Reviews.Title: “the worst 3 stars hotel i've never seen”
Reviews.Author: LorenaGrosso
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a two days workshop event in march, i get a really bad surprise, i'm working in tourist industry and so i'm not discussing about room size or rates., but i want to undersign my full disappointing about : cold welcoming, no assistance (no way to get an adaptor, no way to leave luggages in deposit up to definitively departure, breakfast....no comment at all... less than we gave to Italian Student Group). no water getting out from the bathroom skin. If you need intenet is better for you go to internet point!! a 24h connection you will be required to pay £.12,00!!! Is Central Park Hotel in 2012??? also in Italy we gave for free almost everywhere. Lorena

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Daffodildazy
Reviews.Content: We saw the room advertised on offer for £50 a night which is a bargain for Central London. The room was a small twin, not a lot of room, but was spotlessly clean and had comfortable beds, tea making facilities and limited toiletries in the bathroom. We were about a five minute walk from both Queensway and Bayswater tube stations and the local bus stops. The staff were helpful and friendly and the consierge helped with directions and travel. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the reception staff”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good facilities in a great location. However found the reception staff very unfriendly, unhelpful and generally dismissive. Had an issue with the wifi that cost £12 a day and ultimately didn't work in my room (804). It only took 2 hours or so to finally convince them there was a problem. Would stay again on the condition that they send their front of house staff on a customer service training day! Otherwise there are equally good hotels with better service in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but....”
Reviews.Author: booboobooboo7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located just off Queensway and Hyde Park and the rooms are satisfactory - clean and well appointed. The staff are all helpful and there is a very nice bar area. I thought that the continental breakfast was basic but there was no shortage of croissants, cereals etc. My main gripe is that there was no facility to leave our luggage after we had checked out. This is the first hotel I have stayed in with no concierge's baggage room so we had to pay to store it at Paddington station for the day. If this is not going to be a problem for you then this is a good choice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the existing standards”
Reviews.Author: Sawmanr
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is its best advantage. Close to nice areas like Noting Hill and Hyde Park and very well communicated through metro (stop just right the corner) with other parts of London. The room we got was quite large. Not sure if all the rooms are the same, but ours was situated on the corner of our floor and was very large. Also quite clean though the furniture is really basic. On the downside is the stuff. Do not go there if you are looking for a personal approach. Check in and check out is very cold showing how tired they are of following the procedure with all their guests. As a remark, and already commented by other guests, indeed it is not possible to leave your luggage once you've checkout (something I have done in multiple other hotels in many other cities) They offer you instead to pay 10 GBP extra pounds for a late checkout (2 pm) Quite a sly solution but showing a total lack of customer service approach. Also, as part of this lack of customer service and attention to details, after paying those 10 GBP for the late checkout, when we came back to our room at 13:45, the key didn't open because at reception they had not re programmed it, causing us to go downstairs again, ask for the change and go back to our room to collect our suitcases. Not a huge deal but not the service you expect and you pay for. Still, seeing the other options and prices, it is possible one of the best options for this price (not cheap anyway)

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, broken equipments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend thi hotel at any price. The central heating was providing 30 degres in our room, without possibility to regulate because the thermostat was broken. When we asked the reception, there was no maintenance person available to repare and no other room to exchange. On the following day, we didn't have constant warm water to take a shower (start warm, goes cold for 3 minute, Warm again ...). I should add that my wife is pregnant and we didn't have any special attention to solve our issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Khaledmarei
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room for a week in Cental Park Hotel in November 2010. The single room is small (really small). It contains a small bed, small desk and tiny but clean bathroom. The rooms are heated of course. The hotel lobby is spacious and has a bar and the elevators are new. What's excellent about the hotel is the location, right next to Hyde Park and 3 minutes far from Queensway Tube station, which is 3 stations away from Marble Arch Station. I recommend Central Park Hotel for travellers who don't want to spend a lot of money on accomodation but also looking for a clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money here!”
Reviews.Author: JulianaAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 2011. Most of staff members were very unprofessional, and didn't even know how to 'smile'. They had this common attitude of 'what do you want?' - instead of 'how can I help you?’. The breakfast was dreadful, and they didn't even bother to change our bed sheet for the entire 3 nights. There were no maps or tour info related in the lobby and most of staff members were not willing answer 'any' questions. We ended up paying $30 extra and transferred to another hotel, and that $30 was really worth it. Do not waste your money with this pathetic hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Good Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: JulieD57 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my partner and teenage daughter. Easy walk to/from Queensway or Bayswater Tube Station. Our room had 3 single beds, a bathroom, TV, desk, chair and one nightstand. This was one of only a few affordable hotels that I could find for the 3 of us. It was small but we expected that after reading other reviews. Hotel staff was helpful when we had questions. Internet at hotel was less expensive then the Sheraton we were staying at earlier in the week (using points). Using their computer downstairs was one pound for 30 minutes. Our lock box in the room didn't seem to work and the hotel staff came to assist quickly. Bar in lobby along with a sitting area. Looks like breakfast was available but we found other places for breakfast. We ate at Caffe Roma on Inverness Place (side street between Inverness & Queensway), just a block away. Excellent breakfast and lunch looked good too. Owner VERY nice. Great service. Also ate on Queensway at Ristorante Italiano which was very good for dinner. We would stay here again without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “I do Not reccomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: I was staying in a Hotel in Finsbury Park and decided to move into Central Park Hotel as the price was nearly the same and the area is much better. The result: BIG MISTAKE. For starters the staff in the front desk is plain useless. I am a small woman and I had with me 4 large pieces of luggage as I was staying at a hotel temporarily while I was doing some refurbishments, so I had with me some of my home stuff. I went to ask to the so-called concierge if I could have some help as my luggage was dropped off at the entrance and he just limited to say “you have to check in there, you have to check in” pointing at the reception. I told him I had my luggage at the entrance and that I needed help or at least a trolley to carry it myself but I did not have a positive answer so I had to drag myself all my luggage, holding bags in each arm, dragging 2 suitcases and pushing with my feet a box while the so-called concierge was behind the front desk contemplating the scene. The service at the reception too slowly and cold. Then I had to start dragging again with me my luggage on the way to my room. The room (I had a single one) was tiny; I could barely fit all my stuff in it. Then I needed to make a local phone call so I called the operator who (with very poor English and nearly nagging at me) explained me that I had to pay a £20 deposit if I wanted to make phone calls. So I though, OK not the end of the world, I’ll use my mobile then. But then I needed the internet for an urgent matter and I found out that I had to purchase credit to use it with a minimum rate of £5 an hour!!!! This is outrageous, even the coffee shop in the corner offer free Wi-Fi to their clients and there are around internet cafes where the rate for an hour is from £1. However I ended up paying £12 for 24 hours of internet, just to use the internet for 3 hours as I needed to do something urgent from my own computer. What a rip-off. And breakfast was not complimentary. In this hotel the rates may be cheaper for the area but they try to squeeze every penny from you with their overcharged additional services. Many of them being complimentary services in most hotels. You may save money in the price of the room but you end up paying lots of extra costs, so in the end I think it could have been better had stayed in another hotel, paying a little bit more but avoiding all this annoyance and the sensation of being ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: shish57
Reviews.Content: What can I say. I reviewed one hotel last weekend as a country house - well this would be the servants quarters. Room small and bathroom minuscule - should you have a mishap they would never be able to get in. Couldn't book in unil late - well most of the day gone by then. Fancy a cuppa in the room - forget it - kettle broken. Have a shower but the towel not big enough to wrap around. Fancy another cuppa - no chance as all supplies exhausted having kept finger on button to keep kettle heating. Report kettle broken but not replaced. Report kettle broken yet again and replaced the next day. Go down to breakfast which is chaotic at a sparse continental buffet in a crowded room. Nobody choosing cooked breakfast at an added inflated charge - what a waste of food - I wonder who gets to eat this unappetising mess? But should you ask for lunch maybe even a sandwich at 2.31 no chance. Lunch is at 5.30 he murmured but lunch is at midday I replied. Oh no he said - on break until 5.30. Fortunately the garage round the corner sold snacks or else we would have starved. 2 dry white wines we cry - no dry says he - oh yes says I - what's that there then I point - oh you want that do you -YES. Asked for Rugby to be on in bar in afternoon affirmative from Concierge. Go back to watch Rugby - oh no can't have it on as can't change channels from concierge and barman who doesn't even know what day it is?????? Suddenly notice channels being changed to FOOTBALL for two people who have just walked in. Going from barman to concierges here was nothing doing until threatened with TripAdvisor which worked like magic. Barman inefficient and slow. Concierge quite frankly not telling the truth. Location near Paddington and taxis expensive to get anywhere. Ummmm!!

Reviews.Title: “short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, close to centrum of london, clean and good beds! good service love to stay here again. xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic local hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DavidPlate
Reviews.Content: Really nice front desk staff, clean room with really nice bath and bathroom. I had a lovely room, great TV, excellent heat and air conditioning, Walls are a bit thin but really nice and quiet. Would be happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GinneyRose45
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good value - clean rooms and pleasant desk staff. Good location. Only drawback - you couldn't see the television from one of the beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “An average stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: S G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fit for purpose but not particularly outstanding. The room was small but mostly clean. In an excellent location which made up for the average standard of the hotel. Very close to Bayswater Road and Hyde Park. Within easy reach of the main London attractions.

Reviews.Title: “book this hotel is lush!!”
Reviews.Author: kraigyb
Reviews.Content: great location! two tubes stations minutes apart (queensway/bayswater) so u get access to the best lines! i requested a bath got it! hot water on tap! great reception great everything! great value paid just 57 a night and got a great room .. stayed for 2nights wish i had booked for longer.. we stayed in the craven hotel / crown hyde park it was a dive! i payed 150 for 3nights booked out! in the morning.. got refunded 100 then booked into central park hotel for 110 and wow what a difference this hotel is so lush! i totally recommend it! .. thin walls.. but its not too bad..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sc00mes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while visiting London. The hotel is average, it was a pleasant stay. The location was nice as there were lots of restaurants and local grocery stores nearby as well as two different tube stations in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “40th birthday break”
Reviews.Author: M F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Positives:The staff were welcoming on arrival. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was clean. Good location for what we had planned. Negatives: You have to request a mat for the bath and as we didnt arrive until after 10p.m was told housekeeping were now closed. So weary from travel you had to watch you didnt slip getting in the bath! This was also the case when asking for an iron. Worst by far however was the buzzing coming from the electricity box which was located behind the pillow end of the bed. It was horrendous. We moved the bed to the opposite side until I discovered the next day if I pulled out the card from the lighting the buzzing stopped. However it meant a trip to the loo in darkness as the card wasnt in!! The walls were also really thin and you could hear the neighbours! So take ear plugs if you need quiet to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, lovely carpet!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When you see the reception for the first time, you think you're in for a real treat. It looks very professional and polished. But I can't say the same for the rooms. The bathroom is quite nice. I ordered a room with a bath which I got, it just didn't work and the staff was not able to fix it and the windows didn't close properly. But there was plenty of space and the carpets were really nice and lovely to walk on. It's a good hotel at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Room”
Reviews.Author: Tightrope78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on Wednesday 25 January 2012. I booked a double room through a price comparison site that gave me a very good rate. I discovered that my room was in the basement. The room had no windows and was located on a long corridor with limited lighting. The room was brand new, with all modern amenities and a really nice bathroom. As I was in the basement I couldn’t receive any internet access on my phone. As I was only staying for one night the room wasn’t that bad but had I been staying with someone else for a few nights then I wouldn’t have been pleased with the room.

Reviews.Title: “good price for big room”
Reviews.Author: FeiFairuz
Reviews.Content: I am travelling with a toddler which need space for her to move around. the room is quite big for the price and they are clean. I dunno why there is so many bad review but i like this hotel very much. The staff are helpfull and we get what ever we need. definitely going to stay at this hotel when we visit london in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: BCM72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 mins walk from Queensway tube, we paid just over £200 for 3 nights room only and were very happy with it. We really only used it as a base but the room was a good size, very clean and cleaned fully each day....perfect for a sightseeing trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: This place is by far the worst hotel may wife and I have ever stayed at. The staff is rude and extremely unprofessional. They will nickel and dime you for everything and anything they can. If you ever wanted to experience prison, this is your place.. So disgusted that this place is allowed to be in business.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GeoMo
Reviews.Content: This is not a first class hotel but quite adequate and good value. Staying anywhere in London is expensive but this hotel is in a great area, close to everything you'd want and very reasonable. Clean, adequate rooms. Helpful enough staff. Information in the room could be more helpful - about laundry internet connection - nothing about this in my room. I'd readily recommend it for cheap and cheerful accommodation. If you are coming from Paddington Station with luggage take a taxi (about 6-7 pounds). Far too many stairs at the tube stations!!! No luggage storage at the hotel, which is a nuisance if you are travelling to trhe southern hemisphere and leaving in the evening. Paddington does have a left luggage storage facility which is not too expensive and very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Eugene B
Reviews.Content: The hotel located very close to Hyde Park & Queensway, where you can eat&shop. I got a very spacious room, about 30-36 metres. Great surprise! Everything is quite normal I would say. Just average hotel. The staff is sometimes friendly sometimes not. The breakfast is as you can expect. Good hotel for short break

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don H
Reviews.Content: Like Ryan G, I have spent years (around 40!) staying in hotels all around Europe, Scandinavia and the USA Our children gave us a Theatre Break package for Christmas, part of which was a night at this hotel, and having read some less than complimentary reveiws here, I was dreading our stay there last night. I could not have been more wrong in my expectations. The staff at the desk were helpful and friendly at check-in. Despite the fact that this is a non-smoking hotel, a previous guest had decided to be anti-social and leave our room stinking of his/her tobacco. The front desk had no hesitation in apologising and allocating another room, which was fine. So by now we have seen the lobby, the fifth floor corridor and the third floor corridor, together with a room on each floor. The carpets throughout appeared to be very new, and everywhere was spotless. The rooms are not enormous, but this is not a 4 or 5 star hotel, so what do you expect? There was certainly adequate space to walk around the room, though two people would struggle to be in the bathroom at the same time. The bathroom, the basin, bath and toilet were spotless and shining. The worst hotel I ever stayed in was in New York, where the second bed in our twin room slid out from underneath the other bed, blocking the ony door to the room - the place was a grimy, smelly fire-trap. Breakfast was absolutely fine. My wife had a continental - croissants, bread and toast, with ample supplies of butter and jam/marmalade. Sure, a continental breakfast in a more upmarket hotel would offer ham, fruit etc - but this is a cheaper end hotel in London, so again, what do you expect? I had the English, which was absulutely fine. Better bacon and sausage than I've had in many, more expensive hotels, together with boiled, scrambled or fried egg, beans and hash browns - perfectly acceptable and tasty. The breakfast hostess was the charttiest, friendliest I have ever come across, and the breakfast staff were all friendly and very comptetent. I had occasion to talk to the Concierge, who again was friendly and efficient. I would have no hesitation in staying here again and recommending it to anyone, friend or foe! Beware overly damning reviews thta ay have been planted by a competitor.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay in this horrifying establishment”
Reviews.Author: Ryan G
Reviews.Content: I have spent years travelling and living in the UK and Europe, and I can state with absolute certainty with no tone of exaggeration that this is decisively the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of staying in. The room was the filthiest and the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel; filth which included insects on the walls, a clogged sink with mucus and pubic hair floating inside, urine stains and body hairs on the bed, and a warm mini-fridge which had the distinctive smell of hot garbage. The cleaning staff was also often very rude, profane and audibly obnoxious in the hallway around guests. Another perpetual problem with the hotel was the abhorrent front desk service. Throughout the trip the concierge was present at the desk far less than 50 percent of the time. When we did need the concierge’s assistance, he was not only unhelpful, seemingly unknowledgeable and reluctant to help us, but at times he downright refused to help us. The laughable "continental breakfast” was the worst selection I've ever seen. The breakfast included: buns, croissants and dry cereal, room-temperature milk and juice (there were no cooking appliances available to us and the only available glasses were smaller than a shot glass). The taste and quality of these selections was also sub-par, and the low-quality of the breakfast was one of the most bothersome and consistent issues with the accommodations. The computers in the hotel were also borderline unusable. The internet was relatively expensive, the computer room was often locked and the computers were the most inefficient machines I’ve used in my recent memory. In sum, our experience at this hotel could hardly have been much worse. The room was an unsanitary cesspool, the food, based on the lack of selection and the quality, was a complete disaster and the staff was unprofessional, rude and extremely unhelpful, callous and overall useless. I would greatly implore any individual reading this to STAY AWAY from this terrible place. I cannot emphasize enough how awful of an establishment this hole is. London is an incredible city, but the Central Park Hotel on Queensborough Terrace is invariably one of its darkest and shameful corners.

Reviews.Title: “well connected Central London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plpalani
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well connected and reasonably priced. There are two subway stations nearby. Paddington is not far off. The hotel rooms are compact but well maintained. But one has to avoid the rooms in basement. the staff are quite efficient. The queensway area has got many resturants including fast food chains, Indian, Thai etc Over all not a very bad experience...was there for just one night and checked out at 6 in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not exactly cheap”
Reviews.Author: Ak47d
Reviews.Content: Location is 5 minutes walk from Queensway Tube station. 2 minutes walk from Malaysian Hall for authentic Malaysian cuisines. The hotel itself is presentable but just so. At approx GBP85 per night in winter, you are only looking at a 3 star accommodation at most. The employees are mainly eastern Europeans but I have no complaints about them. The triple-occupant room I booked had 3 single beds with a tiny toilet. The LCD TV was only as big as my PC monitor, I didn't know they made them this small. Room air conditioning wasn't very effective, had to open the window as the heating made the room stuffy despite the thermostat turned all the way DOWN. By opening the window, we were then exposed to vehicle and pedestrians noise from the street below. A higher-floor room could be better in this sense. The hotel is elevator equipped too, which is not a standard facility in hotels of this category where the hotels are essentially in old buildings. Internet access is not free.

Reviews.Title: “Not great. Possible fleas or bugs?”
Reviews.Author: reece h
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay. Unfriendly staff on check in. The only thing that seems to be keeping this hotel in business is its great location. I am writing this two days after my stay and have noticed flea bites down my legs. I'm thinking that this could have well happened during my stay as the mattresses were ancient. comfortable mind you.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!! This hotel is infested with bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Person7
Reviews.Content: A truly horrendous experience. We stayed at central park for two nights. The morning after the first night, we awoke with bed bug bites which gave my partner severe itching and a fever. We informed the hotel manager who moved us to one of their 'executive' rooms. Unfortunately this room was also infested as we awoke the second morning with more bites. When checking out we asked if the hotel were willing to refund us the full payment for our first nights stay which had consequently ruined our trip. They informed us that this would not be happening and we should email the complaints department. The management failed to show any compassion what so ever despite seeing the bites all over my partners arms and shoulders, and hearing how our trip away had been ruined by the situation! We have also had to throw away our clothes in order that we did not bring any bugs home.

Reviews.Title: “In need of improvements”
Reviews.Author: eileen-sara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to the tube station.......the room was clean..... the staff were ok......it's difficult to find good points. The first impression of the room was that it was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in even in London and awfully set out. I had booked a double room expecting a double bed, mattress, duvet. Instead we had two singles pushed in a corner (under the window) with the top duvet being two singles zipped together. Nevertheless a terrible nights sleep for me and my partner with one of us falling down the middle all night. Second main downfall was the bathroom. The sliding door had nothing sliding it at the bottom so it gaped and had gaps between it and the wall! Needless to say if you like your privacy in the bathroom this isnt the place for you (you could see the otherside of the bedroom whilst sat on the loo). Also the loo is squeezed in between the bath and the wall, if you were overweight you would struggle. There was a pointless mini sized bath (may as well have saved space with a shower tray) and the shower settings were all over the place. The room was dated (my nan would have loved it). The hair dryer was very old and you had to keep holding 'on' for it to work. The tea tray was pointless, only one milk carton per cup - two per cup of tea/coffee at least. On the plus side when my partner asked for an iron and ironing board they brought one up straight away. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel but the pub round the corner offers a full english for £5.99 which was good, they had other breakfast items on the menu too if you fancied a change. All in all I would not go back. I would rather pay another 30-40 quid for something more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You'll have what you paid for, no more”
Reviews.Author: Pocahontrash
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in this hotel. Altough the lobby is engaging, the rooms do not live up to that. They are old, a bit dirty and not decorated at all (it's weird to look at empty walls). You can also hear people talking in the adjacent rooms, bring your earplug !. And last but not least, there's no luggage room, we had to carry our bags all day the day we checked out. The good part is, it's a great location, the tube is 100 meters away and you can have a walk in hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not all that 3 stars implies”
Reviews.Author: Oldmotherd
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for a short break and shopping trips, a stone's throw from excellent tube connections. Rooms were clean and comfortable if a little on the small side. However considering the price we were not overly disappointed. Breakfast was not what you might expect from a 3star establishment but was, at best, passable. Biggest problem was with the officious, downright unpleasant reception staff. They really had a problem with the fact that we did not have passports as id when we were travelling from within the UK!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: miliner9113
Reviews.Content: The morning staff should take lessons from the evening staff as far as being polite and helpful. The continental breakfast was the worst that I have ever had. If you want a good breakfast venture outside of the hotel. The rooms were clean which was greatly appreciated. The outside can use a little sprusing up, and they should provide a container for those smokers that seem to litter the front of the hotel with butts. UNFORTUNATELY this hotel acts as a rooming house and not a hotel that you would want to stay in for more than 2 days. This is to be considered a turn-over hotel for those that are traveling to other destinations. I would not recommend this hotel to my clients under any circumstances. Truly sad. The only high point was the attractions and parks.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great, Services is Ok...Rather 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: wh0s0ever
Reviews.Content: I spent a week there (London WTM). This hotel is rather 2 stars than 3. the continental breakfast is very poor, rooms are not spacy at all... Except location which is great (Closer to London Underground, the park and Notting Hill) other amenities are a little wanting. Any way, regarding to Hotel rates in London...this one could be an option...

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Stanleythemanly
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very central to the Bayswater area - just a stones throw from Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. You can tell that this hotel was once upon a time, top class. The rooms are spacious, and the beds are comfortable. TV comes complete with Sky, which is excellent. The tea and coffee station was also very nice. Amenities are very close by in Bayswater, with a massive Tesco to help you save on food. Now to the disadvantages - I did find the staff to be quite abrupt, but nothing unusual for a normal hotel. The other thing I noticed was that the rooms were not very soundproof. We heard next door's 6.00am wake up call as if it was on my bedside table. This being said, I think for the price you cannot go wrong. We flew for 24 hours, and took the tube straight to Central Park, and it was exactly the kind of place that we needed. We travelled in November 2011 as a young couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Epleskrotten
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my 11 year old daughter. The receptionists were a bit "whatever", and for some reason they would not accept my VISA card. That was probably a card machine malfunction since the card worked fine in the shop 15 minutes later. The room was small, but pretty comfortable and clean. The heater was on all the time and the thermostat did not work, so we had to open the window to let in some cooler air. Best part of this hotel is the location! Just a minute walk from a busy shopping street and subway station. Also very close to a well serviced bus stop. For us the location was great as it was right between Westfield and Oxford Street, and the big Hyde park right outside. Terrific location. And good price!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AyrshireJenice
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 4 times now and it's basic but good value. The tube station's round the corner with lots of pubs, a Tesco and a shopping centre in walking distance. The breakfast's basic but enough to keep you going and the rooms are nice but the bathroom's a bit small. All in all, good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: reeco10
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights 5th/6th nov .room was very clean,never bothered paying for breakfast as there are numerous cafes that do full english and a pub 50 yards that also does good grub.only a couple of negatives for me was there was not enough tea/coffee/milk in the room a our double bed was 2 singles zipped together!!!! Oh and the hotel bar could open a bit later too.We went to see alan carr at the o2 and by time we got back we only had a couple of drinks before it closed (1 am ) Overall would recommend to others if for a short stay.hyde park right opposite a 2 tube stations within 200 yards.

Reviews.Title: “"Basic, but clean and excellent value for money"”
Reviews.Author: Weegiewoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with an average room rate of £70 per night. By London's standards that is very cheap and what we got was excellent. Very clean rooms, with housekeeping and fresh towels everyday. King Size bed which was very comfortable. We decided not to pay extra for breakfast in the hotel, and I'm pleased that we didn't. There are numerous cafe's close by where a full English breakfast can be bought for £5. There are 2 tube stations close by, Queen's Way which is on the central line, and Bayswater which is on the circle and district line. Plus Kensington Park is just across the road if you fancy a stroll. All in all, it suited our purpose and more importantly it suited our budget. I would recommend this hotel ,and if the price remains this cheap I would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: bosphorus104
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Small rooms. Chaotic breakfast. Nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, central location, good transport links, clean”
Reviews.Author: travellingtracie
Reviews.Content: Not sure what people expect for £65 ish in central London but for the price paid the room that we got was excellent. Nice large room, comfortable king size bed, small but perfectly functioning bathroom, clean towels daily, TV with freeview, tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that but in that area there are lots of little cafes offering good value breakfasts or there is a small Waitrose nearby where you can buy croissants, danish pastries etc. We were there for a 2 day stay and it was a perfect base for us, really handy bus and tube links, lots of small shops nearby for supplies. The staff that we encountered were very friendly, the cleaners gave us extra coffee and milk on request and the concierge was very helpful in suggesting the best methods of transport to get to various places. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone on a budget visiting the Capital. The value for money is very good. We really couldnt have asked for better for £65.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Børge J
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and was amazed over the bad service. It`s a cheap hotel and therefore I don`t expect much, but I expect a breakfast I don`t have to pay extra for, and a smile from the staff. + Cheap + Ok rooms for the price + Housekeeping was good + Close to central line (subway) and Hyde park. - Very bad breakfast. I guess continental breakfast means bread and jam, because that was all we got. Oh, I must not forget warm milk/juice. - Not free WI-FI, and the one you had to buy was of poor quality - Staff not service minded at all. Called reception for a cab, but thay said that I had to call the consierge (who was standing right beside her). I tried him but he did not pick up the phone. The consierge couldnt help us with restaurant advice or similar either. Rarely a smile, a hello, og goodbye. - No luggagerom for early arrival/late departure, had to go to the railwaystation to store are luggage (£8,50/item, and a long waiting line) - Mould in the bathroom - The TV is way to small for the room, meaning you can`t read the subtitles when laying in the bed. - The temperatur in the shower was all over the place. All in all a bad experience, and I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a book from the cover page: beware no lagguage storage!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBlueBoy
Reviews.Content: Hall entrance and first impression.. In fact when you enter the hotel, with all the nice marble in the entrance door/hallway, concierge, cocktail/sport bar and newly/renovated interior for the downstair breakfast restaurant, you may think: what a good deal soo much for soo little.. and then again, you will be wrong! I recently stayed for 5 nights, so i had the time to get a full picture. I would not tell if you should stay here or not, but i will tell you what to expect.. so you know what you will get for the money you may spend here.. With a little effort from the staff it may get even 3 stars, but no more.. can't possibly go over it. And don't worry, they won't change anytime soon: according to them they are always fully booked.. is not a surprise, the hotel is cheap and the position is good: after all London is always busy.. The room: I got a single room cause i didn't want to break the bank to get a London sized room... The room is dated, the cupboard are the minumum you can get, but there is a nice bag stand integrated with the table area.. that is practical. Another plus is that you get a fridge, and that is handy to store food, drinks.. TV choice is limited (4 channels not even the full freeview, plus 2 arabic mostly you cannot see due to signal noise.. no BBC news, no Cnn, no sky news.. reception also bad from time to time in all the channels). TV is mostly there for decoration really.. The bathroom was smal but clean and relatively new, however, be carefull with the shower pipes: the aren't solid and the older fixing for the top was already replaced once, tough i would not trust the solidity of the work done.. in other terms, to me is not safe!. carefull with the bath tub: there is not mat neither strong handle to grip.. hope you don't fall. If they have to put in place an unsafe bath tub, better do what radisson or Indigo does: place a single or double nice shower and save some space. sink drain doesn't work well either, so you know. There is no way to shut the fan in the bathroom when you use the light: is so noisy you can hear it when the bath door is closed: there is no light at the mirror no electrical shave plugs.. There was no air conditioning (actually there was but wasn't working properly) but fortunately I was able to open the window and for the time of the year the temperature was just fine, the summer would have been unbearable. For the winter there are electrical heaters: i would not leave that on in the night.. first is bad for your lungs, second, i think is not safe in general.. considering how they do things in this hotel.. better get chill than roasted. I always ask a quite room far from passage ways even in 5 star hotels: they forget about it, or they wouldn't care. anyway there was noise from the back of the hotel every night.. i am not sure the locals like to annoy the guests, or are the guests of other ho(s)tels in the area or is the staff that gets crazy at a certain time.. insulation from the other hotel rooms itself is also bad, also you have to consider the other guests, easy ppl or students, would express their joy for the kind of service they are getting from this cheap hotel, and they will share that with you, like it or not.. and i would not argue with drunkies in the night. No breakfast: best choice! The breakfast was not included and i was glad i didn't give any extra pennies to this hotel.. sometimes i am disappointed with 4 stars, i can't imagine what is like having a breakfast here with these first times hoteliers.. The hotel staff and housekeeping. The hotel smeels.. hostel.. i donno how to describe it, as soon as you leave the lift and you enter in your floor you will know what i mean. If you really want to bother and try to sleep after 7am (!!) put a do not disturb sign.. the house keeping will knock to all the doors near you and will make so much noise you will wake up anyway.. if you happen to be in the room, let's say about 11am you will be shout by 'em if you want your room to be cleaned, after 12 the house keeping will ring you and by 1pm they may cut your electricity..(i am not joking: ask to get it restored and they will make fun of it: utterly rudeness!!)...i was working on my computer and phoning some ppl: embarassing to say the least.. internet is overpriced!!! The reception/front desk and checkout process. Upon arrival, and is something i rarely do, i asked for lagguage storage upon checkout: i am glad i asked.. because there isn't. However the naive girl, many young and not trained staff here, said i may ask for a late check out and my leave the room until 3pm. Wrong!!! ain't gonna happen.. trust me!!! Plus she said, anyway Paddington is only 10 minutes walk and you can store your lagguage there.. yes, but walking with a bag makes it 15 or 20 mins dear! Or if you are not fit, you need to get a taxi.. Anyway that is an emergency solution and there is no justifications, after the money you spent to renovate the bar, the entrance or you could use the breakfast room that for the rest of the day is close.. in the Radisson they are more clever, they use all the space they have, even office space, to meet the customer needs. Room in London is pricey.. have some spare room for the breakfast, that is not a restaurant, wanna charge me 5 pound a bag? give some job to do to the concierge.. Mostly this is a badly managed hotel with lots of potential.. They actually deserve the hard way to know how things should work. (I just dumped one of the 2 stars i gave.. sorry but is for the best) I'd NEVER stay in a hotel which does not provide a storage for bags on the check-out day. Naively i phoned them on my check-out day to check about the possibility of a late check out: to my surprise she said that wasn't possible to KNOW over the phone and i had to go down in the reception to agree.. it was too tired and i smeel there was a trick there. I went down at check-out time, i was busy preparing for my departure, had a late night and had to do stuff on my computer, so i took my time.. plus i really wanted to make it a bit harder for them.. the customer service received in the last days was already beyond my (worse) expectations: after queueing a bit, not due to a massive number of ppl, but due to incapacity of the ppl at the desk, so prepare in advance.. (your check out my take half an hour in busy times.. and if your room is not pre paid, even more..) i kindly asked if i could check out later (one hour at least, half was already wasted by queueing): the guy was totally unprepared for this unprecedented quest, so he had to get advise by her supervisor (behind him), embarassed to ask in front of me.. she rudely said: we are fully booked is not possible. and he parrotly repeated.. in that case i said, i'd go up to take my stuff... meanwhile you prepare the bill if any: he would check cause he wouldn't know really.. i figure it out that in half an hour he would have and answer for me, so i could pack with my pace.. Lagguage storage and the concierge desk Honestly i do not see the point to have a concierge in this hostel level so called wanna be posh hotel but i can't really.. there is a porter, poor man.. there were some baggages around so, altough the front desk said no lagguage room, i dare to ask this person.. after all there were bags in the premises and in a little office in the back (and the front desk ain't showed the cleverness of a monkey and perhaps they were wrong i tought). He hopelessly said that they don't have lagguage storage, but intrigued i asked what about temporary storage, unsafe storage (i was really tempted to dump my bag and see what would happen). He said no we don't have any storage room.. perhaps he meant "no room left", oh well i will never know because i will not come back.. I decided that the 2 stars hotels is bloomsbury with shared bathroom offer more for less and in case i really want to save on an hotel that is not in Paddington, the Royal National, previously tried and dumped, immediately becomes a better choice than this. Now you are warned: if i survived the experience so could you, but you will not relax and be ready for some bitter hanger. Is just a cheap hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Won't be winning hotel of the year”
Reviews.Author: paddytrippin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend for two nights. Firstly the staff seem to get really puzzled when you want to check-in. It took circa 15 minutes to check into a pre-booked twin room. Lady staring aimlessly into the computer! Room's are really basic, and really bad reception on the room tv. Pointess having it there if it doesn't work properly. Bathroom and shower again are really basic, and you can hear alot of noise from adjacent rooms. Good location for travelling, and hyde park across the road is a nice benefit, but wouldn't stay here if you planned a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality, uncomfortable and OVER PRICED”
Reviews.Author: lsa66
Reviews.Content: Yes, without exaggeration, room was small, bathroom was tight, bed was shifty, window was thin and flimsy, which will bring all the street noise to your room, heating did not working and you can clearly hear the next room guests conversation. To top it up, they do not hold your luggage when you check out and want to come back later to collect, which will force you to drag it all the way to Paddington Train station, queue for a while and pay £8.50 to hold it for you until you finish your business in few hours. I really wonder, why on earth I would want to return to this poor quality, over priced hotel??

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: cris s
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a package deal & were satisfied with the choice. Great location, walked through Hydes Park (which is beautiful) & walked all the way to Harrods. Close to "tube" stations that will get you anywhere you need to go. The continental breakfast was bland & consisted of very little selection but average. The room was modern & updated (unlike the pictures shown) & clean. Did have a small cooler & safe for convenience. We had a great experience & front desk staff was very prompt and attentive to book tours for us. Great location for price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: buffalojim67
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides reasonable value for money. The rooms are OK but have no drawer storage for folding clothes and few clothes hangers although you can request more. For a London hotel it is pretty good value although the walls are thin and the doors close loudly. The hotel does make a great effort to maintain itself in a nice condition and that helps make it a good choice. The bathrooms have shower/tub combinations, sinks and toilets but they are very small and can be uncomfortable. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and many have been there for many years.

Reviews.Title: “No luggage storage, no air con.”
Reviews.Author: keedwell462
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed thankfully only for one night. I would not recommend this hotel at all. The room was a double but, had my husband been with me, it waould have been very small for the two of us. The bathroom was miniscule but clean. There was no air conditioning but fortunately I was able to open the window and for the time of the year the temperature was just fine, the summer would have been unbearable. I always travel with ear plugs and use them even in 5 star hotels. There was noise from the back of the hotel either from the hotel itself or other premises which backed on to it which I could hear even with the plugs. I was staying at this hotel because my friend from Holland had booked it for 4 nights for herself and her sister and we had arranged to meet up. The continental breakfast was very poor and my friend was very disappointed with it. All she could have, unless she paid some more money,was bread, juice, croissants and jam. She is Dutch and loves cheese and ham for breakfast and usually this is served as part of a continental breakfast and not as an extra. She said that she would not pay extra and would buy some cheese from the Spar shop around the corner and make ker own.!! I was embarrassed that she was having this impression from England and London. I had the English breakfast which was just about passable as it had been under the heated lights for quite some time with a girl giving a stir up from time to time. I know this because I waited about 35 minutes for my friend to come down to breakfast before I took mine so I could see what was going on. My major disappointment was that I booked out early and there was no provision for me to leave my small case until the afternoon. We had planned a trip on the sighseeing bus and river for the morning as it was a beautiful clear, sunny day. I was told, by a very po-faced front of houe manager that I could have the room until 12 but my train was not until late afternoon. I had to take my case with me an d carry it around for six hours. This was a nuisance, getting on and off the sighseeing bus etc. I have NEVER stayed in a hotel which does not provide a storage for bags on the check-out day. I told the front of house manager that I would never stay there again but he said nothing and did not care at all. He SHOULD care because we pay his wages and he needs US more than we need HIM.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: AllroyForPrez
Reviews.Content: Traveling alone and staying here for my two night mini-tour of London, I was quite surprised how close it is to everything. The subway (I'm not going to say 'tube') was just around the corner, and it was easy to get to everything for someone who had never visited the city before. Small room, small bed, and pretty clean for the price - which was right around 80 USD. By no means luxury, but that wasn't on the menu for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: helinoz
Reviews.Content: A quick trip to London as a friend had a spare bed for me! She found this hotel and I have to say I was impressed. Having stayed in dodgy and nice hotels in London..it was nice to find a hotel that was both a good price and a good location and good quality. The decor was a little rough around the edges but the beds were comfy and it had all you needed for a quick stay in London. Close to the Queensway and Bayswater underground stations...pretty much a 2 mins walk this was a great hotel for location. The bathroom was tiny...but this wasnt a huge issue for us as we were only there for one night. Also I walked home from a show on my own and I felt safe enough in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price...”
Reviews.Author: MrSportsnut
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my daughter, whom I accompanied while she settled in for school, we stayed at the Central Park Hotel for 7 nights. Overall, the hotel is a decent (almost good) value for what you pay for. The front staff was helpful (I did not use the concierge), the rooms were clean (but small), and the beds were fairly comfortable. The bar in the hotel is very nice and was never very crowded (if that's what you like). The breakfast that was served will not any awards, but for a quick jump-start, it will suffice. Where the hotel keeps itself from being rated any higher is in its technology. The Internet service was awful. It is managed by a third-party provider and resolving issues is a challenge. After 3 days of suffering, I went around the corner and used the Internet cafe at the hostel. 75 minutes for about $3.75, and its open 24 hours a day. The TV in the room is small, and it never received very many channels. I had to wiggle the coax cable to improve the reception. I was never able to dial an outside line, local or to the US. I had to ask the front desk to connect me on all my calls (I do want to add that the hotel did not charge me for these calls, so while this was a negative on the equipment, it was a plus for the staff). As far as the location - you are close to two tube stations (one a 3 minute walk, the other about 7). There are plenty of places to eat, several currency exchanges, grocery stores, souvenir shops, and even a bookie joint and a casino. If you like to bet on real football (by that, I mean the NFL), then your choices are limited. The casino was small and clean. Mainly roulette, some blackjack, poker, and a few slot machines. If you are a "go with the flow" kind of person, and you like good value, then this hotel will rate a 4 for you (just remember that this is based on what you are paying for). And if it wasn't for the technical glitches, I would have given the place a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: ytanvir
Reviews.Content: Rude staff. The flush in the toilet wasnt working for 2 days and the staff did not do anything about it. The worst hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: cadybugtours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business in London and was not very impressed. The check-in staff was very unhelpful and in fact they acted as though I was bothering them when I had questions. I was told they would hold my luggage for 2 hours while I was at a meeting, only to have another front desk member lambast me for even asking as it is not a service they would ever provide. They told me I could change in their bar restroom, which I did, only to come out 10 minutes later and have them tell me I could take my things up to my room as it was in fact ready. I don't think communication is their forte. I had an additional issue at check-in. My rooms were prepaid from a tour company but the front desk assistant said they were not and refused to check the system or call the company to confirm that they were already paid for. She demanded to charge my credit card and eventually refunded it when it turned out to be their error. However, I had to go ask about the refund, the front desk never alerted me that this had happened; I had to hear it from the tour company. So on the front desk aspect, this place is a horror. The room was sparse, but clean. The bed was very hard but the linens were clean. I saw no evidence of bedbugs as previously reported (I was on the 6th floor) and I checked thoroughly so hopefully they have remediated this problem. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything the person next to you is doing. There was a 1 inch gap between my hall door and the floor so I had to stuff a towel in to block out light and noise from the hallway. Decor and furniture is dated. Location was ok. Not many attractions nearby. A few restaurants were close but I didn't utilize any of them. Transportation is easy from this spot. All in all, I would not stay here again as the headache with the front desk was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay, Comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: adnerb62
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in one of the refurbished rooms on an overnight business trip. The beds were really comfyand the room perfectly clean. Breakfast was normal for this size of hotel with a choice of either cooked or continental. Close to underground stations and a choice of shops. Was fine for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: Vacalover225
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to public transportation and close to many shops. The appearance is decent compared to others in the area. The hotel did not offer any free services ie: internet, food, cable etc. The hotel staff members were just ok not spectacular. The hotel rate was average but considering the lack of amenities it should have been cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lalalucy73
Reviews.Content: Central Park hotel has a great location. It is across the street from Kennsington Park, 2 blocks from Queensway tube and Bayswater tube. There are lots of shops and restaurants right around the block. The check in staff and breakfast staff are not friendly, the man at the concierge desk at night was rude and short in any answer he gave you. Called down to the desk because the room was so hot and they said they would check the air conditioning. After 2 more calls they figured out they don't have air conditioning and sent up a fan. Joe the concierge is very helpful and really the only person there who is interested in helping you. The rooms are small, but clean. There is usually considerable street noise. Breakfast is bread , cereal, juice and coffee. This is the fourth time I have stayed there and I think the location makes up for some of the other things, or heaven forbid I'm getting used to the bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Toscah
Reviews.Content: The Staff and location are great, everything else could use improvement. We did not get a decent shower in the 2 weeks we were there. The pressure and temperature fluctuated so badly we gave up and started having baths instead. We mentioned it several times to the front desk and were assured it would be dealt with. It never was. We had a continental breakfast included in our stay, we chose to eat elsewhere after the first morning. It was sparse and stale. As a matter of fact, everything 'complimentary' seemed to be on the thrifty side, toiletries, towels (no facecloths at all) tea and coffee in room etc..... When we arrived, their system was down and we had to wait ehile they phoned the booking agency to confirm our reservations. After a week and a half, thay still didn't know if we were there when our tour pick up came for us. (They could not find us in the system.) The room doors slam loudly if not closed carefully, so you would hear a lot of loud bangs at all hours. The room we were in (712) did not live up the the photos and description on their website. I would not recommend this hotel to my friends .

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location, but no luggage storage”
Reviews.Author: betteluna
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Central Park Hotel. The room was small, but not miniscule. The room was clean. The twin beds were small, the TV screen was also pretty small. The breakfast was okay--just bread, jam, butter and the coffee terrible. I would say the biggest issue is that they had no luggage storage--there is a hotel around the corner The Bayswater Hotel that offers cheap luggage storage. I have never been to a hotel that didn't offer to store your luggage for you if you arrived before checkout. But all in all, we the stay at the hotel was fine. The location is GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Caralumba
Reviews.Content: Our room (6th floor,street view) was quite nice,large enough for two.The only problem : the bathroom,large enough but with incredible small sink and stationary shower(see photos).The concierge man in the lobby was very documented and helpful. Another minus for the hotel is the quality of breakfast : the continental included bread,butter,three kinds of jam,croissant, 1 type of coffee,1 type of tea,milk,cereals,orange and apple juice,which,from our point of view,was very very poor. (for a 6.50 £ extra you can get in addition a small yoghurt,one slice of cheese + one slice of ham).The location is quite nice and quiet, across the street is Hyde Park, a shopping street nearby( 2 min walk)with lots of restaurants, bus station at the corner of the street (1 min).

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: markmcloughlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night during a business trip because the Ramada close by couldn't accommodate me for my whole trip. When I arrived at the hotel I had what was probably my worst hotel check-in experience ever. Four members of staff behind the counter, three of which weren't busy and tried very hard to ignore me for at least 5 minutes even when I outright demanded service. Finally, the staff member who was busy with another guest was able to attend to me but wouldn't even lift her eyes up from her screen to greet me. The whole thing was farcical. Later on, I came back to the hotel only to realize that I'd stupidly forgotten my room number. To cut a long story short, the slightly more friendly receptionist ended up giving me a key for another guest's room. Walking in on someone in their room is ... uh ... awkward. My room was seriously dated and smelled. I left the window open during the night because of the smell and was seriously disturbed by the racket going on outside. I was actually glad that breakfast wasn't included in my rate - I couldn't wait to check out the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “I totally agree: worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Mirela O
Reviews.Content: If you want to ruin your vacation, staying at the Central Parc Hotel it's the perfect way to do it. First of all, you arrive at th hotel and there isn't anyone to help you with the luggages. Than you have the unpleasant surprise to get to your room. A tiny room. Looking around the room you'll find only a small place to put your clothes. What is supposed to be a cupboard, has not enough place for one person, not to speak for two. But the adventure goes on. Once you go to the bathroom you'll be surprised by the fact that the shower can't be moved The size of the bathroom can no longer surprise you: two people can't get in it at the same time. In order to take a shower you'll have to wait quite some time for the water to get hot. If you would like to have some ventilation that actually works you should have booked a different hotel. And the show goes on ... You try to get over it and get some sleep. It's impossible. Even though you force yourself not to, you hear everything that other people talk in the rooms next to your's. Finnaly you get asleep. You wake up the next day and try to enjoy. But first you go to breakfast. For 6 pounds you have 'continental breakfast". That means some unknown sort of tea, some melted, very salted butter, bread, jam and some dreadfull croissants. If you would like some yoghurt, fruits chease or meat you must pay extra. And all these when you could go nearby and have a delicious breakfast at half the price of the horrific "continental breakfast". You get back to your room and ask for the internet. There is none. You have to pay 5 pounds for 1 hour when nearby you could have internet acces for 1,5 an hour. The hotel provides internet acces at the basement, in a very small room, with no ventilation. Don't imagine that you could use your mobile in that place. You're not in the tube but you're in the same situation; no mobile signal. In case you want to have something printed you'll find yourself send to a hostle nearby. The hotel can't help you. It's time to go. There is no luggage place. But you could pay 70 pounds and keep the room so you could have a place for them, that the hotel should provide, until you leave to the airport. They will recommend to take a "shuttle" for 20 pounds. Big mistake. The shuttle didn't arrive on time. after more than 40 minutes of delay I decided to take a taxi. So, I totally agree with those who complained about the hotel. The only good thing is the location. But it's not worth it. Change the hotel and your vacation will be happier.

Reviews.Title: “What more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: uptowngirl57
Reviews.Content: I almost changed our reservation for five rooms after visiting this site. I am so happy that I didn't. There is nothing wrong with the Central Park. It is not my preferred location (I like Kensington/Knightsbridge) but I have stayed all over the city and there is nothing wrong with Bayswater. The tube was close, the area was safe, and the hotel itself was perfectly acceptable. A nice reception area and bar was great for my family (10 of us, all adults) and ditto for the large breakfast area. Food was on the downside of so-so, but I wasn't there to eat. My 80 year old dad fell outside before we even set foot in the place, and the staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The rooms were small, but who cares? It was clean, convenient, and cheap. I think the adage "You pay for what you get" needs to be remembered by some of the reviewers!

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: joannegalea
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and I must say it was beyond our expectations, bathroom and the room were clean, towels were new and everything spick and span. The only thing that bothered us was that they have no left luggage facility. We had to leave our luggage at Paddington station's left luggage service after we made our check out, this took us round an hour to leave our things there and costs us £8.50 for every luggage. Will definitely return again but if there is the left luggage facility at the hotel it would be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Details make it worse”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia_Art
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 8 days during our trip to London. The hotel made a good first impression as they provide an early check-in for us. The hotel has a very good location: subway & bus stops are very close & there’re beautiful Kensington Gardens just in 2 minute walk. Though the hotel needs some renovation, it’s not very old & our room was ok: not big but quite spacious, accurate & had a mini-fridge. Moreover it was very clean & room service was ok. Breakfast was also not that bad (having read all these comments about miserable breakfast I was a little bit afraid of it): even though there’s not much choice of products, it’s a buffet so you can take whatever you need. If it was just like that, I would definitely give 4 stars to the hotel. But there were some minuses. For me the worst thing was chargeable (and quite expensive) wi-fi. As it was kind of a problem to find a free wi-fi in London it would be very good if we could use it in the hotel. But the real problem was the lack of left baggage room. We had an evening flight and the only option the reception girl could offer is to go and leave our bags on Paddington station (the nearest one). But still it’s quite a good hotel with great location & helpful stuff.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER, dont say I didnt warn you!”
Reviews.Author: hellrazor007
Reviews.Content: this is my review of quite frankly the most useless hotel I have ever encountered. please see my letter to them below and pics attached. read from the top down (incl the farcical response) part 1 Dear Sir/Madam I wish to complain about the treatment received and lack of quality with regard to my stay in the Central Park Hotel from the 11th August for 2 nights. Myself and my partner had arrived in London having been up from 3am british time flying from Palma. Having lugged our bags around we eventually got to the hotel around 3-4pm physically and mentally exhausted. We had requested a double room and arrived to find a small twin room which had any space possible taken up by our bags (which the concierge or anyone else didnt offer to help with). We immediately requested a change of room from 417 I believe and were then switched to 517 (I am not 100% certain of the numbers) which was again miniscule. It began to get even better, as we noticed a power box of some sort right directly behind the bed which I would imagine would surely be a safety hazard. There was also a loose skirting board and bits of carpet not laid properly with threads clearly visible and parts of it partially ripped. Having lifted the duvet it was clear the bed was also not clean judging by the amount of hair in it. I congratulate you for having the first bed I have ever seen in need of a shave! The pictures of the above are attached! We immediately rang reception who promised to get housekeeping to contact us, 15 minutes later having not heard a word we decided to go back to reception and complain. At this stage we were very tired, our bags had been lugged around all day to the point where it felt like an extra body part(s). We told reception we were extremely disappointed with this treatment as we were very tired from travelling and had hoped to rest and wash before meeting friends. We had now changed rooms twice which was a waste of time given the 3rd room was again miniscule (700 and something). Once again no discount/major apology was offered and once more we had to lug our bags again as the staff didnt offer to (concierge was watching sky at this point). This experience has made me extremely angry and frustrated and certainly put a huge downer on my trip to London, things didnt improve as the staff then just ignored us for the rest of the trip even when we made the effort to say hello. Manners dont cost much do they? This included the cleaning staff who didnt even acknowledge us and one member of staff seeing me come out of the lift and turning their back! I began reading some more reviews on my phone which were surprisingly good until I discovered that despite having a concierge there was no facilites to look after our bags until it was time for us to make our way to Gatwick on our check out day. This turned out to be true when we enquired. We again complained that it was the least that could be done given our issue with the rooms and the money we paid (€213 not the dearest price, but it is dear when you consider how much we had to save given our bills, only for I had already been charged through Otel.com I would have left the hotel minutes after arriving). Although I was told facilities are not provided to store bags, I fail to see the purpose of a concierge who from what I can see did absolutely nothing other than watch sky and couldnt even speak english! The reception staff in trying to explain muttered and mumbled a half hearted apology which just made me leave in utter frustration (to lug our bags around once more, to Victoria at a cost of £25). This most defintely the cherry on top of an awful experience which more or less ruined my trip to London. This merely describes my anger and utter frustration with the rooms and the service and staff from the hotel, I am utterly disgusted with the treatment received. I would most defintely not recommend this hotel to anyone! That said I would welcome your comments and a response to this, (an offer of a refund wouldnt go amiss) otherwise I would certainly have no problem in posting this or my views to deter any future visit for anyone across the world on the many websites I use to book hotels (and I am not talking just about tripadvisor or facebook). Given my experience of working in the Government for over a decade I would also certainly not hesitate to contact a local representative or Government Minister to highlight the issues I have raised. I await your response. Yours Sincerely PART 2 Dear Sir, Thank you very much for your email. First you have booked a room in the quiet zone which is in the basement and is a room without windows. But we have allocated a nice standard room which was not up to your expectations and as a courtesy we have moved you to an executive room on the 7thfloor for which the rate is 50% higher than the room you have booked. I refer you to our website which clearly shows that we don’t offer luggage storage facilities and concierge service. And I must attract your attention that we are a 3*** hotel, not a 4**** or a 5***** deluxe. On your next visit to Central Park Hotel please contact me personally and I will be there to welcome you and make sure you get a very nice, executive room at no extra cost. Kind Regards, ********************* Front Office Manager Central Park Hotel 49/67 Queensborough Terrace London W2 3SY PART 3 (which has not been responded to) dear xxxx, Thank you for your response. I am confused as how you came to the conclusion that I booked a room in the basement without windows? The rooms were on the 4th and 5th floors and did have windows. You then suggest that I was moved to the 7th floor into an executive room yet it didnt look at all different from either of the other 2 rooms I declined. Your explanation that "we are a 3*** hotel, not a 4**** or a 5***** deluxe. " is true but I can clearly see that from the site and it is almost as if you are saying that as an explanation for things being so poor. I didnt expect a 5 star hotel and a presidential suite but I certainly expect a lot better from a hotel I pay over 100 Euros a night for. The 2 star travelodge I stayed in near Gatwick airport had a room twice the size for £19, whilst its not exactly the centre of London, it was much better value. I also note that you say you dont provide a concierge service yet there is a picture of it on the main site, as they didnt look after the bags/or even offer any assistance to us, I am not sure what the purpose of it was. Whilst your site does not indeed advertise that it stores luggage I would have assumed that this was a basic service provided as it has been in probably every hotel I have ever stayed in. There is also no reference in your email to explain 1. The attitude of staff. 2. The safety hazard of the second room. 3. The appearance of the room with the carpet. 4. The bed being covered in hair! Again, I would welcome your response. signed xxx

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: lordym
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in the room 403 and bitten by the bugs. Not a cheap hotel and internet is not free ( 1 hour 5 pounds )

Reviews.Title: “Diabolical”
Reviews.Author: Fishfingers5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night during August 2011. It was a shambles. Their systems were down, they checked me into 2 already occupied rooms, lost my paperwork (twice) and refused to let me leave in the morning as their inefficiency led them to believe I had not paid (I had). However - since leaving the hotel I have been plagued by bites. Hundreds of them. That look remarkably like. bed bug bites. I have brought this up with the hotel and received the same shambolic service in terms of response time and quality. Apparently a pest control check has been carried out in the room I slept in, and found nothing. Funny that when you think who's paying their bill.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: alam_vancouver
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel and loved it. The location was very convenient, 2 short blocks to lots of restaurants, 2 underground stations (Queensway and Bayswater). Kensington Park is just across the street. The rooms are small, but sufficient. It was kept very clean, especially the toilets, spotless. The staff was helpful and answered all our questions. The breakfast was a little weak, with rolls, toasts and croissant, but it's free! It saves time in the morning, just to have a light breakfast and we're on our way! We've enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: kareemmahmoud
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location, but the rooms are very small

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to London...en suite restroom...”
Reviews.Author: DebbieandSimon
Reviews.Content: Small but sufficient accommodations. We had a "double" - 2 twin beds. No A/C, but did not need it - luckily! Very convenient to Bayswater and Queensway Tube stations, right off Bayswater Rd. Breakfast was included: hard rolls, toast, croissants, hot water and tea bags, juices, bad coffee, but real butter and jelly! Would not pay again for a breakfast there! Lots of good choices for meals at Inverness Terr., next block over. Also, a Sainsbury (like a small Walmart grocery store here in the US!) with excellent prices for food to "take away" back to the hotel or into packpack! Deb & Si from NC (happy 30th anniversary to us!)

Reviews.Title: “We did not like it and do not recomend it.”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient but that was about it. We did not enjoy our sleep, we felt as if we were pulled towards the middle of the double bed. The full English breakfast was overpriced, with the stale bread and the watery orange juice. But our biggest dissapointment was in the morning we checked out, when we were told that 'the hotel has no luggage storage facilities' and our flight back was at 20:30! Even though we were not planning to go to the airport by train, the only option we were provided by the hotel staff was to go to the nearest train station. We did, but the charge there was 8.50 pounds per item (!) which we turned down, and had to go straight to the airport to spent our day, dispite our plans of a 'final day of relaxing and shopping in London'.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerTads
Reviews.Content: Room was dated, but clean. Mattresses were quite saggy and uncomfortable. We had triple room which meant 3 twin beds. No noticeable control over A/C. Hotel common areas are fine and kept up. Continental Breakfast was passable. Front desk staff cheery but not that helpful. Hotel is on a side street off of noisy Bayswater road and is just north of Hyde Park near Kensington Palace. 5 min walk to Queensway Tube Stop and various shops/eateries/coffee houses.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Don_K_P
Reviews.Content: My family and I has just spent 4 nights in Central Park Hotel, London and we will NOT return. Staff is unfriendly, the included continental breakfast is very plain at best, no a/c in the room, but worst for us was that the hotel does not provide the possibility to leave your luggage in the hotel for a few hours after checkout. Hotel staff says "It is for security reasons" which is nonsense. In all my years of travelling I haven´t been in a single hotel not offering this simple but important service. It meant we either had to traverse the city to a major train station having luggage storage or carrying all our stuff with us until departure. This really was a major inconvenience to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Hotell.no traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel except for two things: very basic breakfast (continental) and a bit noisy aircondition in the room. Great location for tube and bus. Several restaurants nearby. Still - a very quite location. Will stay here for future visits to London.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: nini39
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel with some friends and liked very much. It is good if you intend to visit the city and stay few time at the hotel, only to rest! Nice staff. Room spacious for a city hotel. It is near everything, 5 minutes from Metro and from Central Park.A lot of restaurants near by, not expensive. I will be back when I return to LOndon. I recomend for the price you pay! Breakfast is not included, costs 5 pounds and it is poor. Better to take it out in a pub nearby. there are many.

Reviews.Title: “Our London abode during our stopover”
Reviews.Author: Pazdera
