Reviews.Content: Our repeat-stay Jun 1 to 5, 2011 was as pleasant as the previous visit in 2005 This medium-sized (around 200 rooms-not sure) hotel is home for transient guests from everywhere, and of all ages; located within 2 blocks of 2 (two) Tube- stations - effortlessly roll your luggage to the hotel; clean and comfortable room with daily maid-service, breakfast available in the sous-terrain at modest charge, buffet-style, pubs and restaurants nearby - it's all one really wants on a stopover.Kensington Park (remember Princess Diana!), and Hyde Park (up the soapbox you go!), all in walking distance. To get around, use that ingenious medium, the RF-Oyster Card, that you surely obtained on Heathrow-arrival at the Metro-office; plunk down GBP 25.00 and, if a balance is left when you depart again, cash it in right there. It's good forever and on all tube-lines and buses. These will swiftly take you to shopping, sightseeing and performances. The "London Eye" wheel on the Thames, shows a forbiddingly long line, but it moves very fast and you are on in 20 minutes - converted about CAD 50.00/a pairof adults Londoners are a likeable bunch and helpful with information, as needed. A most enjoyable re-visit of this great city!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: RSWRIG
Reviews.Content: The Central Park Hotel is one of the choices you can select if you are using GoToday.com to book your vacation. Since this is what I did, I will focus my review on how this worked out for me. The hotel itself is located on a fairly unassuming street directly across from Hyde Park. The are several other hotels on the block but they look more like apartment complexes than hotels. Central Park is the only one that actually looks like a hotel. The hotel itself is located withing an easy five minute walk (two blocks over) of the Queensway and Bayswater station. This gives you easy access to the Central tube line and the Circle/District line. On the same block as the tube stations are supermarkets, restaurants, banks (including Pizza Hut, Burger King and McDonalds) and a in-door shopping center. There are also lots of tourist shops that sell t-shirts and other junk. When you go here BE CAREFUL! There are lots of people so I would not be worried about being mugged but there is also an unsavory element which will become immediately apparent. My wife had her pocketbook stolen while we were there so please do not underestimate the level of caution you should take. We did and paid for it (quite literally). Back to the Hotel. The front desk is open 24 hours and the people are friendly and helpful. We needed to documents faxed to us from the US due to the theft and they always found their way to our room. The room itself is small but comfortable. There is a small LCD TV which gets a surprising amount of channels as well as a desk and small couch. The bedroom is in a separate room. The bathroom was interesting. The shower was fine but it was very high off the ground. At 5'3, I need to be cautious when getting in/out. The toilet seat was actually broken. It still functioned (well to the extent any cheap toilet with little to no water pressure can function) but it was disappointing. There were plenty of outlets throughout the room so we were able to keep our devices charged. The in-room WiFi worked but I would not try to do anything more than email or basic web browsing. The room does not have air conditioning. This is not a problem in April but could be in the summer. While leaving the windows open may seem to be a good idea, the street itself is noisy. One nice feature was the fridge. With the close proximity of a supermarket and the use of a fridge, we were able to enjoy some early morning and late night snacks at a reasonable cost. Breakfast, depending on what you signed up for, can be very meager. We had the continental breakfast which was really just rolls & cereal with bread and butter. I will have to admit that the rolls were pretty good. They also offer an upgrade to pre-made eggs and ham but for the price they are asking, you can go less than a block away and get three times the selection of food and better quality. Your call really. There is room service but we did not try it. The Hotel also has a bar in the front lobby but we never visited it. Really the most important thing to me was that when we got there and when we checked out, things moved quickly and without incident. They accepted the vouchers from Go-Today and did not try to hit me up with any additional fees. One other note... they also did a good job in cleaning the rooms from day to day. We always had fresh towels. In summary, if you are on a budget, do not care about AC and want a place that gives you easy access to public transportation, you really can't go wrong with this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Does not even provide left luggage service”
Reviews.Author: Evabluebell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two night, last minute booking. Small, damp smelly room. No air con or air flow. Unhelpful staff. We had a 2100 flight out of London. Unfortunately hotel did not even provide a left luggage service for the day on checkout. expensive for what you get. Would not stay here again. Location however is good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: RayHC
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great from the outside and the entrance supports that impression. Then you get to the room... Ours was small, but you expect that at old hotels in London. What we didn't expect was the concave beds, the safe that we couldn't get to work, the telephone that didn't work (they fixed it), the tv that worked after we fiddled with the cable and the shower... The shower was quite something - the shower head came some two feet out of the wall (no-one knows why) and the glass shower wall came some 2 and a half feet out. In consequence, every time you took a shower you flooded (and I do mean flooded) the bathroom. The carpet was so dirty that we always walked around in our shoes (someone had also managed to burn the mark of an iron on our carpet). I went downstairs to ask reception if they had a secure area to keep valuables such as laptops and other things (since the safe didn't work). The lady looked at me like she'd never heard of such an idea. The location was noisy because of all the partying that was going on and because there is no air conditioning, you had to leave the windows open. I don't blame the hotel for that as it is a function of the location. This hotel relies on having a good location and charging accordingly but doesn't deliver. It is probably the worst hotel that I can remember staying at and is certainly the worst by a long margin on a value for money basis.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: deadeggs
Reviews.Content: Spent almost 2 hours on the net making a last minute booking in central/south west London. Lots of problems getting something with good reviews and at an affordable price. The Central Park had a lot of bad reviews but the location and price met my needs. I took the risk. I took my camera with me to take photos of the bad points as I'm sick and tired of very poor, dirty and overpriced hotels in London. On arrival I was met by an impressive, modern foyer, clean, spacious and with a big check-in desk. I told the receptionist to wait a minute so that I could check my booking as I thought I was in the wrong hotel. You feel as if you have walked into a 4 or 5 star hotel. No, this is where I had booked. So my fears based on the negative reports started to fade away. Three modern lifts to service the upper floors. My room (a single) was more than I had expected. Plenty of space (to European standards), big window, airconditioning, excellent bathroom, nothing to complain about. Breakfast next morning was generous and excellent value for what I got. Other reviewers have said, that sound proofing between rooms is a problem. I think this could be true but I was lucky enough to have good people beside me who didn't party on all night. The location of the hotel is excellent. Two minutes away from two tube lines. Several bus lines pass nearby. Just across the road from Kensington and Hyde parks. Possible to walk to the West End. I will not hesitate to return to this hotel when next in London. For the price I paid, at last, I think I have found a good hotel in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Martha027
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was good value for what we paid. Found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The hotel was close to the tube and bus stop. There were a good few shops, restaurants and pubs in the area. Room was spotless, bed was comfy and the room was cleaned each day. The only bad thing I can say is that the room was really warm and there was no air con. Ask for a room to the back of the hotel, the front can be very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennofish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and very accessible for transport. However, our room faced the road and it was very noisy (people partying at all hours in the street) No aircon so we had to have the window open. Some very badly behaved children, that seemed to be living at the hotel, spoilt the stay. The internet is very expensive. Breakfast ordinary. Rooms clean and serviced daily.

Reviews.Title: “One reason to to not to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Cabraperson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap and cheerful and you get what you pay for. We would return but for one thing. There are no left luggage facilities. Check out is the usual 12 noon but our plane was not leaving until 8.30pm. We expected like most hotels of this size and location that we could leave our bags but they have no facilities for this. So we had to make an extra trip across London to Liverpool St station and pay €34 to leave 4 bags for a few hours there in the Left Luggage. London is expensive enough and this was ridiculous. Woman in the bar was really nice however we wont be back for this one reason.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelB21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nites in June. Was quite anxious before arrival after reading some of the reviews here., but was very pleaantly suprised. The location is ideal, only a short walk to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations. Right beside Kensington Gardens/ Hyde Park. Lots of nice bars, cafes and restaurants very nearby. The room itself was a little small but was spotlessly clean. The staff were pleasant and helpful. I would stay in this hotel again, and would recommend it for a short break in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Jaxtraveler57
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel. Rooms were a little small, but as expected for any other European hotel rooms. The front office staff were helpful, although, some had limited English (very ironic!). The breakfast was decent, nothing really special. This hotel is very close to Hayde Park and the Kensington Palace. It is also a few minutes away from the underground station by Queensway and Bayswater. Overall, it is a decent hotel to stay for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: kson123
Reviews.Content: Our room faced the main street. There was constant noise - traffic, trucks, people talking. It reached a peak around 4 a.m. with banging, rolling, thudding, scraping noises. I don't know if they were emptying trash or delivering supplies. The noise was lessened (but not eliminated) by closing the window... However, if there was air conditioning, it didn't work. Other drawbacks: *The shower was in the bath-tub. The edge was high up, and the floor was slippery. It was difficult to get in and out of, and no grab bars. *We had a room with single beds. They were short and narrow but otherwise not too bad. *Breakfast buffet consisted of cold cereal, juice, and bread rolls, coffee and tea. Good points: *Located near Kensington Gardens within walking distance from three museums, the Royal Albert Hall, Kensington Palace and other attractions *Two tube stations nearby: Bayswater and Queensway *Very multicultural diverse with choices of many types of restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawagner11
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel through a tour package. The reception area is nice, and the staff was polite. Our twin room was small but clean. The bathroom had recently been redone and was very clean. There was really only 1 useable outlet in the room for our accessories, which made it a little difficult to recharge things and run electricals. We faced the main street with a loose window latch which made it very loud, and a little hard to sleep. I recommend asking for a room that does not face the street. Skip the continental breakfast if you can. Dry rolls, and cereal leave alot to be desired. But .... this hotel is just down the street from beautiful Kensington Park, and local pubs. There is a shopping mall nearby, and lots of restaurants. It is a short walk from public transportation which can take you anywhere in London. We were very happy with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated and very good relation quality-price”
Reviews.Author: MiMapaMundi
Reviews.Content: I'd been there 3 times and I will come back! Very well situated in front of Hyde Park. Very good price and very clear.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just fine! Clean, FAB location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AmyD429
Reviews.Content: You know, I read the TripAdvisor reviews before I left for my pre-paid stay here and just about freaked out. The way people were talking you'd think this hotel was a step below an abandoned mattress under a bridge. No, it's not the Ritz, but here's what it IS; a great value a superb location (10 min walk to Notting Hill/Portobello Road - also right next to 2 tube stops) clean (NO bedbugs, believe me, I looked) safe Some other pluses - fridge in the room was very convenient, the shower was wonderful with NO hot water issues. A legit minus - the walls are thin, I could hear my (very loud) neighbor talking on her(speaker)phone. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again, for the money I defy you to show me better in one of the world's most expensive cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and an ideal location!!”
Reviews.Author: l0vesl0nd0n
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive about staying here based on previous reviews. However, when we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel and wondered about the negative reviews. Yes, the rooms are small, but we didn't travel to London to stay in our room. We purposely booked a twin room knowing that beds and rooms in London are usually small. But the rooms were very clean and quiet and well serviced. There's a fridge in the room to keep water, juice, whatever. The staff (except for the breakfast room lady) were helpful and pleasant. If you don't want the toast or cereal, go to one of the many cafes around the corner and grab a cheap breakfast, or grab a pastry from the Tesco. Best of all, was the location -- close to two tube stations and wonderful "village" along the Queensway where you can find cafes, shops and restaurants, and maybe a pub or two;) And the neighbourhood is very very safe. Tip: there are no dressers to unpack your clothes, so you will be living out of your suitcase. Pack wisely and keep yourself organized.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give the hotel a 7/10 overall.”
Reviews.Author: andreiru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the northwest of hyde park - towards Notting Hill. Good value for money. Clean. Our first room was cramped - really tiny, so for our second, third and fourth nights we've asked for a much larger room, which we were gracefully given. Staff are generally pleasant and helpful. On the down side, there is a bit of a chaos in the dining room and rules are confusing and are unnecessary cumbersome. The lady there (Alice) is rude and is evidently in the wrong job. The Japanese man from the concierge desk was particularly helpful and so were the reception staff. I'd give the hotel a 7/10 overall. And a good value for your money (we got a deal, I think).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Traveltalkcentral
Reviews.Content: As a budget traveler I am used to staying at 2 star hotels. This hotel was no different, it wasn't perfect, they never are. It didn't have air conditioning but I didn't think that would be a problem since I was there in the spring. Even when it wasn't hot outside it was hot hot hot in my room. The walls were thin, I could hear my neighbors talking. I almost checked out of the hotel due to this, but luckily housekeeping had a fan, it made all the difference. The hot water is a problem. You can take a 3 minute shower before the water gets cold. If you wait, you will get warm water again, but that was a pain. I I had a single room, it was small, but comfortable and clean. I have no complaints about that. The staff could have been a little nicer, they weren't really rude, just indifferent. The location is ideal, you have 2 tube stations right around the corner. You are a block away from Queensway street, lots of little restaurants, shops, pubs, etc... Things opened early and closed late. This hotel is located in Bayswater which is known to cater to the budget traveler. I am a female and I was traveling alone, I never once felt unsafe. Remember you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Low price - low quality”
Reviews.Author: zeudo
Reviews.Content: Were given a room for disabled persons in the basement. A really unsatisfying room. Funny enough, the space in the room was cramped, and the toilet facilities wasen't satisfying. We asked for another room without success. The hotel is located a short walk to the tubestation at Queensway. Don't eat the breakfast at the hotel - choose instead one of the nearby pubs.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms , lazy & rude staff , unsafe neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: dhruvraj
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks good from outside and the reception is spacious . But they messed up my reservation. They apparently charge the credit card 48 hrs before the date of check in . It seems they tried but could not charge my credit card for some technical reasons . Hence they cancelled my bookings without informing or asking alternate credit card no. I got a rude shock when I checked in and had to rebook at much higher rates . The staff was rude , inefficient , lazy . Room was small tv reception quality was bad . Neighbourhood was unsafe . A guest's wallet was picked just outside the entrance of the hotel and the staff did not do anything to help the guest .

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: colgan1999
Reviews.Content: Well for a start, the food was horrible. The rooms where tiny, my friend complained about a gigantic black mark in the bath so she couldn't shower herself for the whole trip. The continental breakfast was horrible, the toast was either too hard or too soggy and the milk smelt awful. One day when I was eating my "breakfast", I saw a cockroach climbing across the ceiling and even when everyone in the dining room was pointing and staring, and at a point a little girl screamed, the breakfast staff done nothing! I would never stay here ever again. :(

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY BATHROOM, CARELESS CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: KatieBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Central Park Hotel at the end of April when I covered the Royal Wedding. the first time I took a shower there, the water wouldn't go down and eventually, reached up to my shins. After complaining for 3 days in a row to different employees, PLUMBING WAS STILL NOT FIXED and I decided to write this review. The room was, which was somewhat expected but the BATHROOM WAS SO SMALL THERE WAS NO PLACE FOR YOUR TOWELS OTHER THAN ON TOP OF TOILET and to get into the bathroom, you had to open the bathroom door, squeeze in until you're practically in the tub, then shut the door and only then you can use the toilet! The CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS NON-EXISTENT. I had an envelope left for me with documents and money that they claimed was never left there (eventually found after 2 days of arguments) and repeated complaints about the bathroom were ignored. Also, when I asked to send a fax, they said they can only do it after 9 am, I went to a nearby Hilton and got it done in no time. DON'T STAY AT THE CENTRAL PARK HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “un professional”
Reviews.Author: tedster074
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 days. Despite asking for a double, they tried to pawn off a twin on us. The bath is slippery, and the ventilation is bad. The breakfast is bread and cereal. The concierge is grumpy but if you provide him with a map or a telephone number he will direct you or call. Prices for internet and telephone use are simply designed to drive one away from asking for the service. However, the unforgiveable is that my son called three times from Canada and sent an email with urgent information and none of this was relayed to me. The hotel is clean and the location and price is excellent. There is a mini fridge, so buy your own breakfast and bring it down in the a.m.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: poohbearRowlett
Reviews.Content: My room wasquite small, but I've found that to be typical of hotels in Europe; it was very clean, which was important to me; location is good, right across from Kensington Gardens and very short walk to the Tube; continental breakfast offered several choices of breads, cereals and juice, plus coffee or tea... what could be reasonably expected from the term "Continental Breakfast".... wish they had a room to hold luggage, though... check-out is at noon, but my flight wasn't until evening... desk clerk told me that facilities were available at Victoria Station, which was helpful information, but it costs 8 pounds per bag... this was my second stay, and I would stay here again next time I'm in London...

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel186600
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were put in a single room. I had paid for a twin room. When I requested what I had paid for the incredibly rude hotel receptionist whom it has to be said did not speak English very well, pointed me towards the duty manager. This gentleman? called Abdul was most rude. He did not listen to what we were trying to explain to him and got out an envelope and told us to write a letter to the manager. The room we had to stay in on our first night was appalling. It could not fit two people comfortably as it was a basic single room . I would really advise anybody thinking about staying here to reconsider as there are hotels in London that do provide fantastic customer service. This is not one of them

Reviews.Title: “londoner”
Reviews.Author: londoner171
Reviews.Content: Very bad hotel, rude staff, very small rooms. no ironing facility available in the rooms, no porter. very expensive, bad breakfast, the worst management staff ever, noisy (spent all night listening to baby crying) plus drunk people were shouting all night, very very very expensive internet connection

Reviews.Title: “grand hotel from the entrance, swishly suited personnel..huge prospects...mmm”
Reviews.Author: darrencred
Reviews.Content: on the plus side: two card keys?..took me a while to work that one out the three lifts worked all of the five days and so quick, too; the personnel were quick when advised of a problem; there was a bath and a shower; although confusing, i liked the lighting in the rooms...and the fact that there was a safe in the room.... the sweet foreign girl at reception, who did her best to accommodate me at least you can find your way home... negatives: the window was left open, so the room was cold on the first cleaning morning... really bad was when i put the "do not disturb" on the outside of the door on my last day...to return at 11.20am (whereupon, paul daniels must have been at work)...the "do not disturb" had magically found its way into my room....although i only did it as a "what would happen if"...i was totally appalled. the time of departure wasnt for another 40 minutes. also..for the price, they were tight on the teabags/coffee/milk/coathangers/soap. all in all: pleasant welcome; easy to find; the "central park" part of the name draws in foreigners (albeit into a false sense of security), it is wonderful to look at from the outside...nice welcome,....just a bolt down to earth when the keycard goes in. breakfast should have been included in the price the engineer came out twice to sort the safe out...and still wouldn't have it that the pin was faulty..it worked there and then, but he just said "oh, it's working"...but it was sticking. the tv was angled so that u could only watch it from the chair rather than the bed. although it was nice to have a bath,..i'm not used to one that big.. nurses corners left a lot to be desired... i was always told that if a towel is for washing, put it in the shower and if not, hang it...hmmm normally the lavatory paper is turned too... have been used to digital only (although not satellite), the reception for the television was very poor. (partly a switchover thing, but the worst i've seen in 6 hotels). the lack of

Reviews.Title: “very bad service attitude”
Reviews.Author: oshio929
Reviews.Content: The receptionists are very badly educated; the hair dryer was broken and i called them, they just told me "there is nothing i can do right now, cuz it's weekend!" then i walked passed by the reception next day (sunday), a man complained about the broken bulbs in the room, the receptionist said "we will send someone to fix it immediately" (that was 2am) I think the service is as horrible as the breakfast, also the room is very very old and ugly This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in the world, it ruined my trip in London, will never recommend anyone to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've ever sayed”
Reviews.Author: Karyna_11
Reviews.Content: I am not from the kind of customers who are cavilling much at various minor things, however when i saw someboies hair in my "just cleaned" bed.... I still have shivers when i recall that. Somebodies black long hair was all over my bed. Also some dirt was on the carpet.. I was afraid to put a feet on it. i was always finding crumbs there.. I was shocked.. I will never recommend anyone to stay there! euh... ...oh yes.. location was nice... :))))

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is ok”
Reviews.Author: jimmyjimmy12
Reviews.Content: was apprehensive about staying here after reviews of unhelpful staff, bedbugs etc. I have to say that it was fine, rooms a bit on the small side but who goes to London to stay in their room? Shower was fine, got a couple of reasonable nights sleep, hotel close to 2 tube stations (on separate lines), and most important of all NO BEDBUGS! Some of the decor in the rooms could do with a bit of work but that's ok. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “London break”
Reviews.Author: mayleys
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel 2:45pm for 3:00pm check in, 3 receptionists behind desk, 2 chatting to each other 3rd messing about with card machine. Checked in and given our keycard, room 802 on ground floor, found room, maid still cleaning told to come back in 10 mins, went back in 20 mins room still not ready, eventually allowed into room at 3:30pm. Slightly odd layout, it appears the bed has been turned round (meaning I had to either clamber over my husband or climb in from the bottom) as both overhead reading lights were on the right hand side of the bed which wasn't a problem as too dim to read anyway. Although the room was small it was fine for a few nights with air con, tea and coffee, and a fridge which was very useful. The bathroom wasn't as small as I was expecting and was clean and modern with lovely underfloor heating. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment. Location is really good just 3/5 mins walk from bus stop and tube so getting in to West End easy. Overall a good standard hotel for what we paid, would stay again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Brunomello
Reviews.Content: The receptionists are very badly educated; the heater was broken (very hot) and the manager ordered to open the window; the bar served warm beer; the breakfast was beyond horrible is expensive and the woman who organized the breakfast was very rude and stupid. Had a day that two of the three elevators were broken, and several guests had to climb stairs with luggage. when we arrived at the hotel at night he had no towels and bath mat, and we ask the receptionist she said the maid had already gone and I could only get in the morning, I had to come down and speak with the manager and oh yes he has provided. the location of the hotel is very good, near the park and to restaurants and shopping, but the services of the hotels are terrible, not to host it only it for free. Me and my mom we stayed there in March 2011 and not recommended

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room... don't bother with breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Koren_E_S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was tacked on as a freebie with theatre tickets, so I cant comment on the value - though looking at the room rates on the net, it is average for London! The hotel itself is pleasant, the reception staff and house keeping staff were really friendly and helpful - could not fault them at all. What really lets this hotel down in the breakfast! The staff were on the rude side... a couple of them were having a good old moan in the corner! Breakfast (in the loosest sense of the word) is split into 3 categories - full english, continential - including ham and cheese and basic continential (no ham and cheese). We we 'grunted' to our allocated area of breakfast! All 3 categories of breakfast looked fairly poor... the full english did not look overly appealing, the continential's were poor - 'stale and cold' croissants and some stale and not nice looking bread rolls. I did make a break for the toast machine that was not located in our breakfast area!!!! The juice bar - basically all water, just press the watter button, it will be more refreshing! Luckily - Paddington Train Station does a very nice breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst "hotel" I have ever had the misfortune of staying in!!!”
Reviews.Author: StacyJ2011
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Whilst the reception area is deceptively nice, the rest of the hotel certainly is not. The staff were terribly rude, there was no loo paper when we arrived in the room, the bed had BED BUGS and hairs from the previous occupant, and the walls and windows were moldy. Oh, and the walls were so thin that I could hear every word, cough, and snore of my neighbours. I can only imagine that the good reviews are written by hotel staff. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Golle
Reviews.Content: I travel to London at least twice a year and try to book at hotels I know and have stayed at before. I wasn´t able to do that on this trip, so I tried Central Park Hotel. I started out calling them, asking for a room rate. I wanted a single room, no need for a king size bed or anything and the rate was very good. It was actually a couple £´s cheaper than if I used Hotels.com. The location is fantastic. There are probbaly a hundred hotel around Hyde Park, many of them dodgy at best. Tis one is two minutes from Queenswat tube and the vibrant area of Bayswater. Notting Hill is ten minutes away by foot, and Oxford Street half an hour the opposite direction. What more do you need? Reception was always there, the staff extremely helpful. Manager and consierge went out ot their way to fix a problem I encountered. The hotel is modern, the lift too, but the humming of the lift going up and down can be heard, even six rooms away. Bring ear-plugs. They were so sorry and even offered me another room, but it turned out I slept fine. With ear-plugs. The bathroom were alsmost brand new, the bath tub itself were so clean it squeeked, slippery when wet though, so be careful stepping out. Everything worked, and I got a room on the 6th floor, oerlooking the roofs of the city. Splendid. Rooms are small, there is a bed, a desk and chair and that´s it. If you´re in London for fun and to see the city, not to stay at the hotel, this is the place for you. Breakfast is rubbish, though. The £5 option is like this: Ham which is as dry as the desert, bread even worse, butter is grainy and stale, juice is lukewarm and coffe machine splurts coffee all over your hand. For that price you can find something better just around the corner. But in total a very positive experience, and I will absolutely come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, appalling breakfast”
Reviews.Author: potter75_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night recently. The location is good and the reception and concierge staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and adequate for one night. Continental breakfast was appalling, basically consisting of just cereal and bread! Fruit juice dispenser was out of order with no notice to say so and people kept coming up to try and use it over and over again. Never before have I been required to pay extra (£3.50 per head) to have fruit and yoghurt included as part of a continental breakfast. Staff in this area were useless, preferring to chat to themselves rather than give any sort of service to paying guests - and then trying to clean tables way before guests had finished breakfast. Upon checking out we witnessed an almighty row between chambermaids in the corridor, who certainly didn't mind guests seeing and hearing such behaviour. I think this hotel can be summed up by the fact that, on returning home, I emailed them, outlining pretty much as above and inviting them to respond and to date have received nothing in return, not even an acknowledgement of my email. Says it all really. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nor123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Central Park Hotel in october 2010 and in august 2008. Both times we had a nice stay. The first time the room was big for a doble, the second time small. At both stays the room was clean and the continental breakfast was what to be expected. I can't stop thinking that some of these reviews are not ment for Central Park Hotel in Queensborough Terrace. Don't think there are any rooms the basement..... The location is great with the park nearby and with lots of restaurant in Queensway. For our next trip to London we will consider to stay at this hotel again. The price i nice too....

Reviews.Title: “Flea/bed bug ridden Hotel with rude staff-I'd never go back”
Reviews.Author: superted75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a theatre break package. On arrival we checked in at a very nice looking reception.We then went up to our room which was dark,smelly (damp and mould) still dirty and just really grotty. We decided not to make a fuss and to just get on with it. The bathroom was very small with mould growing around the shower and on the shower curtain. I then found some toenail clippings on the bathroom floor which was lovely! The bed was two single beds pushed together which was fine but down the centre of the duvet was a really hard itchy patch which when we looked inside the cover it was velcro, basically two duverts were velcro together! The bed linen has little spots of blood on it and had holes in it which was patched up with another patch of fabric.I found out what the blood spots were the next morning as i woke up with flea/bed bug bites on serveral places on my body! One morning our room plunged into darkness, luckily we found a maid who pulled out the bed and flicked a trip switch and then walked out again without muttering a word.We later found out this happens alot. Breakfast was a joke, we were toild we have a free continental breakfast.When we went to breakfast we found out that continental means stale bread, cerial,jam,tea,cofee and apparently orange juice ( I would say after trying it that it is definatley not orange juice). We ordered a iron during our stay from reception, it was brought up 10 minutes later, when my partner opened the door the maid was facing the other direction and just shoved the iron and ironing board at him and then walked away,again in silence. On the last day we were due to check out at 12, at 11:30 we went back to the room to get or bags and the key card had been deactivated,we asked a maid why and she just said very rudely 'Go down stairs and ask' we then asked her why it had happened and she said the same thing another 3 times.Reception swiped our card and said it was fixed without an apology.When we got back to the room the key still didnt work and this time we were confronted by the manager of housekeeping who wasnt that happy that we had questioned the maid.After serveral minutes of us teling her we were not asking the maid to unlock our door just purely why we were locked out, she let us into our room with a master key and went. This hotel had one thing going for it and thats its location but i would never ever choose to go back to this place.There customer service is one of the worst i have ever encountered and the place is old and disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel. You will ruin your vacation”
Reviews.Author: SweeMocha
Reviews.Content: Dirty. Old. Smelly. Simply a disgusting hotel. Do not stay here. If you're trying to save some money, maybe you should think twice, and pay a little more to upgrade your hotel. Your vacation will be ruined for sure. We paid $799 through Gate 1 Travel - vacationing in Paris (Timhotel Berthier XVII) and in London staying at Central Park Hotel. Timhotel Berthier was disappointing, but Central Park London is simply unforgivable. The rooms, the hallways smell like mold. Breakfast was the worst! We couldn't wait to go on our tour (The Original Tour Bus and Thames Cruise) every morning so we could get out of the hotel, and stayed out dining, shopping until very late so we can stay as little as we had to inside this hotel. Extremely disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Phew!! Got away soon!”
Reviews.Author: Ayyagaris
Reviews.Content: The hotel was my first stay in London and I was looking forward to good sleep after long flight.Got to room and was taken back. Small with absolutely no privacy to talk inside room because I could hear other guests in adjoining rooms.It was challenge to move in bathroom and very little in terms of toiletries.So beware if u forget anything.The housekeeping and room service don't respond and phone calls are unattended for long time.Breakfast is Spartan at best and if you are vegetarian then forget about having food here.It though looks great on webpage in reality it is just found lacking in everyway.You would definitely think twice staying here unless you don't mind all the above and most off all indifference.

Reviews.Title: “daylight??”
Reviews.Author: natant82
Reviews.Content: Awful room in the basement, no windows, very rude staff, had to wait 20 minutes for check in although there were four people behind the counter. never ever again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - centrally located - near tube - tour pick up at hotel - would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ostrem88
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a vacation package that we built through Gate 1 Travel. We had been to London before, but we had stayed in another neightborhood not far away. This hotel is right across the street from Hyde Park and 2-3 blocks from the tube. The room was large with two twin beds and private bathroom. It also has elevators! for those of you used to traveling in Europe, you know how nice this is in smaller hotels. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very helpful. The continental breakfast that came with the package leaves something to be desired; however you could upgrade to a better continental or full breakfast for a few pounds. It was nice to have the tour bus coaches stop at the hotel to take you to the tour departure point. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks, Gate 1, because we had not heard of this hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: lascarReading
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the reviews for this hotel. We stayed for 1 night and paid £52 via Last Minute. I don't know how much some of those complaining about the hotel paid, but at £52 it's excellent value in a great location. At check-in the staff were friendly and cheerful, I was offered at room at front or back and took one at the back. The room was small but not claustrophic, the decor was basic and slightly tired, the wallpaper was scuffed in places, and the bathroom is small but adequate. The bed and bed linen were spotless, there is a fridge and safe in the room and basic tea and coffee. There were only two small milk portions, tough - there are many 24 hour shops nearby, if you need milk or oj, go buy it. The reception area looked good as did the bar but as I didn't visit the bar it I can't comment. For those who are driving and just staying overnight, there is free on-street parking in this area of london from 1830 to 0830. I note one of the reviewers complained that the staff wouldn't call a taxi. At £52 per night I'm not surprised. This place cost less than any Travelodge I've used in London and I wouldn't expect the staff in Travelodge to call a taxi. This is the first time I've posted a review on Trip Advisor and I had second thoughts as I don't want this place to be too popular because I hope to use it many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: rkarim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last week; we find it very poor in term of service, un helpful and very arrogant over enragement of double payment involving Expedia.com I certainly will think twice before booking through Expedia.com, and over all booking hotel such as Central Park Hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, huge bed, clean rooms, poor service, poor & expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RJDSR
Reviews.Content: I think that some of the reviews about this hotel are quite tough. I have been there less than 15 days ago and I can affrim that my bedroom was very clean. I recognize that the bedroom was small, but I believe that it was becaus eof the size of the bed (huge and also very confortable). In my point of view, the drawbacks of this hotel regard the poor service, the personel at the reception desk is not very helpful. Each time we asked them for an advice they were totally clueless. The breakfast was also expensive and poor (£5 continental and £7 english). This was not an issue, there are so much restaurantsa round the corner proposing cheaper and better breakfast. Finally the big added value of the central park hotel is the location, close from everything, 2 metros less than 5 minutes walking, lots of buses, near Notthing Hill, near Piccadilly, near Trafalgar Square. Queensay is near all city main attractions, but itself it is a nice plance with good restaurant, We tried the meditareean one near queensway station it was good, there is also a greek restaurant in the area we recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms! Dirty carpets! Don't let to get a cab for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: kevin3388
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and dirty! The continental breakfast is terrible! Coffee is undrinkable! The staff are not friendly at all. After we checked out, we asked the front desk clerk about the cab. He told us that we have to go to the street to flag for one. However, overheard the conversation, the Japanese guy at the concierge told us he can order one for us. We thought we were getting a cab, but he called his Indian friend over. At the end, we paid double the Pounds what the cab would have caused us! Stay away!!!! The must go some kicked back from the car driver!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room, poor service, dirty beds”
Reviews.Author: Travelfolks5
Reviews.Content: Paid for a 3 bed room and were given a 2 bed. Manager was almost never available. Paper thin walls kept us up most of the night. No one to deal with our concerns or complaints. Our son lives in London and we will not stay there next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, value.”
Reviews.Author: ctdon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park Hotel January 4-12 and had a great experience. Perfectly nice tourist class hotel in a convenient location with two tube stations within a 5 minute walk. Modern Lobby and bar, four fast lifts, decent breakfast, comfortable room with a mini-fridge (I was in a single, easily comparable to the singles at the St. Giles at a considerably lower price). Bathrooms are a decent size and include a tub (nice after hiking all day) but it could use a shelf for your toothbrush, etc. The hotel is kept very clean, housekeeping leaves you alone in the morning if you have your do not disturb sign out, cleaned room and changed the towels everyday. The front of desk staff are very pleasant and helpful. The corridors can be noisy as the doors shut with a bang, and other guests may have louder conversations, the walls are a little on the thin side, but I had no problem sleeping. There are lots of convenient shops on the Queensway nearby as well as restaurants and pubs. The Internet service they offer is too expensive at £12 a day, but they have a computer room downstairs with several coin-operated terminals. Overall I had a great stay here and would certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Bottom Line... "Find a better hotel"”
Reviews.Author: JBel52
Reviews.Content: The rooms of the hotel were clean and spacious considering hotels in Europe. For a Hotel that charges over $100 a night the staff was not helpful. The Services provided were below basic, no phone service unless a $30 deposit was placed, and No bag depot for the time between checkout and leaving for the airport. The breakfast was a shock! "the Continential Breakfast," was a selection of day old bread and corn flakes with coffee form a machine. The unbelievable part was if you want cheese and yogurt you have to pay $10 and eggs and sausage is $15. The Bottom Line the staff couldn't care less.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. NOTHING ELSE even good.”
Reviews.Author: blksheep007
Reviews.Content: Beware of the "quiet area". The name they have given the window less basement rooms. The rooms are VERY warn and tired, and two of our four smelled really bad. All of the beds in all four rooms sagged so much in the middle you had to laugh when you looked at them. We had no cold water for about 12 hours, and the water pressue was not much more than a trikle. Breakfast is a bit of a scam, with your room, you get bread, cerel, coffe and juice, two of the 3 days we stayed the bread for toast had mold on it. We didn't go the third day but ate up the street intead. They offer a VERY exspensive upgrade to add eggs and meat. I would advise skipping the breakfast and hitting a cafe up the street, half the price for an nice breakfast. Two blocked from Bayswater and Queensway stations- perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shahzadyusuf
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is very good with all important destination like oxford st, madame tussaud, king's cross, etc at a walking distance. Rooms & toilets were clean & service was quite good. But i find this hotel to be bit expensive. There are cheaper options in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible!”
Reviews.Author: Cliona_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely noisy. The walls of the rooms were paper thin; we could hear everything in the room next door and from the corridor. I could hear the people next door showering in the morning, it sounded like a waterfall beside my ear! Rooms are also very small, they squeezed three beds into a max. two bed space. Staff were not particularly nice, especially upon check out, when we were overcharged and received no apology. We were also told on check out that there was no baggage storage facility in the hotel for our luggage. Consequently we ended up hauling our bags around London city for the day as our flight was not until 8.30pm. I have stayed in a tiny hostel in New York City where space is scarce and even there I was able to store my bags for the day. I would avoid this hotel if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but never again”
Reviews.Author: greece
Reviews.Content: Except from the good location (very close to two underground stations) everything else was below average. The breakfast was embarassing (ok it was a condinetal one but it should have at least cheese and ham when you paying 120€ per night).

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel. Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: duddud
Reviews.Content: Dirty room, heat in the room dosn't work and wind enters through the windows. Lausy breackfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: nychic026
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews here, I was afraid of the conditions of this hotel. It was included in our travel package and were excited as we knew the hotel was located in a great location. My mother and I stayed at the Central Park Hotel for 4 nights and 4 days. Our room was in the 800s and in between the ground and first floor. To get to our room we needed to go up two small flights of stairs as there was no elevator access. We were able to check in about an hour and a half early (check in is at 3pm). Our room was very clean. There is a mini fridge, water heater with various coffees and teas, and a small flat screen TV, a towel heater and heated floors. For two people the room was quite spacious. Our room faced the front of the hotel and as it's in between the ground and first floor we were able to look out onto the street. We were clearly able to see people outside and had to be mindful to close the blinds. The only downside to having a room on this floor is that we couldn't open the window for fresh air. But there was no street noise and we were able to sleep very very well. The walls are a bit thin, but not to the point were it was bothersome. We heard the guest next door cough a few times and were able to hear the water pipes when someone would take a shower, but for us it was never a big deal. My only complaint would be the shower. Perhaps it was the way the bathroom was modeled, but they could easily install a real shower with a glass door. When you turn on the water it seemed to go everywhere as there is only a cloth blend shower curtain to protect the rest of the bathroom. By the time someone was done with the shower the area nearest the shower (including the carpet outside of the bathroom) was usually wet. Breakfast was included in our package and we were offered a free continental breakfast every morning of our stay. The continental breakfast is worth 2.5 pounds so take it for what it is worth. You're given a choice of apple and orange juices, coffee, teas, croissants, rolls, toast and cereal. There is an option for a hot breakfast but that is at a higher cost. There's no free wifi available which is a bit of a drawback, but not a deal breaker. In the end, the hotel is no frills. Don't expect the Ritz Carlton, it is very basic at the most. But, the room was always clean and tidy by the time we came back. It had a luggage rack which easily fit two 25 inch suitcases and there is enough room to walk around in. There was enough room to fit toiletries, things needed for the day, enough power sockets for our electronics, and a blow dryer. The beds/pillows were comfortable and the hotel is located on a quiet block. If you walk 5 minutes to Queensway you'll hit the major food/shopping/restaurant area. If anything, I would change the shower, but it's not a deal breaker when given the location of the hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Good but Fine, Easy and Helpfull”
Reviews.Author: 03littlemissy03
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just fine.. Staff was helpfull but there's no bal boy service.. and my mum really shoped well.. uurrgghh i was like dying carrying all our bags down to the lobby and to make it worst we can't leave aour bags there when our flight is like in 10 hous time!!! and the Room is clean but the toilet is so small they change towels everyday but no toiletries added only sanitarry bags.. Very continental breakfast.. pay less then you eat less.. the greatest thing about this hotel is its really near to the train station, food outlets and last minute souvenir shops.. Overall my stay here was just good..

Reviews.Title: “Not a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Symh
Reviews.Content: I paid a 100 pounds to stay there for a day.location excellent.unfortunately the room just ok.I asked for a twin got 1 double bed and my friend got a Childs bed which was not long enough. Went to the toilet the water was extremely boiling hot so complained and the plumber told me I have to put the taps on in the bath to make the temperature fine in the basin that didn't work.my friend had a shower next day with shampoo in her hair and cold water in the shower. Bad experience.I say if u want to sleep only and stay close to tube this is good don't expect anything else. Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Armin83
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff is super helpful. Keep in mind there's a big turnover of guest numbers, so of course the rooms are quite worn and the staff is of course busy, but they are doing an excellent job. Special thanks to Tomasz (the canadian eh), Sunreena (from Nepal), Flori and Mr Abdul (who just came back from Mekka). To put it all in a nutshell: Good value for the price paid for a place in this great location, friendly staff, clean but quite worn rooms and could be better heated, thin walls (I am a heavy sleeper so no problem with that). Didnt check out the food, but the bar looks quite nice. The wireless costs 12 pound per day, but there is also a business center somewhere... i didnt make us of it. If you expect luxury here, then look some place else and pay more money!

Reviews.Title: “it's a transit hotel, safe, good location and well priced”
Reviews.Author: pab99_10
Reviews.Content: The Central Park is a pretty basic hotel but the double room was a good size, it was clean and everything worked. Didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the breakfast. Location was very good in that it was a couple of mins walk from 2 tube stations. Not the hotel I'd take my family for a break but as a solo traveller it was fine - and anyway, how much time do you spend in your room when your in central London?

Reviews.Title: “Economy hotel - watch out for wide angle pics online”
Reviews.Author: Vikeay
Reviews.Content: Well single room was so tiny that never expeted it to be what I paid for reasonable economy hotels. If you'd like to spend night near Central London just a mile from Marble Arch this is a right place but rooms are really small. Shower was like you get into a flight washroom! Look deeper at the wide angle pics you may see for single room, which appear to be a large room, well it was ok stay and will rate it 2.5 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ljsd45
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here!!!! You can find a better hotel in the city or on the outskirts of town. However, I was quite surprised my the size of my room and the cleanliness of the bathroom and room itself. For seven nights I paid just a little over 1300$ or about 800 pounds. The cleaning staff were lovely and there was only one young women at the reception desk that was very pleasant and helpful. However, the rest of the staff was rude, obnoxious and had extremely poor customer service skills. If you are American or Canadian DO NOT expect to be treated as you would back home. Expect to be treated as if you have no value as a customer and that they are doing you a favor for staying at this hotel. I went to the breakfast area to check out what they had. I was yelled at by a misserable hostess who told me that I needed to ask permission to look at the buffet. My friend had a single room (I had a double) and her mattress was old and sinking. I guess I just got lucky. Don't prepay for a continental breakfast because you can't upgrade to a full breakfast unless you pay for the full breakfast price. Don't expect to have anything charged to your room. You have to prepay for any service (e.g. Internet, breakfast). Next time I am staying at a Hilton possibly on the outskirts of town and take the Underground into the City. Can't go wrong with a Hilton. Staff are amazing. I had breakfast one morning at the Hilton and was treated better than I would have in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: nikki8060
Reviews.Content: Matresses were old and sunken and getting comfortable proved a challenge. Dated look to room with (flea like) bugs crawling around. No fire alarms in room and those in the restaurant area were covered up (possibly due to people burning toast) - is this legal??!!! Reception staff were impolite and the breakfast team were plain rude. Food was stale and the fresh orange juice was the worst experience of my life! The only positive thing was booking out of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away of this place!”
Reviews.Author: yonihal
Reviews.Content: Tiny rooms, squeaking beds, noisy, service impolite. Heating was broken. Cleaners kept entering the room when I was in and the "do not disturbe" sign was hanging. The only reason to stay - the location.

Reviews.Title: “I would not suggest this hotel even to my worst enermy! It shouldn't be in the business”
Reviews.Author: CanadaVladimir
Reviews.Content: Our son bought us on our 45 anniversary the Mideterenian cruise starting from London.And travel agent booked us one night ( precruise) in London.She suuggest the Central Park Hyde Park hotel so we can see the Hyde Park.When we got the room with #8042 ,we thought as we 've been told, we have the best view. What a joke!.The hotel has only 7 FLOORS.So our room was in the basement with no windows.It loked more like an asylum room or pretrial room than the hotel room.When we asked to change the room, we've been told that manager on duty will call us ,but nobody did.Futhermore, the safe was broken. (another promise was not fulfiled) We asked for an extra towel.Again promised and not done. The last, we asked for 5:00 A.M. wake up call:NEVER got one and were almost late for our ride to the port..So, in the morning We asked the manager for the refund and have been told that only travel agent (because she booked for us) can apply for one. The hotel and the service is disgrace to the Hospitality Service! We were so upset and disgusted with the room and service that we didn't want to see London. We couldn't wait for the morning to leave that hotel. ANNIVERSARY to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Men188590
Reviews.Content: There is not so much to say about this hotel. To start off with the positive aspects, the room was pretty nice. However, the TV was very small and old compared to the distance from the bed. Thereby, there is no bath in the bathroom. The worst thing about the hotel is the level of service. My suitcase was missing upon arrival in London. The would send it later that night to the hotel. I informed the concierge about the expected luggage to be delivered. In the night it was delivered to the hotel, but I was not informed at all. Next morning I called the reception from my room and described my piece of my luggage in order for them to identify the object. It was delivered, but they were unable to bring it to the room. So I had to dress up, go downstairs and pickup the suitcase. Otherwise I didn't have cloths for the day. Then breakfast is just chaotic. The continental breakfast consists of just bread (the croissants are of bad quality) with jam. Actually, the coffee is nice! If you want a better breakfast, you need buy tickets for that. During the breakfast the supervisor is watching you closely. The day of our return we wanted to visit the city for some hours. After our check-out the hotel staff was not willing to store our luggage. For that reason we were dragging our suitcases throughout the underground stations and streets. In short, very bad service!

Reviews.Title: “1 of the 2 WORST Hotels we have stayed at in 28 years!”
Reviews.Author: FatBoy-and-Lulu
Reviews.Content: Although it looks like it is on a quiet, narrow street a half block from Kensington Park, there is nothing quiet about this street in the evening. We just came in from Paris on the Chunnel. We arrived to find a front desk clerk who didn't speak English, nor did the Bartender, nor our maid. The Hallways were kept at 80 degrees or more, so one had to open the window to allow 60 degree weather in, but at night, the Hotel Bar customers went outside to smoke and drunkenly screamed til 1AM about how their football or rugby team was the best. There were ZERO drawers in the hotel room, so we had to live out of our suitcases for a week. There was only 1 shelf in the room 7' up over the hanging closet. The safe is on the floor of the closet at its back, so since it is at the front of the room next to the door, one had to get on the floor prone to reach it...and then it didn't work. Phones would not allow a Long Distance call to the US even after we paid a 20 pound deposit to do so. No WiFi in the Hotel to use our computer. We had to walk 2 blocks to find one. The twin beds were cockeyed, the head of the right top was 6" higher than the left foot of the bed. DISASTER waiting to happen. Under NO circumstances would we ever recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lalalucy73
Reviews.Content: The beds are comfortable, rooms are clean, free continental breakfast and a very friendly staff. I loved that it was across from Kennsington Park. I took a walk every night

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lian33
Reviews.Content: Everything bad,the room,the bad with bags.The mattress very old. The bathroom very small,no shower,toilet does not flow good. Breakfast without any selection,jams missing for days.Only the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: knycty
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to explore London, right by lots of shops and restaurants and Hyde Park, easy to catch the Underground. Small room but okay for a single traveler. Breakfast was just enough to start the day, juice, coffee and rolls. Bar was nice, staff was helpful. Only issue was noisy people on the street outside at night, but my room was on the second floor facing the street, probably wouldn't have that problem higher up. Internet access room was helpful but coin-operated PC's was pretty cheap. Overall a decent stay at a good price for a single traveler. Not sure it'd be as good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: kashpir_pl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 nights in a single room. It was a very small, basic room with standard amenities like TV and fridge. The room itself was not very clean - the room is so small that the walls get dirty very easily. Bathroom was also small, with old taps, but cleaner than the room itself. Didnt' have breakfasts there so cannot comment. Generally, the only reason for choosing this hotel would be the location - close to Quensway street and 2 underground stations as well as some green areas like Kensigton Gardens and Hyde Park. Not far away from Oxford Street either. But frankly speaking I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “outdated and scruffy”
Reviews.Author: sayers17
Reviews.Content: very basic old rooms with poor furnishings and limited facilities . reasonable location for central london and tube

Reviews.Title: “what to expect!”
Reviews.Author: youie31
Reviews.Content: i would have to say that location wise, this is a great hotel, very close to restaurants and shops and very easy access to publilc transport. having said that, it's about the only good thing going for this hotel. the walls are paperthin and you can hear everything happening in the next rooms, in the hallways and in the streets. the rooms are small, even by european standards and although there's a room service menu, when you try to order from it you get told that only one or two things are available (rather than the 10 or so other options). there's no restaurant per say, only a breakfast room downstairs where you can get stale croissants and rolls and cereal (unless you want to pay an extra £7.50 for hot food when it'll cost you less than £5 in the nearby cafe's or restaurants). Overall, not one of the greatest places i've stayed in...and i've stayed in alot of hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed with Central Park Hotel, London”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo1022
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well below what we expected according to their website. The front desk staff were mostly unhelpful. The rooms were well below what you would expect e.g. the curtains were falling off, the double bed was small, the bath was very small; our room required a lot of maintenance to be done on it. There is no luggage storage - they use to have a room for storage but turned it into a hotel unit we were told, many people were asking for a storage room while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: studsmurf
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 double rooms, and got rooms right down the hall and down in the basement. This is the hotel for you if you like small rooms, with no windows, wet floors, hole in the walls, locked up firedoors, worst continental breakfast ever, and a couple of unwelcomed staff at the reseption. You should get paid to sleep at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJQ5
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal in the Central Park Hotel for a 3 night trip to London. I'd stayed in the hotel several years ago and its standards have slipped a bit, however it is in a brilliant location and our room wasn’t very big, but it was clean. There are 2 tube stations a 5 minute walk away so all of London can be explored from here without too much trouble. Breakfast wasn’t great – it wasn’t even good to be honest. The breakfast service was very disorganised. No cutlery was normal, lack of bread to toast, no sugar, etc…, and very few staff to help with these things. Also the area that guests have their breakfast in is not at all pleasant. We enjoy having our breakfast out when we’re away so this was not such a big issue for us. Bayswater has numerous cafes and restaurants to choose from, so you certainly won’t go hungry. All things considered we’d not hesitate to stay in the Central Park Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the low price”
Reviews.Author: deanbond
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. It might be inexpensive for London, but it's not worth the discount. The rooms are not clean, the service is quite poor, and I found a cockroach in my bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Bedwants!!!!! don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Toynbee01
Reviews.Content: Bedwants detected in the rooms. They should clean up THE place.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great, the hotel is so so”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelator
Reviews.Content: Stayed there once in 2007 just before the hotel finished its major face lift. The room is very very small but clean. The bathroom has a nice tub/shower with good water pressure. The nicest part of this hotel is its location - just across the Hyde Park and two minutes walking distance to Queensway. You can find all kinds restaurants there. The bus lines and tube stations are right there. It is perfect for people who visit London and only want a simple and clean place to sleep. Plus, it offers free continental breakfast. (English breakfast cost extra. Pass it unless you like baked beans, greasy bacon, and stewed tomatoes for breakfast.)

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jeniller
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at the Central Park Hotel for 3 nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the beds were very comfy. The only downside was the fact the the water would take a very long time to go down after a shower. The continental breakfast was good. The location was great...we were 2 block down from the metro, across the street from Hyde Park and a block down from the Big Red Bus pick up. Over all very good experience. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: charleen82
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were looking for a hotel for a short staying in London, just the time to visit and enjoy the city. We choosed the Central Park Hotel, that in that period was in process of renovation. Anyway the choise was not bad, 'cos we had no problems. The double room was clean e quite large. The bathroom good as well, very clean. The breakfast space was very big, and the food nothing special. The position of the hotel was optimal to get the underground, just few steps far, and visit the principal actractions of the city. Anyway, close to the hotel there are The Kensington Gardens and The Hyde Park, that deserve to be visited! And many restaurants as well, to enjoy a very good dinner (I suggest the Thai one and Lebanese one). I would suggest this hotel to those friends groups and families who want to have a place to sleep during their staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location- best I can say.”
Reviews.Author: Denaf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, shared room with a friend. Knew it was "tourist class" but perhaps not what that means. As others mentioned, it was convenient to Tube & bus stops, shopping, Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. About 2 miles from the Oxford St. dept. stores. Our experience was not as bad as recent reviews led me to fear. Nor was it pleasant, compared to other places I've stayed. We were allowed to leave our luggage in the room, as we arrived in the morning. The room is small. No drawers, no towel rack or hook in the bathroom. (They put towels on a shelf at the end of the tub). Shower curtain rod too close to the ceiling to hang a towel on it. Room- not too dirty, did not see any bugs. Only 1 chair (at the desk) & a small table we used as a shelf. Bathroom sink did not drain & after reporting to housekeeping, it was not fixed. Next evening, called desk 2 more times before the substitute manager (from food & beverage) came up & poured bleach down the drain & removed the drain plug. Very noisy area. Again, as mentioned, we had to keep the window opened because it was so hot & no fan available. Earplugs a necessity. Small fridge where drawers might have been. If you use it, leave the cabinet door open so the heat build-up doesn't keep the fridge from cooling. Concierge tries to be helpful. Don't use room telephone! The card said it cost 1.5 pounds to make a toll-free call- but 2 persons at the desk said that charge was Per Minute! Local calls also expensive. Very inconvenient to be unable to make necessary calls from room. Used their computer at 1 pound per 30 minutes. Agree, the continental breakfast was not very good & (as I recall- arrangements were made 6 months ago) rather expensive for what you get. It is about what is available at budget motels in the US at no extra fee. If we'd known all available restaurants in the neighborhood before booking, we'd likely had breakfast out. Others say to stay elsewhere- our arrangements were made thru the Road Scholar (formerly Elderhostel) organization & we hoped they'd have done some research about where to put participants for the "add on" London stay. We will be giving them our review.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in our hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Therese26
Reviews.Content: Nothing seemed right at this hotel, except for the location. When we first arrived there were lightbulbs missing, the fridge did not work, and somebody had tossed a broken television outside our door. Right before bedtime we discovered a mouse (big mouse/small rat) in our room. We contacted the staff immediately, but they did not seem interested in solving the problem. We were not offered a new room, and nobody came into our room to deal with the issue. Consequently we had to go to sleep accompanied by this vermin. In addition to this, one of our shopping bags went missing. When we asked the cleaning personnel about this, she replied "thank you". We have not been offered compensation. Central Park Hotel claims that the mouse incident never occurred. Do not stay at this hotel. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Happy - good location and nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Mirjam
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectations for the hotel but the room was clean and there was everything I needed. The room itself was very small. The staff wasn't friendly but not unfriendly either. The location was very good, the tube station was near and also bus stops. Also arriving from the airport it was not too long a distance to walk to the hotel from the Paddington railway station (my luggage wasn't very heavy though). The breakfast wasn't special (no fruit and the coffee tasted like instant coffee) but it was ok for a two days visit. I wish they would have had storage for luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever, i wouldn't let my dog stay there”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Australia_85
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty, Smelly, Noisy, Hot.... The staff were lazy, our T.V was broken, i rang reception 3 times to get it fixed, and they kept saying they were too busy, but when i went down stairs, 4 staff members were standing around chatting. The room and bathroom was very small. No air conditioning and the temperature at that time was 37 Degrees. But if you opened the window, you were at risk of getting robbed or attacked. Plus with the window open, it was very very Noisy from all the drunk people hanging out the front of the hotel. It is the worst place i've ever stayed in my life.... Keep shopping around for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Central Park best near Hyde Park London”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep6372
Reviews.Content: I found Central Park hotel is best near Hyde Park London. Very convenient location. Near Bays Water underground station and Hyde Park. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the WORST Hotel in london- Do not stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tobyrex
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is just awful. Staff are rude, abrupt and clearly hate their job's. We were quite upset as to how we were treated. I have never experienced anything like it. Its a big let down for london. On the second night of our stay we came back to find that the very rude and disrespectful manager( if that's what we wants to call himself) had locked us out of our room. This hotel was booked by a friend of ours & he provided all the necessary details , credit card & contact details and asked them to charge it to his credit card and NOT to ask us for payment. There is no communication, a complete lack of respect for hotel guests & clearly not one member of staff has any common sense. We were treated so badly on arrival, housekeeping staff were arguing outside our bedroom door about how many rooms they have cleaned.We didn't get towels for our room until that night- when we asked for towels we abruptly told that they were not cleaned yet.To the owners of this hotel & staff - you should be ashamed of yourselfs.

Reviews.Title: “sconsigliatissimo!!!not to go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cr137
Reviews.Content: breakfast without any possibility to have a seat or something to eat! reception not good to help us ( ask for a 3 beds, had 2 for all our stay! pre paid reservation, no money back! wi fi do not works properly room not clean. towels dirty of blood and other things!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, close to tube and good restaurants, clean”
Reviews.Author: candyGeorgia
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night with my mum. check in was ok staff not over friendly but acceptable enough. didnt tell us where room was and signs not great but we found it. the room was a good size for this type of hotel, and clean. bed comfortable. if you like tea bring your own as not enough bags or milk - we asked at reception but they only had 2 more? not good for a tea junkie like my mother!!! tube station real close (queensway and bayswater) with great restaurants easy to walk to (especially Beity Lebanese - great food) one big problem was there is no left luggage room at the hotel!! we had to pay £8 per bag at victoria station. I guess I Should have checked prior, but I just assumed all hotels had this facilty. I would stay here again as it was good comfort for the price (£73 for a twin) and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful hotel - do not stay here - no idea why it's 3 *”
Reviews.Author: lwally
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here with my grandmother for 2 nights in a twin room, on arrival we were told that they did not have a twin room for the first night - only a double - They asked us to come back the next day!!!! - after explaining that doing that would leave us with nowhere to sleep that night they offered to put another bed in the double room - great! but then tried to charge us £50 for it! To be honest I was gob smacked at the terrible service especially when they were trying to convince me that I was wrong and that I must have booked the double as their booking manager is never wrong! At this point we spoke to the general manager who explained again that we would have to pay £50 for an extra bed to go in the room. At this point we were ready to walk out and find another hotel - that is until we were informed that their booking policy would mean having to pay for the room anyway! We eventually convinced them to put another bed in the room for free - at which point the general manager looked at us and said ''don't bring a third person into the room though''. Excuse me??? Do me and my grandma look like we are going to be sneaking people into our room in the middle of the night?? I was totally offended at the staffs behavior. The breakfast we paid for was below average, with a very small selection on the continental buffet, the room was noisy, the carpets were dirty and the beds felt old to lie on (sinking in the middle) when I went down to reception on our second night to ask for more milk in our room (they are very tight with it!) there was a couple there who were staying in a room at the back, who could not open their window, and it was a very hot day....I dread to think how uncomfortable it was in that room! ( no air con) this is a hotel that would much rather cut corners and make money out of ripping people off than treat their customers properly. Do not book to stay here unless you like hassle, complications and wasting your money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Alert - No Fire Escape”
Reviews.Author: StaaleH
Reviews.Content: Arrived late, was given room 856 - should think this was on 8th floor, but it is actually the hotels crazy way of squeezing tha last buck out of their guests by converting parts of their basement or garage into rooms. As mentioned a very (VERY) small room, complete with used pizza boxes and dirty drinking cups. The room even came with abig hole in the ceiling where you could look into (lights came on up here with our room lights) the ventilation abd electric installations.
