The worst thing abouut this is the safety aspect as no secondary escape possibilities), the second bad thing was charging us full price for the room, and the third bad thing was the copmplete indifference by the Consierge when this was pointed out to him. Was given a new room (the next day) by helpfull receptionist but had to stay in the basement the first night as the hotel was full. Approaced the Conierge the nexd morning and was given a "what me worry??" look and a cold shoulder when we suggested some sort of compensation for having to sleep in the garage. Shrugged his shoulders and said he was not allowed to compensate in any way. Was given a note with an e-mail address in outer space to send compaints to. I really can not understand why the hotel would risk their good name and reputation for the price of - breakfast.....- we would have settled for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: IBI_UBU
Reviews.Content: First off, the location. You are within a few minutes to two different tube stations running on different lines. So if you find one line down you will still be able to travel to and from your destinations with ease. You are also within a few minutes walk of Hyde Park. The next street over is Queensway. You will find a number of tourist shops selling the usual "I heart London" shirts etc. These shops do compete with each other by having the items marked down or offering a discount for large purchase, or for return purchases. The back of your receipt may have a % off discount on your next purchase. The shops feel very friendly. You will find a few inexpensive internet cafes in the area. Ask if they have headsets if you want Skype home or Skype your calls in London as the hotel charges a lot for phone use. There is also a nice indoor mall a couple of blocks down called Whiteleys. This street also has Boots, Tesco Metro, McDonalds, Burger King, Pubs, etc all a short walk away. Now about the Hotel. I was booked in this hotel as part of a package. The deal was good and London is awesome. My deal included airport transfers as well as some excursions. The day prior to the excursions I was instructed to call the tour company to book our seats. I went to the Concierges desk to ask if he normally set up the pickups. He told me he could sell me tours but had nothing to do with the tours I had included with my package. As I wanted to call home anyway, I went to an internet cafe and Skype'd the tour companies and set everything up. We had met up with a very nice couple from White Rock and they told us of the trouble and huge cost they had getting their phone to work in their room so we did not bother to even try. In the morning we went to the concierge and asked what were we needed to go to catch the bus to our tour. Everyone who spoke to him got the same answer, just wait outside. This did work out as the tour company Evan Evans Tours did a good job setting things up. (Something to remember, the tour companies do not take you back to your hotel, you will need to find your own way. Luckily the tube works great at getting you around.) The day we went to check out, again we went to the Concierge and told him we have a pickup in our itinerary to return us to the airport. Again his answer was just wait outside. As we stood there with all the other people told the same thing, every ten minutes or so, one of us would go back in and ask him to call to ensure our buss was coming. He would again say just wait outside. After our bus was about an hour late and we were getting concerned about missing our flight, our friend from White Rock got more forceful with the Concierge and finally convinced the Concierge to pass over his phone and he called the bus company. The bus company sent out a bus to pick us up and the driver told us, somehow our group had been missed on the route schedule. The "Concierge" sat behind the counter but refused to do anything at all. The room itself was small and basic. It had its own on suite (not all London hotels do) and it served our needs. The breakfast was not too bad. We did not pay the extra for the hot breakfast as it appeared to be a couple of strips of bacon, eggs , and all the included stuff. The breakfast which was include in the room price consisted of toast and pastries, cereal, coffee and juice. This suited me fine as I do not have a full breakfast every day, but I could hear some people were not happy. The room was clean and the cleaning staff were friendly. We needed to open our window as we had no AC, unfortunately this meant listening to the AC on the roof bellow. Internet time can be purchased in the hotel but as I did not bring my laptop, I did not look into the cost. All in all the Hotel was not great but not too bad. The location is really the best thing going for it. Would I stay there again? If the deal was right, I might, but it would need to be a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroachest. Broken T.V's. Broken Bed. Showers for short people only.”
Reviews.Author: WillB101
Reviews.Content: Arrived in london and rang the hotel for the address to give the cabbie. this took three calls to get a understandable answer due to lack of english speaking staff. Finally arrived and the lady asked us if we'd like to pay by card or cash. Had already given card details beforehand but decided to pay cash to avoid carrying excess amounts round london. However when checking my account balance the next day i fount that they had taken the money anyway!!! They said they were holding it for purposes of pre-authorization and would be released in three days, something they failed to mention when asking how id like to pay, leaving us with no money for the second and final day of our trip. After talking to a young lady supervisor she said she'd ring the bank to release the money. she said it may take a couple of hours but it was clear she was guessing (and almost day later the money still isnt released!). I then asked her to ring and find out exactly when it would be released. shortly after some form of tall male manager appeared named Abdul came to talk to us. ( i got the idea they sent him over to intimidate us out of our complaint which did not work!) It was clear they had no intention of ringing the bank again (if they ever did in the first place.) As i was talking to him my girlfirend noticed a leaflet with a hand written note saying "we would prefer if you were not to use the Central Park Hotel services again". But he obviously didnt have the courage to hand it over. We fount this exceptionally rude and cheeky that they would even consider handing us this note, after all the other problems we had during the night...After returning from the centre of london about 01:30am my girlfriend came screaming out of the bathroom. I presummed it would be a spider but a very large bug came charging out of the bathroom, shortly followed by anouther. After stamping on them closer inspection showed them to be COCKROACHES! I scaped the remains up (one of which was still moving slightly) on a piece of paper. I took them down the Concierge and he came to inspect the room, which he did poorly as shortly after he left my poor girlfirend discovered yet anouther one! After trying to stamp on it it crawled under the door. i called the Concierege and we agreed to move rooms which were reluctant to have to do as it was 02:00am by this time, and we'd had the window open long enough to get the room to a nearly bareable tempreture. The Concierge came and saw the COCKROACH and just left it there. When we got to the new room which was almost directly above the old one we discovered that it was extremely hot, the t.v did not work and after checking under the mattress for COCKROACHES we discovered a large piece of chipboard put there to keep the BROKEN bed sturdy. On top of all this the you couldnt fit comfortably under the shower head unless you were under 5 feet tall! After all this we realised we were just waisting more of our last day talking to the dismissive so called manager. As for the money problems we had to rely on family members to transfer us money. If i wasnt so persistant in my nature i feel we would've recieved an even worse service. At first appearances this hotel SEEMS nice but it by far the worst place ive had the dis-pleasure of staying and im not fussy! £20 BnB's put this hotel to shame. You should avoid staying here like the plague as you might just catch it if you do.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very basic, dirty, loud, no A/C, poor service "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Duke733
Reviews.Content: To sum this up quickly please bring ear plugs as you will hear everything from every room. It has a great central location so it has the usual traffic/city noises but with no A/C the windows will need to be open to get a "little" breeze so the noise levels are high. The rooms are disgusting. Cobwebs in the corners and the bathrooms had stains and hair left from the previous guests. They will not store luggage upon check out which is almost unheard of and par for the service you will receive. Pay upon arrival....yep. Basically one step up from an hourly hotel. Finally and I kid you not upon check out today this is the conversation my wife and I were privy to. Two folks are checking in and their room was not ready as it was a bit before noon. The desk clerk informed them they could drop off their luggage in their room but would need to vacate the room immediately as the room had not been cleaned from the previous occupants. Honestly, I have traveled to many places and stayed in many crap hotels but this option upon check in was a first to hear. Just par for the course for this "hotel." Book at your own risk but it is NOT worth the value. There are plenty of other cleaner, cooler, quieter places in London.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: Mimmeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated, but that is almost the only positive point I can mention. The Lobby-are looks nice. The Bar is ok. The breakfast - I would not have it again, rather have a nice coffee somewhere on the way. The size of the room is ok. But the beds would defenitely needed to be replaced (my back still hurts). The bath is very very small. The concierge at the hotel did not speek english and could not help us when we asked for assistance to find an address. Good place to stay if you don't want to spend a fortune and only need a bed at night and don't expect any comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory budget hotel, good for one night”
Reviews.Author: RevellingAround
Reviews.Content: PROS: - good, budget London hotel (we booked with lastminute for under £80) - room was clean and the staff were friendly (mostly...had to wait to check in because 2 staff members were having a chat, but the lady who finally served us was very nice) - good location, not too far from the tube and Hyde Park is just down the road, lots of dining options nearby along the Queensway CONS: - tiny bathroom...and despite putting the shower curtain inside the bathtub I still managed to get water all over the floor - thin walls...you can hear the conversation in the next room - room was too warm Overall I would recommend this hotel for a single night stay - we stayed the night before joining a tour and it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: uk2dubai
Reviews.Content: If you want to sleep in pre-fab beds, or questionable quality, while listning to everything that goes on in the rooms next to you, while counting how many times the lift doors open and close... well then you can not go wrong stayng at Central Park hotel. Makes you wonder how on earth this kind of hotel can stay in business...makes you wonder

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel: location, price, facilities etc etc etc”
Reviews.Author: TRippingale
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights whilst travelling around London doing the sites as you do. Chose the hotel based on price and location and didn't expect much. However, we were extremely impressed! We arrived around 2 (an hour earlier than check-in) and was welcomed in a pleasant way - not too much conversation, pretty to the point but you expect this is London. The hotel was really clean and modern as was the bar and restaurant. Got into our room - disappointed we didn't have a view but this was probably a good thing as we had no outside noise at all. The bed was comfortable and we both got a great night sleep. Room was large with a huge bathroom compared to the size of the room - both being very very clean and pleasant. Only thing I didn't like was the fact that the room was not as modern as the rest of the hotel - maybe time for a make-over. Breakfast was good - very pleasant chef who was very generous - but then we had paid £7.50 each for it so we expected as much! Would definately stay here again due to location over anything else and being cheaper than near by travelodges was a real bonus to our budget trip! Biggest criticism is the timings they set are a bit difficult to work round - 3pm check in, 12pm check out and 7am-10am breakfast but suited our trip perfectly - so plan ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in London - Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Jdog69
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel and on the second night we found bed bugs in our bed and room. We attempted to bring this to the Managers attention, but they explained that it was "OUR PROBLEM" and to complain to our travel agent. If you "google" for reviews on this hotel you'll see I wasn't the only person with this problem. I wouldn't recommend you stay in this hotel for any reason. Had the management staff shown some remorse or helped us to get our clothing clean and bags replaced due to the bed bugs I might have given it a better review, but still would never stay in this hotel again. In one word " NASTY"!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in UK”
Reviews.Author: Lisabear7599
Reviews.Content: The woman at reception was not friendly when I arrived hotel at 11am, she asked me to come back at 2pm or leave luggage at hotel, but I have to pay for luggage storage, she said I can leave luggage free after check out, but they charge for before check in, it sounded cheating, she gave me invoice with different hotel name and address. I asked if I could have breakfast earlier or take away because I will departure ar 7am, she said "make your own tea or coffee at room", not a qualify staff at international hotel. I cancelled another booking at this hotel and will never return...........

Reviews.Title: “Far too noisy if you need a good sleep. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ziziItaly
Reviews.Content: If you're in your twenties, you need a cheap hotel in a good location and you're planning to party all night, this is the hotel for you! The rooms are clean but quite small and in need of a refurbishment. I couldn't sleep because of the noise: the walls are very thin and most of the customers were young and in a party mood. I would raccomend this hotel to my younger sister, but not to collegues, especially if they are in London for business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ostschweizer
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet residential area near Finsbury Park tube station. So well connected to central London by tube or by night buses. Room was huge, did not expect such a huge room for the money we paid. All facilities available like toilet and shower en-suite.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly bad set up and booking”
Reviews.Author: AliWiseman
Reviews.Content: So.. the planned trip to see Rage against the Machine in Finsbury Park was supposed to go well. Back in Feb I booked the hotel, and gained a confirmation email straight away. Upon inspection I noted that the email only said one person was staying, so I called them up. A lovely young lady was exceptionally happy to help, and said that this was just a glitch in the system, yes she had our booking and all was well. I explained to her that this was brilliant, as we were travelling from Holland for my wife's first trip to London. So.. Imagine my surprise when, yesterday, I received an email telling me that unfortunately they could not grant me a reservation and I would have to look elsewhere for somewhere to stay. My wife is of a nervous nature, and was obviously most distressed, so I endeavored to call the hotel only this morning to clear up the confusion. "I have my confirmation number, and two seperate emails WITH that number listed". "We have no record of your booking", was the reply. I trundled back to their website and noticed that, the cost of booking the room for the two days required had now gone up by 30pounds per night! I wonder if this might have something to do with the mysterious disappearance of our booking. As it happens, I made my booking at the same time as an old friend who I was going to meet up with. I grabbed him via the internet and told him of my experience so he rang to check his own reservations. Exactly the same issue arose. I think the lesson here is simple. AVOID AVOID AVOID! They can't mess you about if you don't book there in the first place!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt board my dog at the Central Park Hotel here”
Reviews.Author: gfficom
Reviews.Content: This hotel resulted in a disastrous experience for me. There was a violent disturbance on the first night of my stay meaning I had little or no sleep. The hotel did not deal wth the disturbance at all. In the early morning a large cock roach appeared i my bathroom , about 5:00am. I left as early as possible. The receptionist accused me of lying suggesting I was lying trying to get a discount!! I left a letter for the manager of the hotel asking here to contact me to rectify the situaton . She ignored this request. Instead the hotel took full payment from my credit card even for nigts I didnt stay there and then sent me an email accusing me of lying again. These people have a serious attitude problem. I woud suggest giving this place a wide berth.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: EMI48
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed for three nights at this hotel and were very satisfied with the location, room, price and service offered, and it will be our preferred hotel for future stays. We have previously stayed at many different hotels in the Bayswater and Paddington area and in our opinion this purpose built hotel is very attractive in its price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Hez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Central Park Hotel in Bayswater. Great location and good room. The room is not large but was ample for our needs and it was very clean and the towels, etc., were generous in size and of good quality. We only had the continental breakfast one day and it was good value. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPugwash
Reviews.Content: As in previous reviews, central park has a good enough location but that's about all that's going for this hotel. It attracts mainly tour groups hence very noisy just about their departure time. Thin walls, you can't sleep at night. You can hear everything on the right, on the left and also in the hallways AND on the street. Bottom line is, you can't really sleep which makes a wkend away here so very unpleasant. The carpet in my room was grimey with odd-looking marks that no one has bothered about that made me feel really uncomfortable walking about without shoes! The tv is placed at an odd angle on the wall. The bathroom is pretty crammed, water drains really slowly from the tub - you end up having a shower on your top half with relatively clean water and a bath on your lower half with suddy water. That's another thing, the water is of a very odd quality. It doesnt wash soap off completely. There seems to be some residue still left as the water wont wash it off. I have lived in london for about 5 years in my own flat and have never had such problems with london water but the water in this hotel is terrible. I cannot fault this hotel on location but everything else about it is DREADFUL. You want a hotel that you can rest and have a sort of decent shower with a clean room. This isnt it. Dont ruin your london trip, stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: risteardt
Reviews.Content: My partner & I needed a hotel at relatively short notice near the city centre over Easter weekend. Some of the ones I had been recommended or liked were booked out, so on the basis of location, price & the reviews here I booked this hotel. The hotel is very well located, beside Kensington Park and 5 minute walk from both Queensway & Bayswater tube stops. The room, though small, was recently refurbished tastefully (though not the bed clothes!) and comfortable. However, the room we were allocated was on the ground floor next to the front door, so it was a little bit noisy. The TV on the wall was fixed into an odd position, so you couldn't watch it in bed. The hotel really fell down in service. Our check in at 1am was fine, all we wanted was our room! One of the days we decided to try the £7.50 English breakfast. This was absoultely horrible. What the £7.50 got you was bacon, sausage, etc dished out by a surly waitress after being there all morning. Juice, tea & coffee were all similarly unpleasant. Do NOT eat here. There are plenty of lovely cafes in the area offering superb food & service Like the last review, I have stayed in many hotels over the years and NEVER had one claim they did not have a room in which to store your luggage for a few hours. The young man at the reception desk was most unhelpful and did not appear to care that this was something that was important to us. Thankfully, only having Ryanair's hand luggage allocation with us wasn't too much of an inconvenience, but it did make shopping on Oxford St later that day a little trickier

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't always everything”
Reviews.Author: LindaSUk
Reviews.Content: Over the Easter weekend, my husband and I thought we would treat ourselves to a stay in London, see a show, watch the Cambridge/Oxford boat race live, and attend Easter Sunday service in Westminster Abbey. We were able to do the first two, but the hotel would not store our one suitcase so we could go to church on Easter Sunday. I have stayed in many hotels over the years and NEVER had one claim they did not have a room in which to store your luggage for a few hours. The young man at the reception desk was most unhelpful and did not appear to care that this was something that was important to us. They also had the worst instant coffee machine in the breakfast room. It splashed more out of the cup than made it into the cup. So if you like a decient cup of coffee in the morning and a smiling, helpful face behind reception, don't book this place.

Reviews.Title: “are you sure you stayed at the same hotel as us?? stop moaning!”
Reviews.Author: hotsue67
Reviews.Content: we had booked this hotel as part of a theatre package , so were not expecting too much. we just hoped for somewhere clean and conveniently situated. after reading some of the terrible reviews on here we were not feeling optimistic! however we were pleasantly surprised. the hotel is close to hyde park and 2 tube stations, plenty of places to eat and drink nearby if you chose to. the staff were happy for us to check in and leave our baggage more than 2 hours before check in time , which was great so we could get out sightseeing without luggage. the room was large and very clean with tea/coffee making facilities. the t.v was all english channels (not sure what t.v other reviewers were watching!!) the bed was huge! almost the size of 2 doubles, and very comfortable. the bathroom was small but very clean and lots of hot water and lovely white fluffy towels. i am really fussy when it comes to toilet and cleanliness but i could not find fault, complimentary shower gel shampoo and soap were included. the room was airconditioned too, yes i suppose it could appear a little dated but only compared to brand new hotels, its seemed pretty standard and did not disappoint. continental breakfast was included which consisted of plentiful coffee/tea juice, fresh rolls croissants toast cereal and preserves. these were all replenished regularly and you could have as much as you wanted, you could pay extra for full english but we were more than happy with the continental. i really am not sure what some people expect when they book hotels these days?? unless you want to go really upmarket and pay 5star prices there really is nothing to grumble about at a hotel like the Central park. i am quite choosy but i do think everyone is very quick to criticize but rarely take the time to acknowledge good service. dont be put off by the bad reviews. our stay was definatley worth more than we paid for it!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Place for a Family with Young Teens”
Reviews.Author: lou2010_10
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was very nice.....the hotel left a lot to be desired. Let me preface this review with the statement that I have stayed in hotels that range from Motel 6 to the Rtiz Carlton....At the Central Park Hotel there were nightly bar fights across the street, some night with arrests some nights without, loud drunks in the hallways from 1-3am, the walls are so thin I could hear a man snoring in the next room and on two different nights my husband got the pleasure of listening to people on either side of us having sex. We were fortunate that our son slept through this ...although the two of us did not get one decent nights rest out of the 5 nights that we were there. If you want a wake up call you have to make eye contact with the front desk and watch them write it down...a phone call from your room to the front desk will not do the trick. We were not the only ones that never got a wake up call, the first mroning almost missing a tour. Breakfast consists of white rolls or toast, rice crispies, corn flakes, instant coffee and shot glasses of apple or orange juice. Fruit is non existant. There was a hot breakfast for an additional charge but you were shoed away from that area without being offered an option...again not good when traveling with a hungry teenager. We usually went out for breakfast. The rooms are stark and a bit shocking at first. Single beds with sunken matresses, no fitted sheets and old spreads. There are no dressers and 4 hangers in a small closet so be prepared to live out of your suitcase. If you're s student and don't know any better this hotel is for you...as for the rest of us with a bit more experience in life....I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some other reviews state”
Reviews.Author: Joe5858
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the central park for 1 night earlier this month and i have to say after reading some reviews we have seen we were panicking on what we were going to find when we arrived.But in all fairness we found the staff to be quite helpful as they let us check in 2 hours early and were very polite, the room was clean and warm(with a nice big bathroom)and we did not find the hotel to be to noisy , on a downside the breakfast was basic but for £7.50 extra you could have a full english which we thought a bit expensive even for london.This hotel is fine if you just want a place to sleep for 1 or 2 nights without to many frills we found it to be a clean,warm,safe hotel in a great location and best of all far cheaper than where we usually stay..

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Stephlewis
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. Although the walls are thin and you can here everything, all in all I think it's one of the better budget hotels in London. It is a great location near Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. You get a fridge in the room which is great as I could take my own breakfast and keep the milk in the fridge. The TV doesn't have the best picture to it but that's not really problem. There's so much to do in London, I only needed my room for sleeping and getting showered and dressed. The room was very clean and the staff were helpful. Am booking again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: mare5135
Reviews.Content: This was probably the worst hotel i ever stayed in. The staff was extremely rude upon arrival and the room look like a cave. There were no windows in the room on the first floor. The bedspread looked like a wet dog slept on it and it was too big for the bed.The bathroom toilet leaked which made the floor constantly wet. The TV was noting more than a 13 inch with 5 channels. The only saving grace was the fact that it was close to a tube station and Hyde Park. There were other hotels near by though that I would check out first..Save your money and look elsewhere....

Reviews.Title: “Ok for an overnight in London”
Reviews.Author: Imran58
Reviews.Content: Ok for an overnight stay in London. location is central and loads of restuarants and shopping within stones throw. It's a very quite and safe street so overall it's a nice hotel to stay if you are coming in for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Oliver40
Reviews.Content: Although not expensive when booked with theatre ticket package and well located near Central Line tube station this hotel is in dire need of updating as far as the rooms are concerned. It has a hostel-like feel to it with very small rooms and minute bathrooms. The rooms are relatively clean but bed coverings, curtains and carpets are just old and a little bit smelly. The wallpaper in our room was torn and peeling. There is no double glazing so the room was unbearably noisy all through the night. (Perhaps rooms at the back might be quiter.) A promise that extra pillows would be left in the room while we were out had not been fulfilled when we got back, dead-tired, at 12:30 am. A further call to reception resulted in them being delivered 15 minutes later. Breakfast (basic continental) is awful. Cheap croissants and rolls and undrinkable fruit juice. On our second morning both coffee machines broke down and took ages to fix. Upgrading from continental to English breakfast costs an outrageous seven pounds fifty pence. Public areas are clean but totally lacking in ambiance - more like a railway station than an hotel. Staff are OK but don't smile much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy & horrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dreamketcher
Reviews.Content: Check in was 3PM, didn't receive towels until 5:30 PM. After a trans Atlantic flight we wanted to clean up. Breakfast was horrible, old rolls, shot glass size juice -- we only ate there once in 4 days. Room was clean but extremely noisy. We could hear the guy in the next room snoring and conversations.

Reviews.Title: “no probs!, nice staff and hotel, gr8 location!!!”
Reviews.Author: shell114
Reviews.Content: I booked a theatre package for me and my mom for her 50th b'day, i had read the reviews on here, most of which are all bad so didn't no what to expect! However we arrived at the hotel 2hours before check-in so wasn't sure if they would let us check in but they did no problem, the lady at check in was very pleasant and helpful! We went to our room which wasn't massive but plenty big enough for what we needed - it was clean. tidy (safe, T+C, hot water, comfy beds, tv with english channels) - unlike other reviews have stated! the view overlooked the street opp the hotel. Gr8 location for the underground and directions to hotel were fine from their website! We went down for breakfast the next morning which was included (continental) - not amazing but was ok (juice, t+c, croissants, bread, cereals) could pay extra for full english if you wanted (£7.50)- however we didn't and had almost finished and a member of staff came over to us and said he had noticed it was my moms b'day as she was wearing her 50th badge and he had brought us two little cakes on a plate with a candle and said happy birthday from all the management - which we thought was a lovely touch and totally didn't expect it!!! All in all we had a lovely stay, all the staff we spoke to were really friendly and helpful and i dont understand all the bad reviews on here, but i suppose everyone has there own opinion - however i am cabin crew and have therefore stayed in many 4 an 5 star hotels across the world and didn't think this was a bad hotel at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Trine L
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and there are several other hotels around the same area, so I'll definately look around next time... The room was tiny, the bed was tilted and very wore down, the shower was spraying in all other directions than down in the bath tub, the walls were cardboard thin and there were - as already pointed out - no decent tv channels. The reception area was very good looking - so I was even more disappointed by the wore down room.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: jdci2001lu
Reviews.Content: we, one adult and 2 girls aged 10 & 12 stayed there for 3 nights ( 252 pounds) without breakfast.The room was cleanand very quiete but a bit small.The bathroom tiny but the staff at the reception quiete helpful.Very good location next to two underground stations.We didn't have breakfast and yes we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No room for luggage!!!”
Reviews.Author: gustavDk
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter have just arrived home from a stay at Central Park Hotel. When we were leaving early in the morning and kindly asked the manager of the hotel to keep an eye on our luggage since our flight was leaving late in the evening and we wanted to make the most of our last day - he blankly refused!!! Not room for it, he said (there was plenty of space...). 2 small suitcases - BAD service!!! Lamentable! Will never use this hotel again. The Apollo Hotel across the street kindly took care of our luggage instead! I have been to London many times, but never before have I experienced such a lack of service. Won´t go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaspar_83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park for a weekend with my girlfriend. The hotel is good located close to the Queensway and Bayswater Tubestation. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel nonetheless our room smelled very bad as if someone recently smoked inside (or the carpets and curtains never were changed since ages). I asked the reception staff for a airfreshener. The receptionist promised me to inform the housekeeping which definitely never happened as it smelled for the rest of our stay that bad.... For breakfast there are three options to choose between continental (bread and cereals) master continental (continental + yoghurt, cheese and ham) or full english breakfast. The breakfast room is in the basement. There was a leak in the water pipe which never got repaired so water was dropping into some buckets which wehere spread throughout the room.... At check out the guests in front of us got their boarding passes printed. As I nicely (!) asked if we they could do this for us as well the guy told me that they cannot do that and that the printing to the others just was a onetime exception as they were relatives to the owners family???!! We then wanted to leave our lugagge there for the rest of day which was not possible either.... so we had to store it at Victoria Railway station for a fee of £8 per item... I never would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean, Good if you just need a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jimgem
Reviews.Content: We booked a dailymail offer for 2 theatre tickets and hotel Total £127 for 2 people. So we didn't book direct with the hotel, so have no idea of cost to stay here. Hotel is very basic, our room was clean & warm, showers was hot. Our room had a TV and tea and coffee (cheap tea and coffee) not nice! Breakfast again very basic - tea, coffee, toast, cereal, juice (cheap and low budget brands of food) Had a good nights sleep. Location is a short walk from queensway tube 3 stops from oxford curcus. Would i stay here again not sure- depends on the cost (i would only pay under £100 for 2) If you get a good deal and only need a place to sleep which is basic then this place is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid!!!!!!!!!!! No Electricity & no left luggage!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yodapuppy
Reviews.Content: Ive just came back from a 3 night stay in this hotel, and i will NEVER be back to it! The hotel is in a good enough location, and was cheap, but thats about all it had going for it. I stayed in the hotel 2 years ago for one night and had a bad experience - there was no hot water! So we had to leave for our night out without being able to wash! I thought that was just bad timing and a one-off, but no! This time the electricity went off in the hotel! So we woke on our 2nd day to darkness, and were unable to shower as the bathroom was pitch black with no windows. We stayed away for the day & luckily it came back on. The rooms are noisy here, and very dated - a small amount of money would modernise them & really make a difference. My parnter had trouble sleeping with the noise in the actual hotel - not outside! The hotel itself is full of students and foreigners, including the staff which on both occasions have been less than helpful. There is no breakfast included in their room rates, even basic continental. Rooms are serviced every day but we had to go & ask for toilet roll as they did not replace it, and we overheard the head-maid shouting at the staff for changing sheets on the room next to us when they werent due to be changed, and ordered her to put the dirty ones back on! Added to all this on our last day we were booked on the 5.30pm flight. We checked out at 10am and asked where to leave our luggage only to be told they do not have left luggage!!!!!!! An arguement followed & i asked them HOW in a hotel of that size could they not dedicate one small room to left luggage!!!!!! They were unable to answer & VERY VERRRRY unhelpful! She told us we would have to take our 2 suitcases with us for the day! Emmm, shopping in london with 2 suitcases????? GET A GRIP!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was beyond a joke!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! For that one reason alone i will NEVER stay at this hotel again - add on all the other reasons & you will see why i felt the need to leave my first ever review of anything online. So.... BEWARE!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the price and good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaToendering
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room and even though there wasn’t a lot of space it was clean and the staff was friendly. There was a very functionally hairdryer but the towels was not all that clean. The location was very nice in a safe neighborhood, very close to Queensway metro station and Hyde Park. I can definitely recommend this hotel because of its low rates and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: bla_10 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a one night stay at this hotel in December, and it was HORRIBLE. We were booked in room 8-something. Offcourse we tought we got a room on the 8th floor, but NO. The room was located in the basement, with no window. We were thrilled to be leaving the next day. When packing our belongings we checked under the bed to make sure we did not leave anything behind. To our surprise there was a cockroach there (it was alive) ! We hurried packing up and left the room. We told the reseptionist about the vermin when checking out. All she did was say; I`m sorry, there is nothing I can do about it. She was not shocked, nor did she alarm the cleaning staff. At least not during the 20 minutes we were in the lobby! Her reaction also indicated that it was not the first time guest had found cockroaches in their hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: CliffDC
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Rooms basic but clean in my opinion. Yes the walls are very thin as another reviewer mentioned. Location is fantastic as you can catch a bus to Oxford St or Piccadilly at the end of the road and the tube is also close by. Shame they have no left luggage facilities; this put off friends I recommended the hotel to from making a booking. I did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “I like this hotel for its price and location”
Reviews.Author: Superstar2009Uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for a business trip because of two reasons: its price (especially if booking done by the internet) and its location. Actually, the rooms were not bad…it was clean and in good condition, but the problem was with the air conditioning which was not working properly. Also, I don't like their timing for check in which is 3 pm where the checking out is 12 noon.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Miky7
Reviews.Content: I get a nice promotion, that's why it worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: GermanyOut
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice the staff is nice.The price is worth the stay it is close to the tubes which is the underground subway system.There are some great places to eat and shop walking distance.This hotel is kid friendly the staff didn't complain about kids being to loud.I can't wait to stay there on my next trip out there.I would recommend this hotel to my friend as well as my friend which I had the pleasure of traveling with on my first trip.The only bad thing is it is hard to find this hotel on the gps system but other than that all is good.I hope you have a wonderful stay like we have there with family.

Reviews.Title: “ok!”
Reviews.Author: shellsbellsxx
Reviews.Content: great location but the room was freezing i slept in a jumper! nice hotel for the money but when we wanted to leave there was no luggage room so we had to take our bags the train station and our train wasnt for another 8 hours wouldnt recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a few more dollars and save yourself from Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Lisac2333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Central Park Hotel for one night while on our way to Paris from London. It was probably the worst experience I ever had. The hotel looked nice from the outside but once you walked in the service was appauling! When we finally got to our room it was horrible. Everything was dirty, it was freezing cold, there was mold growing on the ceiling and their was urine all over the bathroom floor. Since it was late and we were only staying there to sleep we decided to stay in the room. When we woke up the next morning we were itching and covered in red bumps. There were bed bugs in the bed! When we went to go check out the staff was completely unhelpful and didn't even ask how our stay was. Plus the entire hotel smelled like gasoline. I would NEVER return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor accomodations”
Reviews.Author: wombat38
Reviews.Content: My wife, I and our 26 yr. old daughter stayed in a "triple" room, which was really too small for the three of us. The carpeting was dirty, the staff surly, the concierges ignorant, and the housekeepers kept forgetting to put toiletries and tea in the room. Internet access charges are very high, though there are inexpensive internet cafes nearby. No way would I call it a three star hotel. On the other hand, the location is great, and there are many good eating places in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cdocPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: A wonder hotel, situated in the queensway-noting hill gate area. Across the street from the park, with numerous shops and restuarants. The hotel was great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: MP-Copenhagen
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel The first time was with at travelling group and i chose it for my single trip, not because it was wonderfull but because of its location. My room was smaller than the first time but the fridge worked in this room. The hairdryer however broke down after 1 minute. The bartender was very nice, but spoke very poorly english. Last year it was possible to store the luggage for a few hours after checking out, but this year it was not...When i told the staff they said they had been building. Fortunately you can store your luggage in most train stations arround. I dont know weather or not i should recommend the hotel. Some have bad experiences whit noisy neighbours but not me. Others talk about rude crew, but again not me. If you just need at place to sleep in a convenient location you can stay there. But if you want a romantic hotel whith atmosphere, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt recommend this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lastsplash
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room which was small but Ok. We only had a pillow each , i rang reception who advised they would another up. they didnt. There was an electricity box between the twin beds which had a buzzing noise , very irritating and difficult to sleep with. The next day, we asked to be moved and we were moved to a room 2 doors down which hadnt been cleaned yet. that was Ok and we left for the day. This room was smaller, there were no towels. i rang reception who said they would send some up.. they didnt. we rang housekeeping and a nice lady brought some up quickly. We stayed for 2 nights in this room. There also was a buzzing electricity box between the bed, but worse was the noise from the room next door. the walls must be paper thin!! the people next door came in at 4am, i could her them talking and coughing all night as if they were in the room with us. it was crystal clear. they werent shouting but i could hear their every word. the same story the following night only that they were in earlier.. i was very tired on departing this hotel. The breakfast is not worth going down to. we had paid extra ( £7.50) each per day for a "full english" which was horrible. we ate very little of it. The Hotel looks nice exterior wise and Bayswater is nice to stay in. the area has nice food places and is close to 2 tube stations. but i could never stay here again unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: Gladiator7
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was quite pleasant. The hotel is very near to the Hyde Park. Also it is just 2-3mins walk from the queenstown station, so it becomes esy to travel in london. There is also a casino nearby. The hotel has good rooms and the service is also average. I just had the breakfast there which was quite average. The rooms at the ground floor are very good, one of which i was staying in. The best part of this hotel is that it is located just 1 min from the hyde park. One can easily have a good walk in the park whenever he feels like. Overall a good hotel for people coming for business visits and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Its Good for the Price and Location...”
Reviews.Author: JPHMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: I agree with most others regarding the check in, it took us ages to be served at reception and the reception staff just went through a basic check in service no smiles, thank you etc but saying that the reception area is very clean and tidy. When I got to room 538 (twin) the safe was locked and required attention, there was no towels in the room and the telephone does not work to alert reception. However within 20 minutes the safe was open and the towels provided (still no telephone) The room was very basic BUT for the price and location I was happy with what I got, the staff are not really friendly they are more like robots carrying out a series of tasks and the bar prices are high as you would expect. I was dissapointed that I could not get anything to eat about 12:00am (no night porter room service) I realise I am painting a poor picture of this hotel but I want you to know the poor side of it before you book, however that said I really didn't think it was that bad as 90% of problems were resolved within 30 minutes and yes I would stay here again. The location is only 3 - 5 minutes walk from Queensway Tube station, this is excellent! There is an indian over the road as you walk out of hotel reception.

Reviews.Title: “london at leisure 09/24/09-10/03/09”
Reviews.Author: sandseekerNepa
Reviews.Content: Everyone should visit london, England. We flew with Virgin Atlantic out of Newark, NJ. What a great airline. Arrived Heathrow airport 9:30am. Took Heathrow Express(bought tickets at airport) to Tube Station. Bought Tube pass for entire stay(you can get on/off as many times a day as you like). Arrived at hotel around 11am. Stayed at the Central Park Hotel in Bayswater. Bayswater is basically in the Kennsington/Notting Hill area. Beautiful area to stay and would highly recommend this area, but not this hotel. The hotel room was very small(like an inside cabin of a cruise ship). Luckily we had a large window that we kept open the entire trip. Bed was very uncomfortable. Walls are very thin. You can hear everything going on in the next room and doors slamming shut all night. We would stay somewhere else the next visit in this particular area. Weather was beautiful! Sunny and low 70's. Perfect. Took the tube everywhere. Very clean and very easy to use. Visited all the sights, Clock tower/Big Ben/Parliament, London eye, Westminster Abbey, Buckingham Palace, St James Park, Tower Brige, Tower of London(did the ceremony of keys at night-book online early).Visited the British Museum(our fav-Rosetta Stone is here), the National Gallery(my fav), Trafalgar Square, Abbey Road, etc. Loved Camden Lock area. Back to the 80's. Took the Eurostar train (booked online for $104 ea person) to Paris. Great day trip. Took the subway to Eiffel Tower, the Lourve and Arc D' Triumph. The highlights of Paris in one day. Also visited the Rodin Museum. Loved the thinker. We took the early train(around 5am and got the 8:30 train back). We didnt need a tour guide in London. We booked everything ourselves and loved that we had time to stroll around the parks and have a glass of wine and relax. We loved London. I cant say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “a shame about the cheap look and feel”
Reviews.Author: t800
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not to bad. But it could give a lot better feel with only a few modifications. Now you are constantly reminded that you are staying in a budget place. a few examples : * TV, there is one, but i could only find BBC's and a few foreing channels. forget about cnn cartoons ect. * Bathroom, chrome was completly worn off from taps , plug in sink was not working. * Breakfeast , the size of glasses besides the juice dispencer makes you think they are serving spirits there. So if your thirsty either camp the dispencer or take a lot of walks back an to your table. The juice is not fresh , but comes form plastic bags , so i dont know why they do this anyway. There is a man dressed as a chef cook who serves heated canned tomatos , beans and sossages for english breakfeast. He also serves as a "guard" for the slices of cheese and ham for wich you have to pay extra if you want them with you "continental" breakfeast. The lobby is empty , no tourist info or brochures in sight. All in all , i got the distinct impression i got the"ryanair" experience without ever flying :) I would have felt cheated if i payed more then 100 a night for it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small rooms and Siberian service!”
Reviews.Author: Yodah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park Hotel and have been very disappointed. It needs to be said that it´s location is excellent, next to Hyde Park and walking distance to Nottinghill. Check-in however was ice-cold due to mostly East-European staff who did not smile, just performing robot-like actions. Although I had B&B confirmed, I was told that I had to pay 5 pounds extra for ham and cheese or 7.50 pound for hot items. Rediculous, so I declined. They informed me after having swiped my credit card already, so I could not get out of the hotel anymore. The room was very small, think cruiseship cabins with similar size TV with mostly Arab and BBC channels. No CNN or international stations. Housekeeping was good though, with daily fresh towels and soap. Internet access had a surcharge. Breakfast was a depressing experience in a room with long communcal tables and no natural light or music. It reminded me of Prison Break. It consisted of bread, butter, jam and cereals. Nothing more unless you ´upgraded´ to ham and cheese or sausages. Again, the cold and silent staff did not add to a pleasant experience. The one exception was the evening concierge, a wonderful knowledageable chap who was of great assistance and made a difference. They should put him in charge of the facility. Unless you get a very good deal (50 pounds or less), I would not stay here. And if you do, don´t contract breakfast. Instead, go to the many restaurants, sidewalk cafes and pubs nearby and enjoy breakfast with a view on Hyde Park (Cafe Diana for instance, filled with pictures of the late Princess of Wales). Probably cheeper and defintely more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Matt7575
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year when we go to the Challenge Cup Final. Although the hotel is nothing special, the rooms are nice and looked after. I'm not a big fan of London but the hotel is very nice for the price. It's in an ideal situation with Hyde Park and Kensington Palace just over the road, and the Royal Albert Hall is just a quick 10-15minute walk straight through Hyde Park. There are also 2 Tube stations nearby so you're not that far away from the rest of London, There's plenty of multi-cultural restaurants & cafes no more than 2 minutes away, and for those who like a drink or two there's plent of pubs & bars as well. The only snag with this hotel is the breakfast. It's not worth paying the price for what you get. So we go to a pizza place rond the corner that does an all you can eat buffet breakfast for £5 which is absolutely gorgeous. I would recommend this hotel to those looking for somewhere that's not too near to London centre but has enough going on around it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice accommodation”
Reviews.Author: jelipe
Reviews.Content: Clean and spacious room. Rather quiet although on ground floor. Reception staff was friendly but rather disorganized and slow. Booked a single room but got a big twin room so it was comfortable. Great value for money. High standard for London.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location ....”
Reviews.Author: Ottavian
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews for this hotel before and after we stayed there last week. It is interesting to note how expectations and assessments of travelers vary. However, some of the comments were right on target. We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Booked over the Internet .We needed just a place to sleep after days spent in London. The greatest asset of this hotel is its location. Close to two underground stations. In addition, nearby Queensway offers everything that travelers may need. Maybe we were lucky, but we completed check-in and check-out in 4 minutes. Everything worked as expected. Room was not very big but offered us enough space to unpack. The kettle and the fridge worked. I was fighting with the safe in the room. Went to the reception and John immediately went with me back upstairs to show me how the safe works. I was really happily surprised. Cleaning personal does not speak English at all, but the supervisor does. The first day the cleaning lady entered the room bringing some extra stuff to the bathroom without knocking the door at least twice. Not very nice experience, if your wife is staying naked at the middle of the room. Reception stuff was helpful, very rarely smiling however. Breakfast. Yes, it is plain but eatable. And what do you expect for the price? Small juice glasses that were already mentioned here several times. Do not complain, just make an extra trip to the juice machine. Very friendly, helpful and smiling stuff in the dining area. One really bad thing already mentioned by at least two travelers: bed bugs. We were bitten and we found several bugs marching on the walls. The hotel HAS to do something about that, I am afraid. Internet: go to the internet cafe at the hostel close to the bus stop at Bayswater Road, three minutes from the hotel. In summary: We may try this hotel again if we are in London, however at first we will ask them about the bed bugs and we will check the Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Caution --- bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Timothy1965
Reviews.Content: I found most of the aspect of this hotel satisfactory. Didn't use any services or spend time except to sleep. Convenient location, staff seemed nice. But my wife was eaten by bedbugs! I can't speak about the entire hotel, but Room 446 was infested. I saw on another site a review from a month ago that said there were bedbugs in the very same room, which suggests real negligence. I understand that they are difficult to get rid of, but surely that guest and others before and since have mentioned the problem. Even if the hotel took no action to get rid of the bugs, it seems perverse to keep putting people in that room at least. Under the cincumstances, I can't recommend, because who knows what one will get?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: bluehen2001
Reviews.Content: After staying at a similarly priced hotel in the same neighborhood, I switched to this hotel and it was a drastic improvement over the shanty I was staying in. For 52 pounds a night, the room is clean and comfortable (people saying small clearly haven't stayed at a London budget-friendly hotel before) with a spacious bathroom. It is 2 blocks from Queensway tube station - awesome for transporting luggage easily. My only complaint would be the lack of a luggage/baggage facility. Since checkout was at 12, I had to take my bags then - would have been inconvenient if my flight home was in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice outside ONLY”
Reviews.Author: lilytan
Reviews.Content: Breakfast very minimal - tea and bread Rooms are a little old. Not happy that there is no storage for luggages. We have to store at Victoria Station while waiting for our night flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean room. A lovely base to explore London”
Reviews.Author: gstravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: We used the room primarily as a base to explore London in a one week trip. The hotel staff was very accommodating about our repeatedly changing our booking to get the best rates possible. The weekday rates were very attractive at around 60 GBP a day (no breakfast). The room is a simple, no frills room with a safe, a tiny television and a mini fridge. The room and bathroom were very clean which was really all we needed. We arrived early and the staff was quickly found us a room by 9:00 AM even though our check in time was 1:00 PM. We asked for a non-basement room at the back of the hotel. So we did not have any problem with the noise. The room got fairly stuffy at night if you closed the windows, so we had to leave the windows open all the time. But the heating was quite effective and the blankets warm, so that did not really pose a problem. Good things about the hotel: 1. Location: As a tourist, this was an amazing location, just within 5-8 minute walk of two London underground stations and within 5 tube stops of most famous London attraction. Also within walking distance is the lovely Protobello market. The hotel is also a pickup point for many coach tours 2. Cleanliness: The rooms are very clean as is the bathroom. I'm quite allergic to dust and the blankets never caused me to sneeze, that meant they were really clean. The sheets and towels looked like they were changed daily. 3.Comfort: The room was warm and cozy with comfortable beds. If you shut the windows, it did get stuffy- but we were lucky and had good weather through the trip, so the windows just stayed open. I thought it was a fair sized room, but my friend thought it a bit small. Things I did not like about the hotel: 1. No luggage room: If you have a late flight out, there's no luggage room you can leave your bags at. Carrying our bags around on the last day was a bit uncomfortable 2. No lunch/dinner served: The hotel does not serve lunch or dinner- luckily we were prepared for this and so made arrangements 3. Rude staff: While the folks at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful, the hotel manager and housekeeping staff were quite rude. Though I must say the housekeeping staff were very honest. We were careless enough to leave the safe open with quite a sum of money in it one day and not a penny was missing when we returned. If you plan to use the hotel only as a base to explore London, i.e. you won't really be spending your day at the hotel- it'd just be a place to crash at night, then I really recommend the hotel. It's a great location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Between Average and Poor for tight budget.”
Reviews.Author: daisy_op
Reviews.Content: I'm always trying to be positive about things especially during vacation, but have to comment about this place. The biggest minus of this hotel is a lack of restaurant. No, really, why wouldn't they have a small, neat place to eat?! There are pubs in the area, but I wouldn't suggest going there. The bar located in the lounge is very poor in selection. Continental breakfast is TERRIBLE!!! Location: close to underground. Other than that - big NO, NO!!! Rooms are very small and isolation is terrible. Cleenliness is poor. The fridge door was broken. Although front desk staff are nice, the service is very poor. However, if you are on a tight budget and planning to stay in a hotel room only to sleep, that's the hotel you can book a room at. Rooms were taken care of every day, nothing got stolen and overall we didn't run into any serious issues.

Reviews.Title: “What You Need to Prepare Yourself for When Booking Here”
Reviews.Author: L0vet0Travel79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my dad and sister for 5 days. Here's the list of problems with the hotel... and then some advises and good news for those, who already booked there - Rooms are extremely tiny, dated, noisy (due to thin walls and windows that don't shut tightly), and draughty- so plan your trip in such way that you don't stay in them for anything other than sleeping. - There are no basic hotel commodities, such as swimming pool, gym, normal bar (theirs is tiny, fully lit, with no selection, and unfriendly staff). So if for some reason you have to stay in, you are going to die of boredom... - There is no restaurant (other than for breakfast), so if, after a day of exploring London onf foot, you feel like a quiet dinner not far from 'home' so that you can crush right after, you are either going to go to bed hungry, or have to travel some more. - If you are intending to eat out in the neighbourhood, however, you are out of luck also... The area is extremaly touristy, so if you are looking for decent food, you might need to take subway to nicer areas around London. We could not find any decent restaurant around the area... just dingy dives, with staff not caring to provide decent service. Thankfully, the location is very close (10-15 min) to a lot of nicer areas, and you are also very close to all tourists' attractions. - Service at the hotel... Not the friendliest bunch, but if you command your way in stern manner, they tend to accomodate. We needed extra pillows and requested them. Did not get them up until next day, and after we had to ask for them again, and received a call from front desk with an inquiry as to why do we require more pillows (???)... they also did not provide us with extra blankets... apparently, they don't have any (???), so they brought heater, which smelled like something died and burned inside it. - Food (cold breakfast). If you like tasteless bread and disgusting coffee- go ahead and enjoy. My advise to those of you, who don't, go to the near by Qeenstreet and get yourself tea/instant coffee, sugar, milk, some fresh baguettes, and cheese, and have your own breakfast in the comfort of your room. There is a fridge and kettle in the room, so if you are not lazy, for very cheap you can cater to your own needs. - The best thing about the place is that it is extremely close to major attractions, and unterground is just 3-5 minutes walk from it. Also, it is relatively inexpensive. If you can, change your reservations to some other place. If not, do yourself a favor, take all the cosmetic/bath necessities with yourself (the ones provided at the hotel are not good), get some compact air freshner, your own face towel, and ear plugs... and most importantly, have an open mind. You are not there for the hotel. London is one of the nicer cities in the world, and there is not enough time in the day to see everything, so just spend most of the time out, and enjoy every moment of it:)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in a good location and very close to the underground station”
Reviews.Author: tinneydonna
Reviews.Content: At first when i read the reviews i did not want to stay in the hotel. I am a young person with a boyfriend and we found the hotel to be very clean and the staff very friendly always there to help if i asked any questions.. Yes they are right that they do not hold luggage but most hotels do not hold luggage.. why check out at 9 if you have nowhere to leave your bags. We checked out at 12. i got up early in the morning and went shopping, i then went back to the hotel for 11.45 to pack, so that i did not have to bring luggage around the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Concierge Need Training in Servicing the Public”
Reviews.Author: Emma058
Reviews.Content: We travelled back to London with my husband this time in tow. I was appalled at the service at this hotel. When I asked the concierge at what time my pick up was to catch the 6:30am train to Edinburgh; he told me at 8:00am . I explained that could not be possible and if he could kindly call the tour company I would appreciate it. His response was that since I did not buy the tour from him , there was no way he was telephoning to get the time. My safe in the room had low battery light on; when I requested if the battery had been changed in order for me to put my travel documents in ; no one could give me an answer because the housekeeping staff had gone home. As I was leaving the elevator, to go to my second floor room when I overheard a supervisor berate one of the cleaning staff for stealing from the rooms. To add insulate to injury, we had to slam the door to close it; needless to say my daughter slammed it and the top flat piece of moulding came crashing down. She took it down to the front desk. 15 minutes later the repair man walks into our room. He did not knock just put his key in the door and opened it. This hotel is definitely not the Thistle Kensington Gardens where I stayed in December.

Reviews.Title: “honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateTosh
Reviews.Content: Good price / quality hotel. Very good location. Rooms have good space and clean. Only bad thing about hotel: no aircondition in rooms. Staff is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rotripper
Reviews.Content: I saw it's rating and clasification on Booking.com, where it is listed at 4* and somehow I have missed the fact that it is 3* on otel.com, but, still, it does not even deserve 2*. I was expecting a somehow decent 3* hotel with small rooms, although I thought is 4*, but once I've got there, all my worst expectations were exceeded. I could hear people from all surrounding rooms (even upstairs and downstairs) even whispering, the noise trough those thin cardbord walls was infernal. The room was "cleaned" daily, but in 8 days they did not once change the sheets. No air conditioning, although there are deceiving signs of it. The TV is even smaller than a room that small could have. They have no luggage room, so if you have to leave the luggage for a couple of hours, they charge you 20 pounds (25 euros) for that. It is the most horrible hotel I have ever stayed in in my life and I wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemies. Great location though, but there are many other hotels in that area, so please choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel - do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: davidb72
Reviews.Content: This has got to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. I booked a triple room for my friends and I. When I entered the reception area I got a very bad feeling. The bedroom was really small - it looked like a throw back to the '70's, what with the dated wallpaper and bed linen. There was no air conditioning in the room, which seems ridiculous considering the warm summers London generally experiences. The bathroom was also tiny. My friends and I decided we couldn't stay there so we checked ourselves into the Thistle Hyde Park, just down the road on Baywater Road (which I would highly recommend). When we asked to cancel our booking for our second night we were asked did we book the room via the internet. We said "yes" and were then told to go downstairs and pay the £1 fee to access the internet to cancel the booking. It seemed incredible to me that reservations could not cancel this but we did so. Luckily, we didn't spend much time in the hotel. The next morning we went down for breakfast and it was disgusting. Everything in the English breakfast was soaking in grease. The dining area was also drab and dark. We checked out soon after and I was billed in Euro rather than Sterling. I asked why would I want to pay for in Euro while in the UK. I was told that the system charged me in Euro as I came from the Eurozone. Another way to rip people off with fluctuations in exchange rates if you ask me. I would implore people not to stay in this hotel. There are far better hotels such as the Thistle Hyde Park with similar price tags.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for exploring London”
Reviews.Author: Dennis021
Reviews.Content: Upon reading reviews of this hotel in London, we noticed that most complaints were about the poor English spoken by most of the staff and the not so luxurious breakfast. On the other hand, the price was right, and the hotel was located quite conveniently for exploring London. We took our chances and booked a stay for three nights at this hotel. Upon arriving, we found the staff to be helpful with our luggage. Strangely enough, the girl at the desk spoke Dutch, our mothertongue, but would only address us in English. The room was recently renovated and clean, including the bathroom. The only drawback was that the room was located on the ground floor, which meant that it was impossible to open a window. The street in front of the hotel was quiet at nighttime, although the walls between the rooms were quite thin. Breakfast was alright if you expect nothing more than a basic meal to get you started. The staff's English wasn't always perfect, but then again, nor is ours! They were always very helpful, friendly and understandable. The hotel's best feature is its location. It's located close to two major underground lines, which take you to the centre of London in no time. Furthermore, the hotel was located nearby a street with inexpensive restaurants and supermarkets, which is nice if you are on a budget. All in all, we really liked the hotel for the price it was offering. The most important to us is that it is clean and conveniently located, and the hotel met those two demands perfectly. We would certainly recommend it to travellers on a budget who don't want to stay in a dingy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Ripoff in the UK”
Reviews.Author: JWMinUK
Reviews.Content: Because we had booked a tour to France that only picked up at certain hotels, we were forced to book this place. We paid over $200 cdn per night for a small, grundgy room. Every other hotel and B&B we staryed at in the UK at least gave you free shortbread and a breakfast. Bathroom was run down, shower bar was rusty, carpet was dirty. As an added bonus, parking was not included and cost 1pnd 50 p per hour. I realize that because you are in the core that things will be more costly, but that does not excuse the shabby condition of the place. It was a sad sendoff to an otherwise great trip. Avoid this place at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expecting”
Reviews.Author: Idocare
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was worried however was happy with the accomodations. True the decor is dated, continental breakfast in minimal but staff were friendly and back side of hotel doesn't face a street so quiter, particularly if you sleep with a window open for fresh air. Loaction is it's best feature and unless you plan to stay inside the room was clean and service acceptable. I would recommend this place for what it is advertised as a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok For A Base”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Girl74
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was very worried about my stay here but the only thing that was true was the small room. I had a double room facing the back of the hotel onto the private houses which I think was better than the front of the hotel as it was not noisy at all and I had the window wide open. The room was clean and tidy the decor was dated but I have seen worse. The 'continental breakfast' was cereal, toast, crossiant with tea/coffee preserve and a shot glass of orange or apple juice. The staff were friendly and we requested two more pillows which they delivered within 10 mins. Not a bad hotel really similar to a travel lodge. Great location for tube stations and busses to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: ccc1138
Reviews.Content: I've never really had an outstanding London hotel experience. This hotel, yes, great location for the tubes. BUT, it's a loud neighborhood with all hotels around so you hear everything. Since there's no AC, you have to have the window open. The lobby is nice, the rooms are typical British rooms, small, stuffy and a tad shabby. The staff is good and dealt with my problem of my phone not working. In London, you just want a reasonable priced room and place where your stuff isn't stolen. Don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like second class citizens!”
Reviews.Author: theholl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location and looked great from the outside. The receptionist checked our booking and gave us our room number, however he did not know where the room was and had to ask a manager! That should have set off warning bells. We were treated like second class citizens and given a room almost underground. There were approx six rooms in this area. The room was TINY and had no windows obviously. I stayed with my son and it was the worst room we ever stayed in and I stay in hotels on a weekly basis for my job. The fact that we only had to stay in the hotel for a few hours and that we were tired meant complaining was pointless. The breakfast was awful and reception was not helpfull. This room was not cheap but it was booked through a hotel booking website. The ONLY positive about the hotel is its location. DO NOT stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel - don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Aus-gal-99
Reviews.Content: The staff were rude and not helpful. We had cockroaches in our room. Our room was situated in the dirty basement. Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “An excellant value of money”
Reviews.Author: DHafez
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel over the net for GBP60 per room per night without breakfast, I thought the room will be a tiny one like all London hotels, putting into account also the rate butfor my surprise the room was quite big which was unexpected, the bathroom was basic a bit old but clean. The service was excellent we arrived at 10:00 a.m. and the reception staff was kind enough to check us in, we asked for a baby cot, we received immediately a very new and clean one). The location is really good very close to both Queensborough and bayswater tube stations. I didn't have a chance to visit the Hyde Park since my visit was really short but the hotel is few steps from it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel, good service, breakfast not bad”
Reviews.Author: PSKIND
Reviews.Content: As with the other reviewers I would rate the location of this hotel is very convenient; close to two tube stations - Bayswater ans Queensway. Queensway is closer but there are good tube connections from Bayswater e.g. to Paddington. You may need to use Paddinton station as there is no luggage storage facility in the hotel (for check-in or check-out) and the closest station with LeftLuggage facility is Paddington station. This is a big nuisance and which I did mention to the hotel staff. Rooms are small but clean. For 70 pounds a night this is a good hotel that provided fairlly good continental breakfast (no cooked food). Internet connection is expensive 45 pounds/week or 5 pounds/hour or 12 pounds/24 hours. Staff were courteous and they quickly shifted me to another room when the first one they gave did not have a good view. Overall I am happy with the hotel and would like to stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Unremarkable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: staree
Reviews.Content: Great proximity to 2 tube stations and Hyde park. Room was very small, furniture and bedcovers were very old. However the room was cleaned every day. Male staff at reception were friendly and helpful. We felt the young female staff on reception in the evening were bored, un-helpful and laughing at the guests. They said they would send someone to show us how to use the safe after we requested in person once and phoned twice... but they never did. They also glared at me and my friends each time we passed... making us feel very unwelcome. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “worst”
Reviews.Author: friis
Reviews.Content: i wrote this to them. sorry for the miss spelling. I came with my friend for 2 nights to your hotel.( 9.6.09-11.6.09) First we thought "what a nice hotell, clean and fresh" , but it wasn't near that at all when we came to the room. we qued to check in for over 10-15 minutes! and there were about 5-6 working people behind the desk, and just ONE was checking in people. And that girl didn't even know what she was doing! i work also in costumer service so i know when its bad service. and centralpark hotel had the worst service ive ever seen. even mc donald's had better service. then when it was our turn she didn't even know what she was supposed to do, asked the other girls many times. and anwsered the phone twice! at the same time she was suposed to serve us. that's really rude. well this didn't end there.we came down and sayed that our blanket stinked like puke!! they told us that they are going to send some one up to our room. No one came!! and its not our duty to ask again. then we came and asked for a "plug connector" and the girl sayed that they dont have. we asked again and she sayed no. then a man behind the other desk told us that they have one! (very lazy costumer service everytime we came and asked something, it seemed that they dont care about the costumers or theyr job) toilet was clean, and im happy about that. but hole room was really.. cheap.. bad bed the windows didn't close properly, tv was really small.
