The most annoing thing was the walls!! first night we heard a cupple doing it. we heard everything!! next morning our "neighbor" talked on the phone and we heard every word he sayed. and it was REALLY early in the morning. we didn't sleep good, i slept for 2 nights just about 8 hours. I usually dont write feedback if its small things. that's just unnecessary nagging. felt like we put TOO much money at your hotel. and the tube strike tops our trip. we had a really bad holiday. I'm never coming to this hotel again its not worth the money when u dont get servise and the rooms are in really bad shape. we had the worst 3 days ever on a holiday, im not kidding it was that bad. we talked to a few people who was staying at your hotel and they where also dissapointed at your costumer service. so its not just us. the only good service was from the bar and concierge (chinese guy) they should get a rise becouse they where the only once that wanted to serve us and cared about us.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleasantly surprised with everything!”
Reviews.Author: Nabob9
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 7th floor was bright, spotlessly clean and roomy enough to feel at home for 7 nights. The lobby, bar and breakfast room were also impecable and the staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly the "Bar" girls. The location was excellent, right across from Kensington Gardens and Palace, Hyde Park, really close to bus and tube transporation, ideal for a couple of seniors!

Reviews.Title: “Good value great location”
Reviews.Author: DeebeeLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Having read a series of unfavourable reviews of this hotel after I had booked I was a little worried about staying there. This was for a short three day stay during half term with my 8 year old son. As I was travelling alone I needed a central location in a decent area of London. This hotel provided just that. I found the reception staff to be efficent it took around five minutes to check in and less to check out. The room was comfortable and whilst not huge was fine for my self and my son. Having read poor reviews of the breakfasts we took our own croissants and there is a fridge in every room so we supplemented our breakfast with cheese and yogurt. IIf a cooked breakfast is high on your list of priorities there are numerous cafes and restaurants five minutes away on Queensway. can't comment on the breakfasts, but I found all of the other negative comments that I had read to be unfounded. The rooms were spotless and were cleaned and replenished everyday, all amenities were as described. I have stayed in more luxurious hotels but I have also paid the price for them as well, this room was had at a budget price particularly for such a great location, five minutes from two tube stations, 5 minutes from Hyde Park and five mins from a bus stop serving central London. My only reservation would be the unpleasant instant coffee that is left in the room, if coffee is your thing you may want to take your own supply or visit one of the nearby coffee shops, but this really is a small quibble. I cannot find any real faults with this hotel, it is not the Dorchester, but if you were not planning on spending hundreds or thousands of pounds per night then this hotel is fine. I felt safe staying there and walking back in the early hours after a theatre trip with my young son, I had no problems with the staff or any amenities and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aya_Ob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in central park hotel 3 times, the location is excellent 3 minutes away from the queensway tube station, 1 minute from the bus station, just cross the street and you will be in kesington park. the rooms are very small but last time i went they gave us relatively a bigger room. I wouldn't recommend their breakfeast so you could just buy your gorcery from Tesco or spar super market near buy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some faults”
Reviews.Author: JazboOttawa
Reviews.Content: I had to laugh when I read the other two most recent reviews. They both nailed it. The Central Park Hotel on Queensborough is clean, safe, a great location and good value for the money. Originally we were given a room with twin beds, we asked for a double and were moved immediately, we asked for extra hangars and were given a few extra. Being on the ground floor with sealed windows we had to have the A/C on almost all the time. The housekeeping staff are wonderful, extra towels, spotless room etc. The continental breakfast is crap, cold cereal, stale bread and a few old rolls, the so-called upgrade breakfast buffet looked horrible, it sat out from very early in the morning. The front desk staff, very helpful, but never said hello or made eye contact, which I think is their inability to speak English. Once a request was mad it was filled immediately! As mentioned in one of the most recent reviews, the Asian fellow did not speak much English, was very unhelpful and dare I say, rude, or very stupid. We asked him to confirm our Gatwick shuttle and he told us to go find a computer and e-mail them!!!!! On the up side, 2 blocks away is the Queensway, 2 tube stations (different lines) dozens of restaurants, stores of every variety, laundry, PUBS, news agents...............anything you need or want to do is there. Two blocks south is Kensington Park, a few blocks west is Notting Hill. I do recommend this hotel, but find an alternative to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Westgalady
Reviews.Content: Room was bare but clean. Top floor room was very hot and we had to leave windows open. However, building across the street is undergoing major update and there is a lot of jackhammer sound during daylight hours. "Free" breakfast was a joke. Hard rolls, butter and jam. Coffee. That's it. No fruit, no cheese, no deli ham like in most continental breakfasts in Europe. Upgrade for additional $ to mid and higher breakfasts were no better. I paid for the best breafast available and got 1 TBS of scrambled powdered eggs, and server would not give me any more. Front desk workers were not friendly, not helpful, and ignored people standing there. Most workers were new and some didn't speak a lot of English. Front desk not organized and made people wait long times when there was no reason. Bathroom was tiny. My 6'2' travel partner couldn't even stand up straight in the shower. There were no towel racks or hooks in the bathroom. I had to lay my new clothes in the sink so I would have them nearby after a shower. The room had one electrical outlet with two places to plug in. They charge about $40 us per day for internet; save your money and go to any McDonald's in London for free internet. Location was very close to two tube stations and lots of restaurants and souvenir stores. Noise level was fairly quiet at night except for some live jazz nearby. If we closed the windows (double pane) the room was quiet. HOWEVER, the room had a radiator that always gave off some heat even when it was turned as low as possible. Because of the constant heat in the room at night, we had to suffer with outside sounds and have the windows open. After the 2nd night I asked the front desk for a fan and they did bring one for us to use. Otherwise, the room would have been impossible to say in at night. I wouldn't stay there again. ALTHOUGH, if a clean room is what you're looking for and you don't care if it's small or the workers are rude, then you might be OK here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - Desk Staff Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: FrugalFrannie
Reviews.Content: Within the last 3 years I've stayed at another budget-level hotel in Bayswater, so I'm writing about this hotel with that one as a comparison. LOCATION: Good in that it is about 2-3 blocks from two tube stations which are on different tube lines. There was construction blocking most of the street that the hotel is on, so I don't know how busy it usually is. FRONT DESK: This hotel had a conceirge desk, but they weren't helpful. The concierge from Asia seemed as though he wanted to help, but his accent was so thick that I could not understand one word in ten. The other concierge appeared to be from the Middle East, and he didn't want to help. I came down once to ask a question. There was no one else at his desk but me. Rather than say, "May I call Housekeeping for you?" - which would have let me know that it was a Housekeeping issue, but he was willing to be helpful - he told me to call Housekeeping. The entire front desk seems to be learning how to do their jobs, and they ignore people. They didn't even tell me how to turn on the lights in the room. (The room key is put in a holder right inside the door. This lets the light be turned on, and, when you remove your door key to leave, it turns them off.) This took me a few minutes to figure out, and it would have been nice if the front desk informed me of this. There was usually a free newspaper near the desk. Occasionally the Financial Times, but usually one of the free ones you get at the Tube stations. NO LUGGAGE STORAGE! ROOM: Big, but that could be because the trumble bed under my bed would make the room a triple. There was a small refrigerator in the room. It didn't work, but when I called, a newer one was put in. (It only kept things cool, but it was nice to have one.) On what Americans would call the 3rd floor, in a room facing the front, I could hear traffic from Bayswater Road, so I suggest ear plugs. One evening I heard some loud people outside, but it was only for a short period of tiem. There was one drawer in the room, and that was a small one in the nightstand. There were only four hangers in the closet, and Housekeeping would only let me have two more. (This is for two people in the room.) The TV remote threw me. (You click a number to turn it on, but hit the power switch to turn it off. When I called, someone came and showed me how to use it. There was a tub and a shower head. It was a bit of a climb to get in the tub, and it tended to be slippery. There were no places to hang clothes or towels, but the water pressure was good, and there was lots of hot water. HOUSEKEEPING: They did an acceptable job of cleaning, and were quick to bring an extra blanket and pillow when I called. MEALS: I didn't use the bar, the restaurant, or room service. The breakfast that came with the room consisted of cereal (three types), toast, dinner rolls, croissants, coffee, and SMALL cups that held about two ounces of OJ, apple juice, or milk. You're greated by an attractive lobby when you enter, too bad the behavior of the front desk staff/conceirge staff isn't as attractive. The woman who was in the breakfast rooms most mornings, and took the breakfast passes was pleasant, as were the men who replaced the fridge, and the one who showed me how to use the TV remote control.

Reviews.Title: “not ever again”
Reviews.Author: sterndlibutzer
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself looked quite pretty when we got there, however when we wanted to check in no one wanted to help us. it felt like we were a burden to them.. the room was super tiny and there was hair in the bathroom, but the sheets smelled fresh and looked clean. breakfast was ok as well, they did not offer much, just bread, toast, jam and honey. the worst experience we had at the hotel was the check out process. the girl at the front desk had no idea how to check someone out, that wouldnt be too bad (I was a trainee at a hotel myself) but she can tell us that, instead she kept talking to her colleague in a foreign language so we were not sure what they were talking about, so we felt really uncomfortable. Suddenly, she said goodbye and turn her bato us, we guessed we checked out successfully. When we asked the girl for further info she looked at us funny and say, "ask the concierge", just like that and turned away. WOW how rude was that... Additionally, the hotel does not have a luggage room, so no place store your luggage, instead you have to travel all the way to paddington station and pay 8pounds per piece to store your luggage. the concierge, although having a clefs d'or pin, was rude and not helpful at all. def. doesnt deserve the pin! despite the small room and the minimal breakfast we would have recommended the hotel, BUT the staff was sooooo extremely rude, we would NEVER return or send anyone there, ever. P.S. the internet prices were ridiculous!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER!!!! Try Hotel INDIGO instead!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wendy11234567
Reviews.Content: owful stuff, rude, even try to steel from me my sun glasses while having the riduculous , breakfast seemed a joke. old food, really couldn't eat it.....not worth a penny....have seen the new Indigo Hotel nearby, same price but...wonderful all over!! would never reccomend this mouse trap to anyone.... plenty of nice places in london and, in addition, no luggage store, so you have to carry your luggage with you even if you have a late flight...in London this is simply not what you expect from a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: UptownGirl24
Reviews.Content: Hotel: The hotel is situated 5 minutes from 2 central stations on the London Tube, Bayswater and Queensland. The speciality of this hotel is it's location. It is exactly 5 minutes from one of London's most happening areas for night life!!! ANd equally cool area for window shopping. The Park is 5 minutes walk too! SO if you are a tourist looking for a central location, this is the place. Rooms: Decently good rooms, spacious, with good view. Clean, with all basic amenities. Even though the hotel is very close to the main street... it's peaceful and marks for a good stay. Food: The breakfast spread was good... and no complains in that regard. Service: The service in terms of bell boys could have been slightly better. The staff wasn't very friendly. But, if you are a tourist looking for a good time, and looking for a simple abode in one of the heppest localities of London, then this is the place. Over all, a cool, affordable place to live... with a great location and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lowend
Reviews.Content: I don't agree with the negative reviews. We spent 4 nights in the hotel and everything was just fine. The room and bathroom was small but clean. They cleaned every room every day. The staff was kind and polite. I can only recommend this hotel to everyone. 2 negative things -the breakfast is a joke -there is no luggage room

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a few problems with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: GEvans14
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfreind stayed at this hotel was good value for money... good location and very helpful staff. the second night we where there the lights in the room wouldnt come on we told reception and they sent some one up straight away after not being able to resolve the problem they moved us to a twin room, after being offerd for the staff to push the beds together we said we will do it, when doing this a big bug came out from under the bed, this wasnt very nice so we searched the room before going to sleep to check there where no more and there wasnt. overall i think the location of the hotel was good, the price was good, food was ok staff very helpful, it was a nice looking hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in a good location near tube stations”
Reviews.Author: orientfan16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and overall it was a pleasant stay. Queensway and Bayswater tube stops are nearby, its approx 5 mins walk from both, and a bus stop 3 mins away. When I arrived at the hotel, there were roadworks happening on Queensbrough Terrace - the drilling was loud. I checked in to the room, took 5 mins to check in and a small queue was formed. They orig gave me a room on the ground floor, but I requsted a room higher up in the buliding, and eventually they did find me one on the fifth floor. The lifts are very modern, and fast. The corridors are clean and tidy, and good presentation. My room, 524, was a twin room that was actualy very large. They could have easily have put a sofabed in the room as well, to make it a family room. Bathroom was very clean, although a bit small. Bath was a good size though. In side the room, where was a safe which was orig locked - I tried sev combinations but it was locked out. Evenetually I tried 999 and it unlocked. The room itself was very clean, bed linen clean, the tv was not so good though - only 2 working channels and the rest was not tuned in properly. On my last night I tried the room serivce, the menu included basic drinks as well as hot drinks, although the varierty of food was not good. I ordered chicken and pasta - chicken was nice but pasta a bit cold. I paid the waiter right away, and food came in ten minutes. A few ours after eating though, I saw a small mouse run through my room and under the bed!! It was pretty quick - i saw something move in the corner of my eye and then I realised it was a tiny mouse!! On the first few nights, the hotel was generally quiet, but on the last night the next door room was really loud until 1am. Overall, the hotel is pretty good dependant on what you pay, I paid £57 a night for a single bed, I would not pay more than £70 a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: Groundhopper
Reviews.Content: I've used this hotel on a couple of occasions. The service in this hotel is awful and terrible! They don't give a damn about customer service. The rooms are ok in size, but apart from the lobby and reception areas the rest of the hotel is quite runned down. If you arrive there before 2 o' clock the hotel do not offer luggage storage, which is outragous! If you just need a place to sleep the hotel is ok enough. otherwise stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.....but thats about the only good thing...”
Reviews.Author: eat-the-pies
Reviews.Content: Room was small and the double bed was two singles pushed together, and we did book a double!! If you do stay here take some earplugs because the walls are so thin we could hear everything that was going on in the adjoining rooms !! We booked a continental breakfast, what a joke.....a very small glass of orange juice and dry bread...I tried to get some cheese and salami but was abruptly told that I could only have the dry bread!!! Once you have enjoyed your breakfast and you check out, you will then discover that you cant leave your luggage at the hotel!! I have never stayed in a hotel that doesn't offer that facility, we overheard an American family who were not flying home until early evening that they would have to take there bags to a station!! Absolute joke, and will never go near this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: MrsGallasStarr
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews about this hotel, I was very unsure about staying here I arrived at the hotel about 10.30am to drop my suitcase off. was allowed to check in but I was told my room was being cleaned told to leave my case in the room. hotel Receptionist helpful and welcoming I booked a twin room, the room and bathroom was very clean, bed a bit lumpy! (but I had a good night sleep!) a good size room had a nice little fridge good for keeping bottled water chilled etc.. Good location two blocks away from tube station(Queensway-Central Line) and (Bayswater-District line) lot's of handy shops and places to eat around the hotel too. Heating and plenty hotwater all working fine. my stay was just for one night, I have no complaints about this hotel you get what you pay for, I have stayed far worse hotels. this hotel is no Ritz but it's not the cockroach motel either ....

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rude staff”
Reviews.Author: SachaFierce
Reviews.Content: Horrible horrible place, would never ever stay there again. The staff was very rude and didnt really care, especially the foreign blonde lady at the bar,there was another guy, small with dark hair at the bar who was ok and nicer but as for the other lady, she basically walked away while i was speakingwith her, i wish i got her name.She had an answer for everything and cut me off while i was speaking, Being a hotelier myself i was very suprised they have staff like that representing their hotel. Upon check out, there was a lot of confusion as the guests infront of us where all complaining which didnt suprise me. We had no hot water for the 3 days we stayed and had to wait a while to get hot water, Also when we arrived, we didnt have toilet paper. The hotel had run out of ice 3 times in a row, no luggage facility and the room was small and overlooked into someone apartment. On Friday night couldnt sleep as there was a party in the apartment facing us. The only good thing about this place is the nice and very friendly housekeeping staff. I will never stay here again and will never recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No luggage storage - only stay if you are leaving London immediately after checking out.”
Reviews.Author: SJHUk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel several times in the past. Basic hotel in excellent location, and cheap price meant we returned again for a 2 night stay. However we will not be returning again due to the fact that our final days stay was ruined by having to traipse around the capital with our cases at lunchtime as this hotel no longer offers luggage storage once you have checked out. and the staff never thought to mention this at check-in, as we would have made alternate arrangements far earlier if we had known. We were told to try St Pancras staion as this was where we would be leaving from - by the time we got there we had to queue for a while (with it being peak lunch hour) and had to pay £8 per case for storage for the day - however the staff at St Pancras were extremely friendly and helpful and the storage facility there was excellent, and £8 was a small price to pay for not having to lug cases round London for 9 hours which would have totally ruined any plans for our final day. Therefore i would only recommend staying here if you are leaving London as soon as you check out or you enjoy trailing a heavy case around all day. We certainly will not be returning as there are plenty of other well located hotels charging the same rates which DO offer luggage storage.

Reviews.Title: “Weird breakfast and night without sleep”
Reviews.Author: caldosh47
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Monday. Good location (close to two Tube stations). The room was ready, small but adequate at the front of the hotel, first floor. Bathroom was clean, but the carpeting in the room looked old and I did not walk around on it with bare feet. The bed was lumpy. Breakfast seemed like a joke. In the basement was a large hall and its decor looked like something out of a communist cafeteria. Close to midnight on Wednesday the fire alarm went off twice, but reception assured me it was a fluke. The next morning (around 7:30) when I took my shower there was no warm water. The prices of the rooms were not bad at all, but looking back I would rather have paid more for more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but not desirable”
Reviews.Author: ViscountJohn
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel through British Airways. Location is very convenient - it's two blocks away from Queensway which has two tube stations and lots of cheap shops, restaurants, and cheap internet cafes. Kensington Gardens and Palace, Hyde Park, and Nottinghill are just a few blocks away. Hotel is the largest on the block, which is lined up with several small hotels. Lobby's nice enough and the guy at the reception was friendly. When I entered my room (on the fourth floor, facing the back of the building), was somewhat shocked by the small size. There's no real closet, just a narrow open space for hanging clothes. You can't really fully unpack! There's a small tube TV (not LCD) with no cable. Bathroom is kinda small, too, and has limited space for hanging towels, etc. When I asked for an electrical plug adaptor, was told they're all taken. After a couple of days, the concierge advised to just buy one in Queensway. Twice, the chambermaid forgot to put towels and and toilet paper in the room. Had to get them from the reception. Breakfast was OK but not high quality. It's a decent value though. There's also no luggage storage. Was told they have no space for it. Was advised to go to Paddington Station. Went there and learned they charge 6.50 pounds per piece per 24 hours. Quite expensive if you only need to store your luggage for a few hours. Better to leave them in cloak storage of a museum during the day.

Reviews.Title: “No water, No electric - not great!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddy83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over valentines night, and i am glad to see others who stayed at the same time as us also encountered the same problems! i say this as we were not informed that the no electric or no water problem was hotel-wide, not even an explanation or good will gesture in sight! The room was a basic twin (when asked for a double) and right next to the lifts, so the noise levels were mild but constant throughout the day/night (apart from during the power cut as the lifts weren't working - which meant a pleasant 7 double flights of stairs to our room!) the room was clean, the towels changed each day, bed comfy, extra pillows provided, a good location for central london with the tube station a 3 minute walk away. slightly annoyed with no luggage room as we ended up spending a morning also looking for alternative arrangements to leave our bags once we had checked out (convieniently we were told that Liverpool Street Station has this facility at a price of £6.50 per bag for 24 hours) which is where our train was from later on in the day. Overall - you get what you pay for, and budget hotel it was. Clean, no frills, cheap, bed for the night. But if you are a light sleeper i suggest ear plugs to drown out the noise from the all night street cleaners and hotel guest/cleaners and a spare torch and water bottle just in case!! Didnt eat there so cant comment - but plenty of local restaurants to keep you well fed!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Iubitzica
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good looking at the reception, but in the rooms was really bad. First night the heating didn't work, plus the window couldn't be close properly. So was really COLD!!!! Next morning, no warm WATER, are we in the 21st century? or in middle ages?or less??? Finally in the evening we had hot water. but we needed to change the room. the same problem COLD!!!! Second morning, again no hot water..... Also the beds, matrasses were bad as well....so nothing really good to say to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect 4 star standards”
Reviews.Author: Ana2500
Reviews.Content: The most 2 star hotels I've stayed in have been nicer than this hotel which do not live up to its 4 star rating due to these facts: -No bedside table lamps -No luggage storage (after you're checked out) -No cable tv -Poor service (especially reception staff) -Really, really bad breakfast (they served chredded cheese(?!) and eggs that seemed to have been boiled a week ago) The day we were leaving there was no electricity or water in the room. We didn't get any information or apologies. We had to check out without being able to shower. I didn't wan't to pay full price for a room with shower as they didn't provide this. However neither the duty manager not the reception staff seemed to care. I'am not a fuzzy person but wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone -it's pretentious, has no charm, discount breakfast and staff with a "couldn't care less attitude"!

Reviews.Title: “Good mark for Central park”
Reviews.Author: Froniga
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Central Park one night so can judge only from that brief experience. The accommodation was fine. Room was ordinary, nothing special, but I wouldn't have expected anything else for the reasonable price. Bed comfortable, nice firm mattress, pleasant bathroom, all very clean. My only negative comment is that there was a faint smell of cigarette smoke lingering. I don't blame the hotel for that - all the rooms are non-smoking and I think it was just a totally inconsiderate guest before me not obeying the rules. I'm a woman travelling alone and felt completely at home and safe in this hotel. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. And if you are a tourist reading this planning to visit London, the location is a really great base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 2sacred2say
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel online for a good price. Upon arrival the lobby was very nice and tidy however our room was small, run down and quite dirty. The jug leaked, the shower was extremely mouldy (and the air was so damp it was difficult to breathe). I can't help but feeling we drew the short end of the straw in relation to the room we were staying on (considering reviews overalll were pretty good). It was certainly a disappointing experience and our stays in a couple of London YHA Hostels were far more pleasant. Some rooms may be good but don't get your hopes up!

Reviews.Title: “Reduction in services”
Reviews.Author: beddybecks
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Central Park Hotel several times but on my latest visit found that there was no left luggage facilities. This caused problems on my last day trying to find somewhere to leave my cases. I wasted a morning trying to find an alternative left luggage facility. I was told 60% of guests complained about this.

Reviews.Title: “ok even for 2 weeks”
Reviews.Author: ClaireXXXXX
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks, therefore I know what I`m writing here ;) First impression was nice and helpful staff (I had read in reviews about unfriendly people in the reception, but in fact they were really kind!) and really small room! This was a bit shocking for the beginning as I have stayed at really good hotels previously and this room was obviously of different size and equipment. However, all basic things I expected were there (safe, tv, hairdryer, teapot with a cup, plate and tea/coffee, even bath in my small bathroom, fridge) and this trip was low budget, therefore it was ok for me. Breakfast (continental) was basics as well, cereals, toasts/breads with jam, tea, coffee, juice. Thats all. But if you like that kind of food, its really ok. However, I didnt like the tea and brought mine. My safe broke down and it was repaired in 5 minutes after I told it to the guy at the reception.. Wi fi in room costs 5 gbp per hour, therefore I used internet in the "business centre" for 2 gbp per hour... The room was quiet. You can hear door slams and talking in the corridor, but in general it was ok. Location of the hotel is one of its greatest advantages, as it is 5 min away from queensway tube station (Central line) and some 7 min away from bayswater tube station (Circle line). As I came from Gatwick airport, I only had to take train to London (to Victoria station) and one tube line to the hotel, which was really convenient. And, during those 2 weeks, there were times when one or other tube line didnt work (repair works etc.), therefore there was always possibility to take the other tube line. Bus stop is some 3 mins away the hotel, even more convenient than tube station. Surroundings...In the nearby streets there are a lot of (cheap) souvenier shops, a lot of restaurants, food shop, and one amazing italian cafe :)) And I also discovered small mall with H&M and Zara...And, of course, Hyde park! One more thing - tv had some 6 programmes only :) Therefore "the basics" is the best word to describe the hotel. Well, to sum up - I was satisfied with the hotel, as it was cheap and had a really good location. Good choice for budget trips and non-grumblers! For those who write bad reviews about the hotel I`d like to advice to go to better - 4 or 5star hotels :) you cannot ask the impossible for such low price!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & great location!”
Reviews.Author: snapperbandit
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here September 2008 and found this hotel to be just what we were looking for. I am a travel agent and book this hotel regularly as i have had very good feedback from my clients who have visted the Central Park. We spent a total of 6 nights and found the location to be perfect as it is two streets from Bayswater Station, which is on the tube circle line which takes you to all the major tourist stops without changing trains. The feedback on sites such as this were not that great, however we found that both the room and bathrooms were clean and well kept, and the continental breakfast just fine. Be warned though as the bar staff and some of the front desk attendants tend to have trouble understanding english, so patience can be a virtue. The problem with some reviews is the fact that they are often based on expectations, so make sure you realise that this is a basic clean 3 star London hotel with a location you can't really fault.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: icelandic_cat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Central Park Hotel with my husband for three nights in September 2008. The hotel has a great location if you are comfortable with using the tube. It is really close to two tube stations and nearby are several restaurants and cafes. Our room was reasonably sized and rather large compared to a lot of other hotels rooms in London that we have stayed in. The bathroom was quite small though. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but there are several places in the area where you can have breakfast. Overall, a nice hotel in a great location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault”
Reviews.Author: shazcon
Reviews.Content: me and a friend stayed in the central park hotel on 09/01/09 for 3 nights. On arrival we where mistakenly put in a double room instead of a twin, this was however rectified quickly with no inconvenience to us. The room we stayed in was a good size very clean with comfortable beds and surroundings, bathroom was a good size and also clean. The location of the hotel was good on the edge of hyde park with a tube station just around the corner. Staff where really friendly and helpful, i can only praise the service. On leaving the hotel i left my ipod in the room the hotel very kindly mailed it to me i left monday and received my ipod back thursday morning. Overall i was really pleased with my stay at the central park hotel and i dont understand where the bad reviews are coming from some people must expect the ritz for less than 100 pound please do not listen to negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Punch50
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, close to pubs, and hyde park. Front desk was very helpfull and nice. Quick checking in and check out. We had a triple room and it was quite roomy, clean and bright. Alot bigger than i thought it would be. We were about an hours walk from Marble Arch. which is a nice walk. Hotel is close to the tube and bus stops. They weather was great for us only rained for about 5 min. the whole week . Got to meet Family for the first time. So we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but beware......”
Reviews.Author: Frandan
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet. Hotel had average reviews compared to other London hotels. Looked really good on their website. Excellent location - across the road from Hyde Park and around the corner are some really good restaurants - try the thai and indian. Looks are deceiving - lovely lobby - room the size of a tin can which is usual for Europe. Staff are pretty hospitable. We were given a room that had just had the bathroom door painted - not seeing this tiny note stuck to the door entered in only to wear the paint all over. They did get my jacket dry-cleaned but what a drama to find out which house keeper had taken it and to get it returned. They then changed our rooms but my husband had received flee bites to his back and chest from resting on the bed. Rooms are very outdated and require a complete upgrade to match the lobby decor. I recommend the buffet breakfast - plenty to choose from hot and cold and will keep you going all day. Overall experience, disappointed, may stay here again only because of convenient location to everything/tube etc but will probably pay more for better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: aloha8
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel. Rooms are small and the decor and furniture are outdated but seems like the hotel has gone through some new renovations in the lobby and other common areas. Convenient location right outside of Hyde Park and very close to Tube stops. The offered a free continental breakfast which is good to take advantage of for some juice or coffee in the morning but DO NOT pay extra to upgrade for the cooked food, it is NOT worth it. Overall, not bad if you get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: otk25
Reviews.Content: No frills hotel. Clean, modern, well maintained. If you just need inexpensive place to sleep - good choice. Next to tube station and across the road from Kensington Gardens and 15 minutes walking distance from Paddington station to catch train to Heathrow. Inexpensive restaurants and grocery stores in the area. Fridge in room is really helpful. Rooms are very small, but clean and functional. Negatives: 1. Lousy continental breakfast. I did not expect gourmet meal at all for the price, but I didn’t expect watered-down juice and not fresh croissants either. 2. Thin walls. Can hear voices outside the room. Yet for the price would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very continental hotel in heart of London”
Reviews.Author: kosyo_t
Reviews.Content: In contrast to many London hotels located in renovated old buildings, this Central park hotel not just look like “normal” hotel, but rooms also have lot of space. Easy to find, with fast access to tube. We stayed for four week days and catch the excellent price for double room with average of 72$ (!!!). Clean room and bathroom, no problems at all. Take attention if you need taxi drive to airport or train station – try to catch standard cab, because cars which arrive by request on reception are overpriced (took at 4 a.m. to Victoria train station 20 pounds for 5 minutes drive).

Reviews.Title: “Anything included at all?”
Reviews.Author: Bernhoff
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I both love London. It’s versatility, it's thriving night-life, it's enormous shops, it's tranquil parks and much more... It must be Europe’s grandest city. For the final two night of our travel through all of the UK, eventually leading to London, we decided to stay in a somewhat more luxurious hotel than the previous hotel/motels we stayed in. We were exhausted and we needed a good place to rest, located somewhere from were could easily explore the city. Choosing for the Central Park Hotel (which is supposedly of 3 star quality) was one of the WORST decisions we made throughout our many travels. As we came in, there was a giant queue in front of us, we needed to wait for more than 30 minutes before being told that we couldn’t check in any time before three o’clock. After three o’clock, my fiancée and I went to visit the Hyde Park in the meanwhile, a chubby lady who seemed to be inseparably surrounded by a strikingly strong odour of sweat and being relentlessly sulky towards us, said she wasn’t yet capable to check us in for a twofold reason: there was no room available, there was no booking made (?!?). After I showed her my conformation and her inquiring at the reservation office, it took another 30 minutes for her to return, she admitted that it was simply not posted correctly in the system she worked from. So we where finally checked in. She said breakfast wasn’t included in the rate, but after I showed her my conformation again, she annoyingly admitted it was. We got four, clearly already used, vouchers. The roomed that was given to us was remarkably tiny, imagine a cramp single room with a king-size bed in there, that’s how it seemed. It was clearly smaller than the rooms of cheaper hotels we stayed in during our may travels. After noticing the dust on our in our windowsill and the stains in our bath we went down again to kindly ask for another room. The lady, still the same one and the only one apparently on service, who seemed annoyed while ending her Internet chat sessions to answer my request, simply said that there were no other rooms available. If we would come back in the morning, she said literally: “Maybe one of my colleagues the other morning wants to change it for you, check it with them.” I informed her, which is true and not just a lie that suits the situation, about my fiancée’s asthma, and that my fiancée couldn’t stay in a room as dirty as the one we were allocated in, she simply replied, “That’s your problem, sir.” The other morning though, after not-enjoying the cheap breakfast (only spongy croissant with some jam, no, jelly with a colour, we asked again, and still the receptionists weren’t able, some maybe not even capable, of changing our room. My fiancée didn’t sleep all night because of her condition, but I didn’t feel it was appropriate using this in the argument, until everything resulted in me speaking to an uncaring, uninterested, bad tempered front-office manager. Still nothing happened. My fiancée brought two towels from home. We were planning to sleep in hotels, but you never know for sure whatever your come across (like what happened in the CPH). After we asked for two new towels, the original ones had suspicious stains on them, we were presented with two greasy new ones. My fiancée therefore decided to use one of her own. In the morning, after coming back disappointed from asking (applying seems a better fit term) for a new room, we found that our towels had been removed by housekeeping that was already cleaning everything. After calling reception, where they put us through to concierge, where they asked us to call housekeeping, where I was put on hold before being put through to a lady, we were explained that the towels had already been taken downstairs by mistake. In the evening after seven, we noticed they weren’t delivered back, so I informed at the concierge desk. They didn’t know, they asked the duty manager, a kind gentleman from India, who would ask housekeeping again. The next morning even after check-out they didn’t find anything, they would just take another look which raised the suspicion the didn’t look at all. We left without them, leaving our address at the concierge desk, but nothing was sent home. It is not about losing the towels, we might have thrown them away in the end anyway, but it’s about the hotel fetching guest’s possessions and not even taking an effort to return them to there righteous owners! The hotel is horribly dirty and cheap for a ridiculous high rate. This, on itself, would not even be all to bad if it wasn’t for all staff being incredibly incapable and insolent (including management, especially the front-office manager) in there approach towards guests. DON’T GO THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: ExpatBB
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is convenient, the service and room conditions was terrible. My bed was so uncomfortable, which come to find out, was a simple portable cot. The drain in the tub was clogged upon arrival and although we asked for three days for this to be fixed, nothing was done. There are other hotels in the area...I would give them a try before suffering through a Central Park Hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Average with some downs”
Reviews.Author: C0sm0Kramer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the lobby I was surprised how nice it was and the bar looked like a 4 Star Hotel. We had a warm welcome and got checked in pretty fast and without any issues. The room was big enough, even with the crib we ordered for our 11months old. Unfortunately the furniture were really old and I got back pain by sleeping in this small bed (1.2m ?? for a couple). Overall, the room was old, clean and quiet. The bathroom was refurbished, so everything looked pretty new. unfortunately there was no place to put anything! We also needed a nanny for one afternoon, as we were attending an event. The nanny was provided by the Hotel. We were really satisfied and the nanny was great. Breakfast is not worth of it! Go and enjoy it somewhere else! The location just north of Hyde Park was perfect. Paddington Main Station as well as 2 underground stations (Bayswater and Queensway) were within ~5min walking distances.

Reviews.Title: “you need to have your eyes open”
Reviews.Author: justine37
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews, so knew we were not going to be staying in anything flash but we were seriously shocked when we booked into the hotel. Room on the 1st floor was disgusting. So small that we couldn't put the suitcases on the floor - 2 adults staying for 7 nights!!! Bar fridge in front of where it should have fitted, but didn't. I immediately rang Reception and was told that all their rooms were the same. Now, I knew I had checked Trip Advisor, so went to nearest Internet Cafe, and checked again. Went back to Reception, this time faced them down. Told them we'd booked the hotel after checking Trip Advisor, and we knew that they had rooms much better than they had given us, and that we would expect to have our room changed, but were happy to wait until the next morning. This was agreed to, quite quickly too. Suggestion - use Trip Advisor when you book in "we checked on Trip Advisor" should assure you of their more decent rooms Suggestion - do not accept anything below 3rd floor. The room we ended up with was fine - nothing flash - we had never expected flash. It was clean, and bathroom was fine. Obvious problems with the hotel - don't bother with the breakfast; or with the Concierges who couldn't care less. Long queues at Reception, all complaints!!! this didn't impact on us at all.

Reviews.Title: “Central Park was superb”
Reviews.Author: Selfridges
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I visited London again. We were given a room on the 7th floor and had a nice view of the London Eye. Unfortunately, as the room was located next to the housekeeping office, we had some issues with the noise in the morning from housekeeping. Fortunately, the moment we complained, Management responsed professionally and promptly to address the problem. The room change was prompt and they even upgraded us to a larger room which made the stay even more pleasant. Although we lost the view of the London Eye..we did not mind. Rooms were larger than anticipated, clean and comfortable. The Hotel is strategically located - it was very easy to catch any form of transportation from the hotel and a pleasant walk from Notting Hill Gate (approximately 10 minutes). It's opposite Hyde Park which was convenient and lovely as the weekend that we had in London had wonderful weather. We were able to walk all the way to the Royal Albert Hall. Staff were friendly. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, value for money - would def use this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: WeathergirlUK
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at this Hotel via Lastminute.com, very busy reception and hall - three lifts. There is a bar as you walk in which is open until 1am - which is useful. Room was much larger than I anticipated, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Basic toiletries and tea and coffee facilities were good. Would def stay here again, value for money in an excellent location - good transport services -

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Pockets08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Central Park Hotel for four nights Sept 19 to 23, 2008. In our opinion it is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. Here is our experience. Day 1 My wife and I checked in early (9:00 AM) and expected our room not to be available until Noon or possibly 2:00 PM. That was as expected. I had just lost my wallet and credit cards on the underground, I asked if I could use a phone to get my cards cancelled. I was told there was no telephone available that customers can use. The hotel phones could not handle toll free or collect calls. We were directed to a pay phone two blocks away on Bayswater. Of course there was so much traffic noise you could not hear anything. On inquiring again the hotel directed us to another pay phone two blocks in the other direction but it was quiet enough so we made our calls. On asking to talk to the hotel manager I was told he was not available, finally they told me he would talk to me before the end of the day, it never happened. Day 2 Our room was on the 1st floor and directly below was a refrigeration compressor. It was still going full throttle at 1 AM. I phoned down and the night clerk arrived at our room and confirmed the noise, we were told to close the window. They could not turn off the compressor and the hotel was completely full so no other room was available, perhaps they could move us the next day. Day 3 The hotel moved us to the 3rd floor the next day. On awakening there was no hot water. We were told it was only our room and they would check it out that day. Day 4 On returning to our room at 5:30 PM it had not been cleaned or the beds made, we had to phone down to houskeeping to have the room made up. In general all the staff except for the concierge was anything but helpful. They gave the impression that you, the customer should not be bothering them with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Great Hotel...!!!”
Reviews.Author: buznbro15
Reviews.Content: Wow, where to begin...well my wife and I stayed at the Central Park Hotel from Sept. 21-28 and overall we had an awesome experience. We weren't looking for anything too fancy, just a hotel that was clean and had a great location. This hotel certainly had what we were looking for. We found ALL of the staff to be very pleasant, particularly Paula at the lobby bar. We initeracted with many different nations at this hotel, which we found interesting. The rooms were clean (and cleaned daily) with fresh towels, however, bring your own face cloth/sponge. They also had a mini fridge in the room which we really liked...great for storing water, milk, etc. The location was awesome as well...steps to the Queensway Tube station, numerous eateries, etc. Do yourself a favour and dine at Tuk Tuk on Queensway, we ended up there on 4 occasions during an 8 day stay...outstanding Thai/Chinese cuisine. We walked EVERYWHERE for the entire 8 days and covered all kinds of territory, places like Oxford Street, Soho, Theatre district, Lambeth, Southwark, Holborn, Wesminster, Hyde Park, etc, etc. London is truly a FANTASTIC walking city, with so much history to see and explore. The only 2 blemishes we experienced were: 1) a very ignorant tube station employee who, even with a massive queue of commuters one morning, waiting to purchase fare from him, decided to continue reading his NEWSPAPER behind the glass and only serve people when he was good and ready!!??(all other tube operators were great though!) and 2) although we appreciated the view of the street from our room, there were times when it got extremely loud from guests staying at neighbouring hotels across the way. Even with the window closed, you could be woken up out of a deep sleep. My advice to you is if your a light sleeper, request a room opposite from the street. Our package included the continental breakfast, which would have been great, however, for some unknown reason, we were upgraded to the "English breakfast", which now included bacon, 2 types of eggs, sausage, beans and what appeared to be a deep fried toast of some sort. Some people could be heard complianing about certain foods being "not hot enough" but we had no problems with it, afterall, we were on holiday and not cooking so what's to complain about. Overall, we had a blast in London and were extremely satisfied with choosing the Central Park Hotel. Yes, there will be those who will have a negative experience for one reason or another but believe me, if you go ANYWHERE with a positive attitude, people will feed off your example!

Reviews.Title: “Take no notice of the ridiculously negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: janmobile
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews carefully before booking this hotel. On the whole you get what you pay for and the breakfast is more than adequate. I have to say that I have never had to reverse out of a bathroom before but the room was clean and the beds comfortable so what more do you want? The location is excellent being no more than 5 minutes walk from Hyde Park and the Central Line and barely more from Bayswater Tube station. I just wish the girl on reception could have forced a smile but it hardly spoiled our stay! I would stay again for the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in London - EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Radley1875
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the hotel lobby. Once you get in the lift and out onto your floor you will feel like you've entered a totally different hotel. The carpets were filthy and held together with silver duct tape! The rooms were teeny tiny. My partner and I could hardly walk around the bed. The bathroom was also teeny tiny and even though it had been cleaned it was still looking grubby. The toilet seat was hanging off and the flush was temperamental. I would never stay at this hotel again. I visit London every year and I have seen my fair share of 'budget' hotels but this one really takes the biscuit. Do yourself a favour, do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “The continental breakfast is a joke”
Reviews.Author: Eric_DB
Reviews.Content: Overall Central Park Hotel is ok. The location is good, the rooms are small but clean. However, the continental breakfast was a big disappointment. There are some many annoying things about so I dont know where to start. The cooked ham was of the lowest quality imaginable, the cheese was grated(!!) not sliced, the really sour juice was served in shot size glasses, the youghurt tasted synthetic and was just not edibile and the orange marmelade did not taste like oranges and was so sour. The raspberry marmelade was decent though. Tea was ok, but were only available in no name tea bags. At hotels of decent quality, when the tea comes in bags, there are at least 3-4 different kinds available. Also, you were not allowed to serve yourself cheese and ham - I can accept that - but the hotel staff serving you the ham and cheese were really not service minded at all. They reminded more of the "soup nazi" in one of the Seinfeld show episodes! I can tell you, your money are better spent at Starbucks etc than in this breakfast room. We stayed at this hotel for two nights and then switched to Hilton Docklands for a meeting in Canary Wharf and what a difference. The breakfast at Hilton is pure quality while the key words at Cental Park seems to be low quality food, unfriendly staff and meagre choice

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious - How not to run a hotel”
Reviews.Author: BohemiansDublin
Reviews.Content: Just back home today. This hotel is close to the tube/shopping/restaurants/Kensington Gardens, but that's where the good news ends. The staff were badly trained, had no concept of customer focus and were ignorant of hotel policy and pricing. There was a constant queue at reception due to inefficiency. At one point 2 girls at reception were attempting to reattach a cuff button in front of me while I watched. TV/Safe were broken in the room, items were not replenished in the room following room service, and the room was lazily cleaned (bath/taps were given a wide berth by the cleaning staff apparently). The breakfast was what I would expect from a greasy spoon, not a 3 star hotel. We booked 2 rooms, when the key to one of the rooms failed, and I called to request another key, I was sarcastically quizzed as to how I could possibly be calling them if I was locked out (I was calling from the other room). The Room windows are extremely unsafe for small children. To cap things off, my 3:45AM wake up call called me at 3:25 - 20 minutes early. I'ld like to think this was intentional but I don't think it was. Avoid this hotel please. This is the first hotel review I've ever written, but in travelling across Europe and the US I've never encountered anything as bad as this.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money but its OK overall”
Reviews.Author: vl4781
Reviews.Content: General impression Medium size hotel, reception area is well presented. Reception Customer service was ok although they are not very coordinated. Whilst the reception told me to speak to the concierge and the concierge told me to speak to reception, what was that about?? Room Stayed in 138, which was clean. I had the room facing the street there are other hotels in the same street so was a little noisy at night but its ok unless you are a very light sleeper. Breakfast Very very very poor. I stayed in cheap B&B and even they are significantly better. There are 2 types of cereal either cornflakes or muesli. Not that I have a problem with that except it taste awful I saw one of the staff filling it with Asda value muesli. If I am paying £65 a night I think I am expecting something a little better. Machine coffee, poor quality croissant. Location Good!!! Its a few minutes from the high street, you are within 5 minutes walk from 2 different underground stations. It is also very near to Paddington so if you travel by Paddington express to and from Heathrow then it is very convenient. Overall It is not likely that I will stay in this hotel again unless it is much cheaper. Location is good but for what I was paying it was not value for money. I wrote a review about Mayflower Hotel in Earls Court. In terms of cost, they are quite similar but Mayflower was a lot better. It is a much smaller hotel and the room is smaller but the overall experience was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Just barely makes Average with a Tube-centric location”
Reviews.Author: GSSDaring
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about, this hotel is about packing a lot of tourists in. On the plus side the room I had was quiet. On the minus side was the cramped nature of the place including two floors with lower than standard ceilings. Also the included breakfast was quite spartan (unless you ponied up a good deal extra for the hot food options). Staff ranged from friendly to indifferent to inhospitable over the week I stayed. Still, it kept me in walking distance to two different tube stations that gave me the run of central London, so I refuse to condemn it, just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter5000
Reviews.Content: I've read all the reviews about this hotel, and while agree with a lot of the comments (poor breakfast, poor customer service etc), I think the hotel is good for the price. The location is excellent for anyone wishing to be close to all the sights in London. The hotel is very clean, and the rooms are cleaned to a very good standard. The bar is nice, but really needs some background music. Generally the customer service was very poor from all staff (Mgmt and staff alike), except for one friendly Concierge who directed us to a local Spanish restaurant which was excellent. Overall the hotel was fine, although I didn't spend a lot of time there, as it is so close to the Underground stations and there is also plenty to do in the local area. If it's a bustling hotel with plenty to do then this won't be the place for you, but if you're looking for clean no-frills budget accommodation close to everything then I'd recommend Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Central location. My cat has a better breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Deadwalking
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on new years eve 2007/2008. The location is perfect between Queensborough and Bayswater tube stations and Hyde Park in a "budget" neighbourhood filled with inexpensive restaurants and miscellaneous gift shops. The lobby of the hotel is modern and spacious but the rooms are relatively small and dated. However the staff is rude and the breakfast is awful. We paid for a British breakfast (DONT BOOK ANY BREAKFAST THERE, BRITISH OR CONTINENTAL) which entitled us to the continental plus some mediocre bacon and eggs, beans, and fried bread served by a dragon lady which ONLY GAVE US ONE SLICE/PORTION of each item. When I asked for a second piece of bacon she said that she had instructions to only give one!!! This in a 3 star hotel!!! The sensation on the breakfast room is that you are being watched by the waiters every minute as you would steal their undrinkable coffee or any or the other items that make their awful buffet. In fact they have a small army of waiters 3 of them work the other watch the potential burglars I mean the clients, preventing them from stealing a croissant. Yes the quality matched the quantity here. Worst breakfast ever. Despite the location I wouldn’t stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good area, but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: AsterixThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite clean, but the rooms very small and the breakfast very poor. I spent a night in a room under the ground level. where i was feeling like being in an U-boat. Rooms below earth level should be prohibited. A.P. Greece, 48

Reviews.Title: “the worst breakfast on earth”
Reviews.Author: Aussie034
Reviews.Content: The room was small and noisy, as we had expressly requested a quiet room, they were very obliging, and gave us a larger and much quieter room. The hotels location is as good as it gets. The restaurant appears to be run as a franchise,. We were astounded when having a club sandwich delivered to the room, we were asked to pay cash on delivery.Breakfast is so bad and so mean, you need to try it just once to experience it. Although the hotel advertises that a continental breakfast includes ham and cheese, the ham and cheese (on a tray)is closly guarded by the dragon lady cashier. A nyone not paying for a full English breakfast is not permitted to approach the cold cuts........although what you would do with cold cuts as well as a full English breakfast is beyond me.To sum up, you cant beat the location, and although the sheets and towls are kind of tacky,nowhere else in the area has as many elevators,such wide corridors, or fridges,even though they dont work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: ctheworld88
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Central Park Hotel after first staying there in April 2006. For us (budget travelers in our late 30s), the hotel's location is its greatest asset. Located less than 5 minutes from both the Queensway and Bayswater tube stops, and across the street from Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens/Palace, and 1 minute from a 24 hour Internet cafe, it is an ideal situation for the budget traveler who relies on walking and mass transportation. The hotel's common areas (lobby, bar and breakfast area) have all undergone a sleek reburbishment within the last two years. (You can see the pictures on the hotel's website.) Like others have said, though, the rooms remain tired and dated. During each of our stays, we did comment on the cleanliness of the bathrooms, but the decor and carpeting in the rooms and hallways is stained, and certainly does not match the contemporary style of the common areas. On the positive side, there are 3 lifts, free luggage storage, windows that actually open (no air-con), and in-room coffee and tea making facilities. We do hope the rooms are next on the list for an update. However, you can be sure the rates will increase once that happens. We booked a twin room through Venere.com for a steal at 98 GBP per night. We also hope management will consider upgrading the continental breakfast offered with the room rate. Consisting of cereal, stale croissants, bread, coffee, tea and the tiniest juice, it is really not worth the trouble. Fresh delicious scones, muffins and baguettes can be had from any number of establishments on Queensway. If you are an upscale traveler who requires certain lavish amenities, then this hotel is not for you. However, if you're an easy-going budget traveler who likes convenience and a good location, stay at the Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: priscillaq
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks fairly impressive from the outside and the front lobby not bad either but unfortunately the rooms are a bit of a dissapointment then. The decor is basic and cheap looking but everything was clean and in good working condition. Even though you are in the centre of London the bedrooms are very quiet and the beds huge and comfy. Breakfast very very basic as mentioned earlier but there was no problem making several trips to the juice machine if one wanted a refill. Service efficient at the front desk and bar. The real plus is it's great location to the park and also proximity to the underground. We went to the Indian restaurent across the road the night we arrived, wouldn't do that again. Overall, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRBS
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Central Park Hotel was not an overall good experience. First of all, I had to wait 8 hours for a hotel room even after having reserved it months before arriving. The hotel reservation system mixed up my request for two beds and instead tried to give me one bed. That wasn't good. After sternly demanding a room with two beds, I was finally accommodated, though 8 hours later. The front desk staff wasn't very friendly. Though the restaurant/bar staff was very friendly and comforting. The food was average, not bad, just average. The hotel room was clean, but extremely small and the bathroom was extremely small. I guess that is what is expected in some European hotels and that's okay. What wasn't expected and isn't okay is that I was there in the cold season and the room had no heat whatsoever. Finally after numerous requests, the maintenance department brought me up one of their space heaters, which did the trick of finally providing heat. The hot water barely lasted throughout one 10 minute or less shower. When I arrived, I was taking medication for a sinus infection, however, my medicine was either stolen or thrown away by the housekeeper and when I reported it to the staff, my complaint was never addressed and the management seemed to have a very nonchalant attitude. I ended up seeing an acupuncturist in the area who gave me a great chinese herb and acupuncture treatment that helped tremendously. The hotel itself is located in a very quiet area of town with just a small area of shopping nearby. Truly an uneventful area. Not much in the way of public transportation nearby either.

Reviews.Title: “OK...but that's all”
Reviews.Author: LFK
Reviews.Content: Booked a Triple room for only £40, but this was due to a mistake that a well known hotel search engine site had made and the prices were for another Park Hotel in Finsbury Park. But the Agency decided to honour the price. However, if I had paid any more I would have been disapointed. Great Location, just Opposite the Park. Reception friendly & helpful. Room was clean and beds were comfortable, the decor had seen better days. Breakfast was an interesting experience, some of the other reviewers were right, the coffeee was foul!! Rolls, Croissants, Toast, Cereal and Jam, no cheese, ham or eggs. The dining room was vast and a bit of a free for all, you could upgrade to cooked breakfast for £5, but we decided not to bother. As I say it was OK because we got a bargain price, but I wouldn't hurry back

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm”
Reviews.Author: travel_alex
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit torn about my feelings for this hotel.... We had a great room (#204) so I can't complain about that... But I saw a bunch of other rooms whem they were being cleaned, and I understood that we lucked out... The hotel is big, but it's not noisy or anything so thats a plus =) And the location is great, close to subway and Hyde Park... Breakfast is terrible! And the lady who runs it would really benefit from a little more smiling... I don't know if we would stay here again, it's nothing wrong with the place in particular, but there is something about it that's negative.... But for the money we spent we got a great deal! So I guess I'm not much help, 'cause I haven't made up my mind yet, and probably never will =) But the Indian restaurant across the street is really GOOD =)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and tawdry”
Reviews.Author: TTYP
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt why the hotel's website only shows one photo of a room. Think of a cabin on the lower deck of an aging cruise ship and you have a good idea of the accomodations. Neither the so-called continental or full breakfasts are palatable and the dining area is a loud cafeteria. I didn't know you could slice bread so thin. Simply assume that you are getting a place to lay down at night and that it comes with no breakfast. Then check some other hotels in the area (there are dozens). They will all have the same good location and cannot have worse accomodations (ok there is a hostel next door). At that point you are just looking for the cheapest rate. One review said there was a good indian place across the street. It is a 14 dish buffet that counts salad dressing and a sauce as dishes. Go to Hyde Park speakers corner on a sunday. Its long walking distance from the hotel and is worth the price of the airfare. It runs all day even though the barely intelligible hotel concierge claimed that it started at 1 pm.

Reviews.Title: “waste of great location”
Reviews.Author: Melaneejune
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, just across the street from Hyde Park. The setup itself is very odd. The front desk is nice, our receptionist wasn't very friendly but it was 3:00am so I can't blame her. The elevator was slow and shaky. The rooms were very very small. I have never seen such a tiny room with tiny beds. The whole atmosphere just wasn't inviting and was quite stressful. We went downstairs for a drink and found a strange sort of basement bar... the drinks were overpriced and the breakfast was awful! The rooms just felt strange and we couldn't relax. It didn't feel like a typical hotel. It all just felt very odd and we couldn't ever relax and enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, 2 minutes walk to the Queensway tube station and 1 minute walk to Hyde Park. The rooms were great! Big, clean, comfortable bed, nice bathroom. If breakfast is important for you, dont stay here, it was awful! Some croissants, jelly and cornflakes. That was it, english breakfast was 5 pound extra and wasn`t much to brag about and the lady serving it didn`t speak english. And she only allowed you to get one plate. Another thing we didn`t like was the staff. They never said hello and I dont think I ever saw them smile at us. Not service minded at all. But I would stay there again, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressive”
Reviews.Author: derbyshirenomad
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the location of the hotel is superb, but that is the only superlative that will be used in this review. The foyer is welcoming with the staff polite and efficient. But that is where the enjoyment of your stay will end. I stayed in a single room and it was exceptionally small, even by single room standards. The room was poorly lit, shabbily decorated, the television had 2 working English channels but 5 Arabic. They only provided two tea bags / milk for my entire stay and it was a constant battle to keep the hot water of the shower at the same temperature. And this was all before I experienced the worst hotel breakfast I have ever had the misfortune of eating. The breakfast ( if you can call it that) consisted of stale croissants, luke warm tea, watered down fruit juice served in ridiculously small glasses that you kept having to refill every minute. The idea that this was meant to be a continental breakfast was laughable. I hoped the English breakfast might cheer me up but again, NO. The hot food was not hot as it had been left out for so long and I’ve eaten leather that tasted better than the bacon. So all in all, not a good stay. If you want an excellent location but you do not care for the quality of the room, bathing facilities or breakfast, then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise steer well clear of this hotel. There are better / cheaper hotels within great locations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mszacman
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in March on a trip booked with Gate1. It's a nice budget hotel, perfect for what we needed: a place to rest and sleep after sightseeing. The location is great, just a short walk to the underground, and the bus and tour bus stops. Near beautiful Kensington park. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was small, with the double bed taking up most of the room, but we were pleasantly surprised with the bathroom. The tub was deep and long, great for weary travelers to soak in. The pillows were horrible, and very flat, but we were so exhausted after sightseeing all day, that we slept like babies. Breakfast was not great, but edible. We ate dinner at the great little Indian restaurant across the street. All in all a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel76
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here this past week for 2 nights. Rooms vary is size. I I stayed in a room with 2 twin beds. Bathroom was good size, tub/ shower were large, big closet. Lots of outlets, tv with a couple stations, large windows and a fridge. The other people in our group stayed in a room with one double bed that took up most of their room. They had a smaller closet and smaller bathroom. Neither room had much light. But overall for the price (we got it comped through a deal with British Airlines) and the location of the hotel, it was fine to stay at. They provided the included continental breakfast of breads, cereal, juice, tea and coffee and the option to purchase an English breakfast from their hot breakfast bar. Most of the staff was very helpful. They upgraded us after our rooms were not ready in time. There were free local newspapers in the lobby. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Steps away from the tube station (yellow and green lines), and right off of Bayswater Street with many bus stops and easy access to cabs if need them. Lots of places to eat and shop in the area. Right across from Hyde/Kensington Park. On the 'Original' Hop On /Off purple bus route. Sunday mornings til afternoon local artists sell their work along the outside of the park across the street. Area is close to Paddington and Nottinghill.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accomodation, but some rooms are really terrible”
Reviews.Author: Filippo75
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Central Park Hotel in London several times, mostly because the position is excellent and the price (around 80-90 euro for the single room) is fair. However, my last experience was really negative: I had a single room on the ground floor, tiny, with no windows and with one of the worst acoustic isolation ever (I could hear TVs in the other rooms, and the noise of people walking on the stairs). Lesson learnt: if you want to try this hotel, stay away from ground floor rooms (the other rooms are bigger, quieter and have windows).

Reviews.Title: “good location, ok price for london”
Reviews.Author: DeniMu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just one night in March. Booked pretty last minute. We were delighted with the location which is 1 minute walk from Queensway station and a few mins from bayswater station. It is right beside hyde park and in between oxford street and notting hill. Check-in was smooth and the public areas of the hotel are very nice. Staff were always helpful and pleasant. The rooms were bit old fashioned with paisley wallpaper and flowery curtains but most hotels are! Nothing to complain about. The size of the twin room was more than adequate. The bathroom was nicely tiled, and clean. Not much room to move around in it though – we are small people so it didn’t matter but we were amused – not for tall or bigger people!. The continental breakfast was nothing to praise. It was tea, coffee, juices, cereals, croissants or bread. If there is anything to be slightly improved it is the breakfast . and the cutlery was dirty!!! It was served until 11am though which is good for late risers. But next time I would skip it and go elsewhere. I would stay though again. It was well priced for London and in a very good location. Overall I was happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: EXTTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on biz. Checkin v-good, v-nice girls to deal with. There was a bit of work goin on but only in daylight & most seemed to be upgrades which is always good news. Had an issue with bedroom backing onto flat roof & got changed with a smile & "no problem, sir" Cold weather in Nov. but rooms were warm & clean, a little on the small side but with all the usual services...tv, mini fridge (empty of course), iron, en suite(compact & bijou!), phone, desk oh yeah & a bed. Was out 'n about all day, ate in a nice standard fare indian restaurant behind hotel one night, had a few beers chatting to fellow guests & polite bar staff in the hotel bar before bed, what more could you want...well it suited me anyway! If you fancy a bit of up market dining I went to Biosdales of Bishopsgate, down a tiny alley opposite liverpool st. station, for a mother of a steak. Hey man, it was sweet! Best I've tasted since Smith & Wollensky NYC(still the best)...and thats coming from a paddy!!! One word of caution, as is common practice with most hotels outside the Euro cash zone, they kindly displayed my bill & debited my card in Euro! Handy for calculation but they apply their own exchange rate there & then! Best to insist your bill is presented in local currency, then let your card company apply its exchange rate, this probably applies to hotels worldwide actually. Would I go back? For the purpose of my visit, yes

Reviews.Title: “AOK but with a Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: breener77
Reviews.Content: Righty.. First Off.. If you are staying here for a Night or 2 (& wont be in the Room much) and want Cheap Clean Accomadation.. Then Stay here. I went over for 1 night for a Match which I gather from the people there thats mainly what people use it for. Plus's = Very close to Queensway UG, 3 Streets away (Small Streets), Clean Hotel, CHEAP! If you are staying here for a lengthened stay and will be spending time in the Hotel then maybe its not for you. Minus's = Very Thin Walls, Small Rooms, Shower was Bust, Small offer of Toiletries & A FRIDGE in the room?!?!?. I Would say its IDEAL for going over for Matches for the Cheap & Excellent access to UG Trains.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: civil2006
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, warm and new. All that I wanted in a hotel. And best of all, in a really great location. 100 m from Queensway station and another 200 m to Bayswater station. 5 minutes walking to all kinds of restaurants: chinese, persian, mexican (in the Whiteleys mall), Pizza hut, McDonalds, Burger King, Starbucks etc etc. I would definetely recommend it to all of my friends. I booked it at 80 euros per night.
