Reviews.Title: “basic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: mick24
Reviews.Content: stayed here last weekend,the rooms are very small but clean. The plus side of this hotel is the location, rigth beside two tube stations Queensway and Bayswater. Only two minutes to centre of city.

Reviews.Title: “Hostel come old peoples home”
Reviews.Author: dirtsngrainger
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong old peroples homes and hostels can be very nice. however, when i compare this hotel to them i am refering to the sort of homes that you see on watchdog tv programs!! initially we were presented with a failry contemporary facade, illuminated with fancy lighting, reception area also seemed nice and clean etc. checked in fine, although the person who checked us in had no real concept of the english language. but check in was fairly painless once wed waited in the queue for 20 minutes. so, we picked up our bags and made our way to the elevator, doors opened and we got in to what was not much bigger than a dumb waiter!! and not entirely fitted out any better!! up to the second floor and "ding"...............................nothing. then the elevator returned us to the ground floor, pressed the button again for the 2nd floor and "ding"..........................................nothing, doors wouldnt open on the 2nd floor. great. so the stairs it was. great after a 20 minute wait in the queue at reception!!! into the 2nd floor lobby, we were greeted by paisley carpets, which did well to hide the wear and filth and wall lines with oak/beech effect melamine that has seen better days!! to the room we inserted our entry card and presto IT WORKED!!! wow, i thought, this could be the turning point for the hotel. opened the door to find the bed (apparently a double but obviously a 3/4) only 2 feet away from the door. the room was pretty outdated, wallpaper was disgusting and most pieces were hanging off the wall. the tea making facilities were actually 2 tea bags, a coffee a kettle and 2 cups. no sugar or milk. upon filling up the kettle i found the remaind of the dover cliffs at the bottom!! there was more lime scale settled at the bottom than id ever seen before, however this was only bettered by the mould in the lid!! The room did however have a fridge! however no matter what setting it was always warmer in the fridge than the room. curtains had mould at the bottoms of the and the windows had pints of condensation on them!! bed was comfy although a bed of nails did seem more appealling than the loose springs that seemed to find there ways into my ribs no matter what position i led in! onto the bathroom.....totally tiled, was fairly clean apart from all the rust on the appliances. there literally was no room to put any of your toiletries. the floors and walls are waffer thin. so much so if someone is putting a plug in the room next door, it sounds like theyre coming through the wall!! you can hear with great detail people in the toilets either side, below and above you!! the conceirge who looked a bit like mr miagy from karate kid, was pretty abrupt and if you asked for a taxi, several minutes later you would get the most dodgey car turn up and charge you over inflated rates no matter where you wanted to go! we took a black cab on the way from the station to the hotel and it was 4 quid, to one of the hotels "limo service cars" (a clapped out megane) and were initially charged 18 quid!!! this hotel is really quite pathetic! if you look at their website you think youre getting something close to a travel lodge, but in reality travel lodges blow this out of the water!! its in dire need ove a massive overhaul. the pictures on their website seriously misrepresent what you end up with!! Stay clear of this or alternatively take your tent and sleep in hyde park for a more comfortable night!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: slf999
Reviews.Content: Difficult to recommend anything about this hotel except it's location. Staff were indifferent/off hand. Bedroom was poor. Patchy/stained carpet. Stained bedclothes/pillows. Bathroom was ok. They advertise satelitte tv? All I could find was the 5 british channels (which all had bad 'ghosting' on the picture) plus two arabic channels. No radio as advertised. Asked for alarm call at 7am, they woke me up at 6.40.....a minor thing but irritating. Breakfast was spectacularly bad. My company booked the hotel for me....I shall make sure I book future hotels myself. This is the worst hotel I have stopped in in London (out of over 30 stop overs over the last 5 years).

Reviews.Title: “Lobby looks better than the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Archgirl16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in London a number of times, and to be honest it is an overpriced city. Decent, affordable hotels are hard to come by. We hired a three bed room and it was fairly priced, especially considering we were struggling to find deals on rooms for three people. We had asked for a double bed and a single bed as we were a married couple travelling with one other person; however, we received three single beds. We were too tired to argue, and to be honest we probably got a better sleep (haha). The outside of the building and the lobby are fairly nice and don't look like the standard white Victorian hotel that there is an abundance of; unfortunately, the rooms were not as nice as the entrance. The rooms were in need of reburbishment as they were old and worn. Seeing past the dated decor, the bedding and bathroom was very clean. The bathroom was humerous, when we opened the door we saw what was smaller than our walk-in-robe at home. The toilet was right up against the bath tub/shower. My husband who is 6"4 nearly had a heart attack and looked at me with pleading eyes asking how on earth he was to use this space or lack there of. For the money the hotel is better than average for London. Elsewhere in the world you would get better for the money, but as far as London goes it was a decent hotel. I had been told that the Concierge was lovely - he must have had time off as we were given grumpy from the seven dwarfs who appeared to be irritated by the fact that we wanted to ask directions and get a 2p photocopy of a map. He wore his golden keys on his lapels, which glinted and mocked me by the lack of serivce and pleasantries he showed. Lastly, we had arrived at the hotel early and our room wasn't ready for us to check in. So we asked for the front desk to store our luggage in their store room. I explained clearly that two bags had glass and other breakables in it. We were told not to worry. I reiterated that there were breakables. Upon returning we discovered that one of the bags was being crushed by a large suitcase and the other bag had obviously fallen and was upside down. I personally was very unimpressed, when I complained the guy said it wasn't him. No sorry was given - luckily my items weren't broken. The location is nice as it is basically facing Kensington Gardens which lead on to Hyde Park. We walked to Harrods etc, which is quite a walk. Best to catch the bus to the sites and back. Fairly cheap for tickets - for three people it was less than 12 pounds in total for a return trip. All in all I would stay there again as it is a clean roof over your head which is better than what you would get at other hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Unkas
Reviews.Content: Room are small, good breakfast and helpful staff. The hotel is situated between two subway stations and for the price I paid I would return back

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Worn out London”
Reviews.Author: Lanka_Latvia
Reviews.Content: well, London must be absolutely ... special in the way that it's so pricey and has very little return for the money. The hotel had stains on the carpet floor both in hallways and in the room. The breakfast was so poor - actually for a hotel of this size to have 6 items for breakfast - coffee (don't even try), milk, musli, cornflakes, bread and marmalade is very, very poor. For 5 pounds extra you can get scrambled eggs and some sausages, but I think it's not worth it. I tried to have breakfast at the hotel for two mornings - but after that I gave up and went to Starbucks for the rest of the week. The location of the hotel is rather central - even Hilton hotel is 1 min walking distance away and Hyde Park is right next. Subway is two blocks away. Neighbourhood is quite good, but definately chooze smth else unless the proximity to the Oxford street is so important.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: sb79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine. A bit pricey for what it was, but perfectly fine. The location is great, close to two tube stations (so a short, short trip to the Heathrow Express). While the room was small (the bed did take up most of the space with minimal room for luggage), it was clean, there were plenty of towels, and the maid service did a good job each day. You were also able to control the heat within the room, which was nice as it was very stuffy in the beginning. Downside - the walls are very thin, and until you get used to it, you think people might be walking towards your room, and you can easily hear people talking. I found the staff to be very nice (in particular, a bartender who had to deal with some unruly drunk people), in general, just very pleasant. Located near a lot of shops/places to eat. If you are from New York, the area reminded me of 34th Street. Not super high end, but plenty of familiar shops/fast food locations.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: Thezed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for the price. Was in London on business hence only there briefly in the mornings and evenings to sleep and for this it is perfectly adequete. Rooms were very clean, as was the bathroom. Went to breakfast on the first morning and it was okay but not worth losing an extra half an hour in bed! I was on the fourth floor but my colleague was on the 1st and his room had obviously been modernised, flat screen tv etc. Fridge in room nice touch (when I found it) Would have liked some drawer space but managed without. Not particularly noisy that I noticed. Agree with other reviews that it is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: amberVenice
Reviews.Content: We stayied at the Central Park Hotel for four nights last week. The location is terrific, very close to the undergroung stops of Queensway and Bayswater, and in a very quiet residencial area mostly populated by asiatic communities.Closeby it's possible to find every kind of shop and restaurants and this was a positive thing. The room was very standard , we booked the Executive Double paying a little bit more and the size was acceptable, with enough space to move around. The bathroom was tiny and basic (little sink-wc-and shower) but the cleanliness in general was quite ok. To conclude....the worst thing has been BREAKFAST!! the coffee was simply dirty water...and the it offered just bread, cerals and milk. I don't think I will stay at the Central Park hotel again on my next visits to the amazing city of London.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to crash each day”
Reviews.Author: jcravens
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny and the ceilings were low, but the room was very clean and modern, the bed was comfortable, we had a small flat screen TV in the room, the bathroom floor was heated, and there was a hair dryer. We couldn't hear people in the other rooms, but we could hear people on the street late at night, so bring your earplugs. Skip the over-priced, very skimpy "English breakfast" at the hotel, which is not worth the money -- stick with the continental breakfast, which is included in the cost of your room, and then have a proper English breakfast at a restaurant. The neighborhood is terrific -- just a few blocks from two different tube stations (and two different tube lines), Hyde Park is less than a block away, and there are restaurants everywhere. This is a site-seers hotel: it's for sleeping after a long day of touring, not for hanging out in your room. Having stayed at more expensive-but-dirtier hotels, I felt this place was worth the money, and will probably stay here again the next time I'm in London.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Stay Away!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Napnjoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night before my wedding. My fiance and I decided to be traditional in spending the night before apart. The hotel was under very loud and messy construction. Upon checking in I asked the front desk about the construction and they said " What construction?" followed by a jackhammer on que. At 5:00A.M I awoke with uncomfortable itching that when inspected were large bites all over my body, including neck and face. I went down to the front desk to show them and they pretended not to know what the bites were and threatened to call the police if I continued to complain. Long story short I checked out and got married and will never forget the Central Park Hotel since I have bedbug bites in my wedding photos and had itchy disgusting wounds for several days that oozed day and night while my new wife and I were trying to enjoy our honeymoon. Please don't let this happen to you it was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel, but there's one point of critic”
Reviews.Author: stephang
Reviews.Content: Hi all, I spent one week in summer 2007 in this hotel and I was very pleased with the service, food and equipment. Also the price was OK for a hotel of that standard There is only one point I found very sad: During the checkin procedure I was asked by the young! female concierge whether I come from germany. After affirming that the reaction was concise, unfriendly and rough. I experienced the same behaviour when I came to the breakfast room by the woman who checked the room cards. As a curious young traveller who wanted to discover London for the first time, it felt very sad to be treated that way. It's a pity because I really liked this hotel and London is such a ecxiting place. Stephan G

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Yair_Mor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Kensington Park in a nice and quiet street. The receptionists were very nice and welcomed us well. The room was pretty clean. It had private bathroom (not shared), TV and safe. Breakfast was nice but very simple. The hotel is located near Queensway tube station which brings you fast wherever you want to go. We enjoyed our stay and the staff. We recommend the hotel for anyone who goes traveling on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Vsch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Central Park Hotel in Sept. We stayed in the main building of the hotel (7th floor). The room was small (average for Europe) and clean. There is a LOT of rehab. work going on in the hotel. So during the day there was a lot of noise and workmen everywhere. We had a couple of minor issues because of the work. But nothing worth mentioning. There is a luggage room that you can leave your bags in if you arrive before check-in. That was very convenient. We were able to explore the city instead of sitting in the lobby for a few hours waiting to check in. The staff was a bit aloof...very polite but not really friendly. Breakfast is cereal and toast/bread. (You have to pay extra for the hot dishes. It didn't seem worth it.) The hotel is very convenient to two tube stations (Queensway and Bayswater). You can get pretty much anywhere on the tube. (It is very organized and easy to use.) There are a couple of Starbucks close to the hotel too if you really need a latte. There are many pubs, restaurants and stores within a few blocks. Hyde Park is very close too. Overall I would recommend this hotel. It's pleasant and conveniently located. Enjoy your trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude pricing for internet”
Reviews.Author: lilpuppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CP for three nigts. Got a good price of 55£/night, single (got a twinroom) including breakfast. The hotel and the room was clean and the room was ok sizewise. Beds confy enough.The location was good, verry close to underground and morningwalks in Hyde Park. No handshower in shower and if you´r a woman wanting to style your hair in the morning, bring you own hairdryer as theirs are worse then you would expect. The tiny tv in room had seen better days and made a ringing noise when turned off. Breakfast was verry poor and probabley the worst hotel-breakfast i´ve ever had. The bartender in the bar had no clue what Dry Martini was. My personal big no-no for this hotel was the high rate for internet connection. Charging 5£/h or 12£/24h for internet connection is to my oppinium rude and since i need/want to be online while indoors, for the cost of 67£/night i would deffenetley choose another hotel where internet is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to sleep - otherwise not recommended”
Reviews.Author: blondiee77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9/17-9/21. The hotel is in a decent neighborhood, close to the tube station, restaurants, pubs, shops and the park. Check in was fast and although they say check in is at 2pm they let us have our room when we arrived which was around 10am. The staff wasn't the friendliest or most helpful, but they were professional. The room was tiny. And I mean tiny. I was expecting small since I'd heard that is the norm over there, but I was shocked at how TINY the room really was. It was clean though, as was the bathroom (also tiny). Breakfast was included in our package but after trying it once we decided to skip it for the rest of our stay. The coffee was terrible and I have no idea what it was they were trying to pass off as orange juice. Stay away. Overall it was an okay place to sleep, however, my one big complaint was the noise coming from some kind of generator right outside the window. Why they would put such a noisy machine right by the window is beyond my comprehension. The room was not air conditioned so the first night we left the window open to let in some air, big mistake. The noise was unbearable. The second night we decided to leave the window shut (I'm thankful it wasn't summertime) and it did block out most of the noise though it was still noticeable. Although the location was nice I don't think I would stay here again or would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bayswater Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovelylassEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked through the hotel website 3wks before staying there. I stayed for 3 nights in a double room with my husband for a internet price of £65 per night for room and continantal breakfast-BARGAIN!!!! On arrival the hotel was packed with Chelsea football fans from overseas that were staying there for the match that night. I was told upon check in that we were to be moved to another hotel as there had been "a problem". I insisted that we were staying there and only there, as some of my business contacts had been told to meet me there and I could not reschedule. I explained that had I been contaced prior to arrival about this then fine but they cannot expect people to just accept being moved once they had arrived, basically because the hotel had chose to overbook and cater for the 100+ footie fans!! The room was surprisingly ok, It was VERY clean and smelt fresh. It was not spacious but average size for a 3* London hotel. The double bed was infact two pushed together but comfy. There was a fridge in the room which was good for snacks and drinks, although room service was not expensive-£1.20 for a coke and £5.50 for chicken and chips, delivered within 10mins of ordering at a busytime(5pm). The hotel is 3mins walk from Queensway tube,8mins from Bayswater tube. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, along the same road as the tube stations. These rooms are ideal if you just want something clean to sleep, shower and get ready. They are not luxurious but they are acceptable. The walls are paper thin so might not be good if you ae a lightsleeper without earplugs! One of the days my meetings were cancelled so I decided to have a lie in and chill out- The cleaners were so loud, chatting in a foreign language nonstop and seemed to be cleaning the whole day 9am until 4pm!!Not a problem if you are out sightseeing but if you are planning to spend you daytime there then not ideal at all. There was building work going on but it was not noticeable noisewise and it didnt hinder the hotel facilities. I expect that when the hotel refurb is finished the prices will go up, they have until December already-It was good because I got a good price but anymore than £75 per night and I dont think it would be worth it as you could get better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic indeed - okay for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: Nealbo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel a few years ago but the standard has dropped quite a bit. It was also undergoing renovation at the time of my two night stay which can't be helped ! They had obviously not got around to my room which was small , very bland and very basic with a tiny television that has seen better days ! The room and hotel was however clean and the staff were okay. I didn't eat there apart from the continental breakfast which was as you'd expect. The location of the hotel is however very nice , being adjacent to Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. I was with my elderly father who is very easy to please but even he thought the hotel was "just okay". Visitors to the UK from far abroad staying a week or a fortnight may be very wise to think carefully before committing themselves to staying here. However as very short stay budget hotel not too bad at all. I probably however won't go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: cgwebber
Reviews.Content: We took a four day trip to London on a very limited budget, and found this hotel through a 'two nights free' offer from British Airways. We read online reviews before we left which described the hotel as small and dirty, but when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. Everything was very clean, and not ridiculously small, just typically european sized. The staff was very nice, and the concierge frequently gave us walking directions, called taxis, and made reservations. We found it to be a very nice, reasonably priced hotel in a fantastic location- about half a block from beautiful Kensington Gardens, a short walk to Portobello Road and Knightsbridge. We would not hesitate in using them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Atlante0
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and found it very good - specially considering the price of 57 GBP including continental breakfast. I was given a room in the ground floor which I suppose is newer than the floors above. It was a really big room, new, surely less than 2 years old, with an LCD TV (which was small but enough) and very clean, too. The staff were friendly and helpful. The quality of the breakfast included in the price was not fantastic but OK. Overall, from my experience I consider this as a good choice for a budget hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jess_2419
Reviews.Content: We got to stay at this hotel for free for two nights through a British Airways promotion. We weren't sure what to expect since it was free, but it was a pleasant surprise! The room was very clean and the hotel is in a good neighborhood. Very near - within walking distance - to two underground stations (Bayswater and Queensway). They were great with holding our luggage until our room was ready, since we arrived early in the morning. And no, the room wasn't too small...it was definitely huge by London standards. I was surprised. I definitely recommend this hotel, especially if getting it through a promotion!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: PhilaLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the list of British Airways 2nights free when booking airfare. I wasn't expecting much. We've stayed at some budget hotels, and I'm not one to write reviews, but this place was great value for London. Number one with me is cleanliness, and our room was VERY VERY clean, (no gunk in tub grout!) and not too small. The location couldn't be better. Right across from Hyde park, near Kensington Palace. Right around the corner from 2 tube stops. Also, like to be near Paddington station to use Heathrow express when flying back home. Many fabulous ethnic restaurants to chose from. The staff was very pleasant, helpful, and professional. Free continental breakfast was ok - but the dining room was large and accomodating for many people-very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value And Good Return!”
Reviews.Author: latinosteve
Reviews.Content: Me and my gf were coming to london for 2 nights for a short break, see a bit of london and a show. In truth, we werent fussed about the hotel but admitted we wanted 3 star. On last minute.com we booked it for £55 a night for both of us, so we thought good value and took it. Alot of people have said in their reviews the outside isnt that pleasent. (Hence why they take photo's of it at night as the shining sign makes it look more fancy) But in truth, who really cares. I rather they spent time on whats inside the hotel than whats outside it. On arrival the staff were very helpful and the first impressions were good. The bar was tidy and the reception area and general presentation was in fact above a 3 star i felt. The staff were polite and check in was quick and simple. As we entered the room we looked around for a few seconds then me and my gf turned to eachother and said 'its alright aint it;. Looking back it was, 1 double bed, private shower/toilet, a tv (not much of a view though). The room was tidy as any room can be, not a stain or smudge anywhere to be seen and the bed was neatly made and the bathroom was spotless. Its quite strange but it was almost too plain and simple, but its what we wanted. There was building work going on at the time however this was a while ago. I was disappointed the hotel had not informed us of this but as we wanted to gone by 10am or so anyway we didnt let is bother us. To sum it up generally. The room was clean, tidy and although there isnt acres of space you have plenty of room to move around and get ready for going out. If i wanted to take my girlfriend away for a special romantic occassion i wouldnt come here but as we just wanted to see london this hotel was perfect and couldnt fault it. We paid a cheap rate and good a decent room and the continental breakfast was good standard also so you wont be let down. I would say if you just want a pleasent hotel to stay at for a night or 2 then i wouldnt hesitate in saying stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a penny.....right now...”
Reviews.Author: Maritre
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for 3 nights after having a look at their web-site. Well, the single room did look small, but at least the lobby and the rest of the hotel looked really nice. So I thought..... Arriving there I arrived at a building site. The hotel is rebuilding it's lobby (and some rooms) and it looked horrible even from the outside. The single room (executive I was told) was actually smaller than it looked on the photo. There were no towels, the fridge was broken and two of the lamps did not work. Building works startet at 9AM in the morning, so I had an early wake up call and headed for the breakfast room. If you're not picky when it comes to food the continental breakfast served in the food hall is ok - toast and marmelade. After breakfast I went back to the lobby and it's unfriendly staff and cancelled my last night. Could not get away from there fast enough. Hopefully it will be better when they have finished their building work - but untill then I would stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: stein5285
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the money. Food was not as bad as people say. At least they include breakfast with the room. Free papers are also avaliable. Hotel is close to public transportation. Rooms not as small as other European hotels I have stayed at. Front Desk was not as helpul as I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: goulashBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights at a price of GBP 76, booked through the hotel's website. Hotel is in a quiet area close to the centre of London. Metro and bus closeby. Rooms are small but clean. Our room was recently refurbished. Dont expect too much from breakfast (soft horrible croissants and breadrols with confiture, for 5 GPB you can take the English breakfast........however having looked at it you can better take an English breakfast outside). This hotel is very good value if you want to be close to where all the action is. Most likely the prices will go up when the hotel is fully refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK!”
Reviews.Author: Saikku
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel. It was better than we expected. The room was small, but there was everything we needed. The bed was good and the bathroom small but comfortable and very clean. The continental breakfast was enough for us and tea was very good! Location was very good, there were a lot of shops and restaurants just around the corner. Bus stop and underground was nearby, but sometimes we walked through the Kensington Park as far as the Thames. If you want a place to have a bath in a clean bathroom and sleep in comfortable bed after walking around this lovely city for all day long, this is a place for you. If you want to stay in hotel, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “good but . . .”
Reviews.Author: bluth-boi
Reviews.Content: only problem i had with the hotel were the staff in reception extremely rude and unhelpful, was barely even acknowledged upon checking in, not even wished a pleasant stay and not even a thank you upon checking out. The rest of the staff were extremely pleasant. Continental breakfast not great but did the job, ex cellent location, only two minutes from queenway and bayswater tube line which is a real selling point, would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money, but not great”
Reviews.Author: IUlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not horrible, but as far as comfort goes for a vacation, it was bad. Our room was on the top floor, one window was boarded up and the other only opened a tiny bit. There was no air conditioning, which was alright at night, but almost nauseating in the morning when the sun shined directly into the room. The hotel staff was not very helpful, except when they allowed us to check out early without paying a fee, and the area was a little too hectic and overcrowded with tourists. We would not stay there again, but the hotel was under renovation, so I imagine many of these problems will be worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loopsandcream
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel i looked up on this website this hotel, i thought i made a very bad mistake, so on Tuesday 19th June my expectataions wernt up to much. When i arrived i was in shock. The hotel was huge and there was a lovely modern bar on the left with leather chairs and SKY tv. Then whne I went to reception the staff were very pleasant. There was updating of the building going on when i arrives on the tuesday but by the time id left it was all gone. I was in a triple room and thought it would be quite small, but much to my delight it was perfect. It was extremely clean, it had 2 bid beds, and then there was a foldable bed, which was no problem at all, it was still big and an big adult would have no problem sleeping in it. The room had a fridge, desk, tea/coffee making facilites and a hairdryer. The bathroom was immaculate modern, and quite big, the shower was lovely. I had continental breakfast in the morning which was nice, crossants bread toast ceral and orange or apple juice. The location of the hotel is superb, Only down the road is Hyde Park and then Bayswater tube station. Would i stay here again: Defiently

Reviews.Title: “Substandard”
Reviews.Author: RogerThornhill
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was substandard all around and I would not recommend it to anyone. To begin with there was considerable re-modeling going, which is something we were not made aware of. Secondly, we were given a tiny triple room on the first floor which although fairly clean, had a horrible view to a wall and assorted utility ducts. It gets worse: The TV set was miniscule, did not work well and had no cable. The continental breakfast was served in a room resembling a prison canteen. The staff was inexperienced and unfriendly except for a nice bartender. The price is too high for what you get. We have been travelling to London for many years and we love the city but this is probably the worse hotel experience we've ever had. The only plus is the location (across from Hyde Park) but there are much better choices in the area than this glorified flophouse.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were unfriendly and disorganized. They could not seem to find our booking and eventually placed us in a room. This consisted of a small sitting room with one chair and a TV. There was only enough room for our cases. The bedroom was so tiny we had to walk sideways to get into the bed. Breakfast was a choice of continental or for five pounds we could have eggs, sausage, bacon, beans and mushrooms. We paid the five pounds but discovered we were ripped off. The cooked breakfast was inedible - overcooked and tasteless. The orange juice, coffee, cereal, toast and selection of jams would have been preferred and was included in the cost of the stay at the hotel. The street was very noisy and the sounds came into the room throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Had some bites”
Reviews.Author: DukeyTo
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked pretty bad inside, messy and dirty. Our room was fine, although quite small. The bathroom was clean. I did get feasted upon at night (bed bugs?) but we walked so much during our days that I just wanted to sleep and really what could I do? The location was good, the breakfast was pretty bad unless you wanted to pay extra for the english breakfast which we did not. Overall not great but we survived.

Reviews.Title: “Good value budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoDfromEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via BHRC online and got good value for a budget hotel in Central London. The lobby is currently undergoing reburbishment works and so looks a little untidy however the bar area at the front of the hotel is welcoming with 2 large plasma screen TVs and comfy seating area. Check in was quick and easy and although we arrrived 2 hours prior to the check in time our room was ready for us. The staff were very pleasant and friendly. The bedrooms are adequate for the 1 night we stayed and were very clean and tidy, bathroom is tiny but again was very clean. All in all a great location, easy for Hyde Park and easy walking distances to shops, underground and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel for the budget traveller who doesnt expect the Hilton for the price of a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you're stuck for a place”
Reviews.Author: murmur
Reviews.Content: For the price I wasn't expecting it to be amazing but overall I was disappointed. I found the staff rude and unhelpful. The bedroom was clean but needed refurbishment, ripped wallpaper etc. The bathroom was fine. I was disappointed there was no fruit or yoghurt for breakfast, just cereal and fried breakfast. The lobby area is being done up so half of it was like a construction site. There was noise from other bedrooms, and in the morning there was construction noise outside from about 7am. I would stay here if you need a place in central london for a night or two but definitely wouldn't expect to relax there.

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ande2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Central Park Hotel for 5 days and we were very satisfied with this hotel. I've been to a lot of London's budget hotels and this one has a lot of advantages: The check-in and check-out were fast and friendly as we had pre-paid vouchers and the cloak-room was available and guarded. The new lifts were working nicely and the corridors of this hotel are broad. The rooms were large enough and recently renovated. The fridge and the safety-box in our room were a definate plus and the location of this hotel is excellent: So close to Bayswater Road and Queensway. Some minor minus points from a very little bathroom (it worked very well, though) and not enough room for our clothes. The continental breakfast was poor, but we bought the English breakfast (4£) on most mornings and it got us through half of the day. We had some small problems with our rooms, but they were corrected effectively by the friendly staff. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to a budget minded tourist, who needs a comfortable place just to relax and does spend his time touring the vast city not in the hotel. Remember to use the great restaurants near-by on Queensway and Westbourne Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl2007
Reviews.Content: We got two nights here free for booking our airfare through BA. There are a ton of just such hotels in the Bayswater/Paddington area and this one is middle of the pack. Tiny room with TV that did not work, even tinier bathroom. Room was reasonably clean. Hotel's main lobby under construction, so it might look better soon. Close to Queensway tube stop and Kensington Park. Front desk was nice enough but the woman working the morning breakfast buffet was not. The included breakfast was meager and it was definitely not worth spending the extra money to add on the hot foods portion of the buffet. Overall, I've stayed at better places in this same area (also free from BA). Not recommended, but not also so terrible that I'd warn you to stay away. Just come with low expectations and things should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: GerberZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for tree night in April. Booked in advance with Hotels.com and found our triple room to be perfectly acceptable. I would agree that we could hear all that was happening in the room next to me. Major plus is how close the hotel is to Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. We found it convenient to have a breakfast at the hotel. It was simple, nothing special but nice and convenient feature. Overall it was a good choice for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great. clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilsquirrel
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through expedia for $95 CND/nite. Not a bad hotel as it's a good location and priced well for London. Close to subway station and Hyde park (beautiful and a must see). Lots of eateries nearby down the street as well (chinese food, pasta etc). Would definitely stay here again. Service was mediocre, but didn't mind as we were there just to sleep. Complimentary breakfast (cereal, bread, juice), which helps in such an expensive city to dine in. Only problems: almost got mugged returning one night from some drunken revelers (seems to be a few on a friday nite) when returning from dinner, and I swear I had a (friendly, but mischievous) encounter with the supernatural one night. Something, or someone, decided to have a pillow fight with me one night and I was fully awake (by the noisy people outside easily heard through the thin windows) and my friend was sound asleep. Creepy? Not really. Makes for a good story, though =)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: HinckleyFox
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with Hyde park being a stones throw away and 2 underground stations just round the corner. I stayed in a single room which I thought was a good size for a London hotel, rooms were also very clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: poohbearRowlett
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews of this hotel, I was worried; after our trip, I couldn't wait to get home and write my own! 1) Some reviewers said that the rooms weren't clean: I found ours to be very clean, and thoroughly cleaned each day. 2) "Staff wasn't helpful"; yes, they were! from the time we arrived, they couldn't have been nicer or more helpful! 3) "Rooms were small"; true, but I've never been in any economy hotel in any city in Europe where that wasn't the case, and I've been in London, Paris, Athens, Rome, and several cities in Germany, Scotland, & Ireland. 4) Complaints about breakfast; the Free continental breakfast offers a variety of cereals, juices, tea, coffee and rolls; that was plenty for us, although one morning we paid for the hot breakfast and found it to be very good; maybe a little overpriced, but London is a very expensive city; you should be prepared for that before you go! Location was excellent; all in all, I would recommend this hotel, and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad good location”
Reviews.Author: froggyfrog
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok: I've stayed at this location twice. The location is very good with lots of pubs, stores and 2 tube stops right up the street. It's much better to stay here in the winter than in the summer because they don't have air conditioning which was horrible. No fans where available either we asked the front desk. Other than that the rooms are small but clean and it's a good value.

Reviews.Title: “fair value .”
Reviews.Author: scofield999
Reviews.Content: Price is not so stable, i booked 3 nights, 2 are $49, 1 is $104. 5 mins from Queensway Tube, quite convenience to be honest. 15 mins from Paddington Station. Breakfast ...uhhhh.......to be honest, not enough choices. Orange juicy.........Crazzzzzzzy. Seem mixed with water..... Bread like a rock I prefer Toast because it is a hot food. Tea is ok, better than expect. Room, not so big enough, Bed is small, but clean and tidy. Toilet is small, but I think ok for me. TV channel...limited of choices.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of a Shark Tank”
Reviews.Author: kaakre
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed at the Cental Park for two nights in December. It was booked as part of a package. The usual British check-in pain infliction is observed here. No check in until 3:00 pm but on your day of checkout your card key is deactivated at 10:30. I judge a hotel by whether or not they look out for their guests. If they work hand in hand with the crooks it is a bad situaution. We needed a cab for a trip that would be 10 GBP in a real London cab. The concierge got us one and announced that the fare was 15 GBP and that it would be a mini-cab rather than a regular cab with a meter. We needed to make the meeting so I agreed. Once in the cab the cabbie raised the price to 18 GBP! I assume the guys and/or the management at the hotel get a kickback for this "service". Second example of how badly these guys treat customers is the exchange rate. Hotel rates are not normally the best but they are usually in the zone. Not so here-- with the USD/GBP rate at 1.93 these guys have a posted exchange rate of 2.23! That has to be the worst in the world! Incredible. These guys are not your friends. You are a victim to be plucked not a customer to be helped. Room was OK by my London standards. Small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: KeyWest77
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel perfectly fine for our short stay in london. The room was quite small and was very basic, but had everything we wanted. The location was quite good, right next to Hype Park. Cooked breakfast was £4 and you can ask for what you want from the chef. There is also croissants, bread, and cereal which you can help yourself to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but little else to offer”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLimey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, and it is not as bad as some of these reviewers are saying. The rooms are very small, but most of the cheaper London hotels are. The facilities are not upmarket. However, the location is great. Lots of shops and restaurants five minutes down the road. Right across the street from Kensington Gardens with a palace, park and playground. The tube directly into central London is a five minute walk. As for the Arabic comments, of course the TVs have BBC and ITV. We watched the World Cup every night we were there! You can do better than this hotel, but the price is good. Debbie Ockey Fresno, California USA

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend..”
Reviews.Author: kalena32
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room in this hotel for a 5 night stay in December (as I write this it is our last night here). The room is tiny with not enough space for us to move around in, the fridge isn't working, I think we might have been in the renovated part but it doesn't look like it. The bathroom is also tiny - there is no space to dry yourself etc and to get the hot water you needed to run the water for a while. One day we had no hot water at all and when we rung reception the phone was constantly engaged - probably taken off the hook in anticipation of all the complaints. Breakfast was ok - like other reviewers said there is not a lot of variety - fresh rolls, tea/coffee, juice, cornflakes or muesli and other condiments but it is sufficient. The hot breakfast is not good value for money, there are other restaurants etc in the local area which provide a better hot english breakfast. Your breakfast has to be paid for there and then (if you are paying for the hot option) it cannot be charged to your room. TV - only a couple of BBC stations, channel 5 and arabic stations. No pay movies etc. Phone - you cannot pick up the phone and make a call which is ridiculous for a hotel even if its a 2 star! You have to pay a 20 pound deposit if you wish to use your phone, EVEN if you have given them your credit card for your account. Taxi - Be VERY careful with the hotel taxi, we were nearly ripped off by the taxi they organised us - he tried to charge us 8 pounds more than what a black cab would cost and when we queried the cost pretended he was recalculating and reduced his price substantially. There are no meters in their taxis so make sure you get a price before you start your journey. Its just as easy to go onto Bayswater Road and hail a cab, at least you know you wont get ripped off by a dodgy cab operator. Internet - pretty expensive, was originally paying 5 pounds for 2 hours but this was changed yesterday so now you pay 5 pounds for 1 hour. Wireless which is good. Staff - on the whole seemed friendly however hard to understand and converse with. Over the phone conversation is totally lost in translation. Upside, room seemed clean, location close to the tube, across (almost) from the park. Overall, this is a disappointing hotel and I would not recommend staying here. I've stayed in hostels that provided better service, accommodation and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Leicester_Girl
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at the Central Park hotel - we chose this hotel as it was central and looked far better than those in the same price bracket. The location is good - 10 mins walk to Oxford Street, 10 mins in a taxi to the west end and close to the central line and circle line tube stations. It suited our needs perfectly. I agree, the walls are thin! We heard talking from the room next door like it was in our room. But the room served it's purpose - the bathroom was fine, the bed comfy and the room quite spacious for the location. The only downfall was the staff - the receptionists seemed far more interested in picking up the 'phone then talking to the customers that were in front of them. All in all, I would stay there again - it's clean and functional and you can get a room at £50 per night - a steal!

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy...”
Reviews.Author: DriftwoodB
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews, slamming the staff, and the rooms, I did not have high expectations staying here. First, the staff were very helpful and pleasant. The lounge area is large and friendly with a nice bar. The rooms were clean and large enough. I have stayed in rooms that were so small you had to go outside to change your mind. Bathrooms were spotless and cleaned everyday. We pretty much stayed with the continental breakfast of coffee, croissant and cereal. A few people in our group did opt for the "English" Breakfast and were not pleased. For the 8 pounds ($16US), it was not worth it. The only drawback that we had was that the rooms all face the street. The buildings are 4 stories high and the street acts as an acoustic amplifier, so every sound travels up into the rooms. Other than that, it is ideally located, close to tube stops and restuarants There is a wonderful Italian Restuarant about 7 blocks down on Bayswater called Zizzi. I highly recommend it. Delightful staff, marvelous food, the best meals we had when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly OK”
Reviews.Author: Tightrope78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in mid November. Booked in advance with Expedia and found my single room to be perfectly acceptable. Clean, tidy and a very comfortable bed. I would agree that the walls must be paper thin as I could hear all that was happening in the room next to me. The hotel is undergoing rennovations at the minute and whilst this had no impact on me you may want to take it into consideration. Major plus is how close the hotel is to Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. I did not sample the breakfast therefore am unable to comment on the food available.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brandi715
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ridiculously small, unless you upgrade. Our suitcases barely fit. The walls are very thin and each night of our trip at around 3 am, we heard doors slamming so loudly that I eventually had to open the door and say something to the people. There is no air conditioning, which allowed the confined space to get stuffy, and when we opened the window at night, we had to deal with the noise of pigeons. The staff angered me the most. I felt like they had never spoken with someone from America and were not interested in doing so at the time. Really, I have never had a hotel staff belittle me so much. The best part of the staff was the bartender in the lobby. Do yourself a favor and research other options. Each day of our trip, we dreaded returning to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Central Park , ok with me”
Reviews.Author: poshfitvee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park Hotel at the begining of September. I rather enjoyed my stay at this hotel . The rooms were clean and were kept clean everyday starting at 10:30 am. The staff was also very polite and helpful. The only thing that they could improve on is getting a couch in their lobby area and letting people who are travelling internationally place their luggages in another room until their rooms are ready. We arrived too early as did many others did and we had to wait. I understand about the wait because most hotels do have a check in and out time so our waiting wasn't such a bad thing. The other things that I enjoyed was the fact that Hyde Park was just down the street, there where tons of shops and resturants just a block over , the tube (Queensway ) was also on the same block as well ( right next to the Hilton ).Also there were plenty of T.V channels including one channel that played alot of american movies and shows ( in case you become homesick) as well as a porn channel.I can't comment on the free breakfast because I never ate there. I ate from the deli at Spar grocery. Loved it ! You get two Samosas for a pound. Overall I would say that if you were to come to London I would reccomend this hotel.You'll get a clean room, polite staff, T.V with plenty of channels , a phone , plenty of hot water and porn don't forget the porn. LOL ! However if your coming to London to stay in your hotel room then , No , I definitely don't reccomend that you stay here. Note: You will pay 20 pounds to activate the phone ( even if you have a phone card to use, which you can buy around the corner from the hotel ) , the rooms are small so don't flip out when you see it, Americans beware there are no face towels ( wash cloths ) available so bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: jtfman
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are basic, at best. Price was good. Breakfast was dreadful, definitely go elsewhere. Not a good location on the weekend given the distance from central Londan and the expense of taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotell to an OK price”
Reviews.Author: swede82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Central Park between 18th and 24th september 2006. The outside of the hotell i very nice, well litt in a blueish light. The lobby was big and the staff was very friendly and helpful. But onece you get in your room the problems starts. It took us about 30 minutes to understand how to turn the lights on (you have to put your keycard in too get light). The room was very small and there were no storage space, so our cloths stayed in our suitcases för the entier stay. To the good thins.... The loacation is perfect. Only five minutes with the underground to Oxford Circus. The buses to Piccadilly, Victoria and Kings Cross went 24/7. Also very close to resturants, shops and pubs. Queensway is just around the corner, with everything you could possiblie need. I would deffently stay there agin. But not for more than 5 days, tops.

Reviews.Title: “All services uner 1 roof”
Reviews.Author: JesterDonnelly
Reviews.Content: I booked through Placestostay.com as one of their recommended hotels and we were very happy. The staff were very helpful when we arrived at 23.00 and even offered us rooms service. The rooms are fine, a little dated but clean and airy. There is an ATm, shop, bar and restaurant here as well as a post box in reception - no joke!! The hotel is beside the park and underground, also some large shopping centre (sorry can't remember name!) is close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “London's Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffpot
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks fine from the street and the reception area is OK, but once you are shown to your room, or should I call it a dog box, any illusions of having a pleasant stay in a London Hotel are quickly shattered. The room is so small that my husband and I couldn't pass each other, one had to sit on the bed or leave the room. This is not an exageration. We were on the 7th floor, facing due west and it was 32 degrees outside. Inside our room it would easily have been 35 - 38 degrees. There is no air conditioning! The bathroom was so small you couldn't dry any part of your body. You could hardly lift your arms to brush your hair. There was no satalite TV, the mini bar was completely empty and the fridge didn't work. I find it hard to accept that these rooms pass the authorities' standards. They are shocking. The breakfast was consistant with the cell like rooms. Do not stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Central Dump Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frunkah
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Central Park Hotel this past July. We were very disappointed upon arrival. We arrived prior to check in time and when we asked if there was a bathroom or a room to change our clothes we were told NO. There is NO airconditioning in this hotel. YES YOU READ THAT CORRECTLY!! It was the middle of July - very hot and we were on the 3rd floor. This hotel is also under construction which made opening the windows a noisy affair. We paid for the "continental breakfast" when we booked our room however when we arrived for breakfast we were told to pay an additional 4 pounds if we wanted hot food. All that was offered to us was cold cereal and bread. The room smelled of smoke and was extremely small in size. Our TV did not work. This hotel should be called the Central Dump Hotel because it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Al Jazeera”
Reviews.Author: Virginia Gentleman
Reviews.Content: If you want to know what the weather is in London you better bring an arabic translator. Even then you probably won't know what the weather is going to be like in London because Al Jazeera is the only news channel in this hotel. If you can speak arabic you might be able to find out about someplace in the Middle East. This hotel is in London. Where is the BBC or CNN?

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: vanlinks
Reviews.Content: Room: I have booked a single bed state room; it is a very small room. It looks like the size is 6x8. Overall the room is clean and I had no major complains with it. Just a note, this hotel does not have air conditioning unit in the rooms. Surrounding area: This hotel is situated in a very good location. It takes only 7 minutes walking to “Bayswater” tube station which you can take either “circle” or “district” line. There are lots of places you can eat nearby the hotel, only takes few minutes of walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: AKSanchez
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was a bit skeptical about staying at this hotel but, it was great. In a great location, close to the tube, friendly staff, very clean room. We had what I imagine to be one of the most undesirable rooms, down in the basement with no window. It did make it a bit difficult to know when morning came but hey, we were in London to see London...not to sit in our hotel room viewing it from a window. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good If you Speak Arabic!!”
Reviews.Author: DaffyDuckDC
Reviews.Content: GOOD HOTEL IF YOU SPEEK ARABIC.... I have traveled the world and one thing is consistant... CNN or BBC TV... This hotel in the heart of london had neither.. you would think a London hotel would offer BBC at least, but no... It had al jazeera of all stations. In additon, the bathroom sink would not drian.. there are many better hotels many better ones! This hotel did offer a free breakfast but was loaded with tourists mostly blue hairs and camera toaters...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean and a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ekbno
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel, Easter 2006, and it was a pleasant surprise. Room 727 was facing the backside of the hotel and although there was some noise from a fan outside, it was quiet. The room was very clean and not as small as expected, enough room at both sides of bed to keep suitcases, etc. The furniture and decoration seemed quite new. You need to put the keycard into a cardholder in order to switch on the electricity. The refrigerator was dependent on the keycard to function, so it was only cold when we stayed in the room. The heating was easy to switch on and off (temperature switch) and windows could be opened. Remember to bring an adaptor, can be bought in the gift-shop but overpriced. The bed was a double bed with only one large mattress and one large blanket/sheet. It was quite comfortable, but I would have preferred two mattresses. The bathroom was nice and clean, with a tub. The water pressure was a little low and I missed a hand-shower. Towels were changed every day, the bathroom fan was quite noisy. Staff was quite friendly and helpful. The reception area was a bit worn and the breakfast room could need a makeover. The only thing to complain about was the poor continental breakfast. It consisted of toast, rolls, 3 types of jam, butter, cereals, milk, juice, tea, coffee and water. If you pay £4 you could have english breakfast with fried or boiled eggs, bacon, sausages, baked beans, cheese and ham. It was not really worth the price. As this is a large hotel, the breakfast room was quite crowded and guests sometimes had to wait for a free table. The closest bus stop is in Bayswater Road, only 1 minute away. Queensway tube station is approx. 3 min. away (closed until Sept. 2006) and Bayswater approx. 5-6 min. away. There are plenty of restaurants and burger shops in the neighbourhood. All in all we really enjoyed the Central Park Hotel, and would consider this for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “not bad...but not great”
Reviews.Author: serg33
Reviews.Content: I knew, after reading some of the reviews, that this hotel was so-so. I only stayed for one night and paid 58 pounds. The room itself isn't too bad, they are fairly clean. The room is super small and the bathroom is super duper small. The hot water is cold and the cold water is even colder. I let the "hot" water run for a few minutes thinking that it will eventually heat up...I was wrong. The lady at the counter had told me that all their rooms are non-smoking, but when I walked in the room the stench of smoke was pretty bad. It's a good place to stay for about a day or two, maybe three, if you don't mind the smell, or no hot water and you only need a place to lay your head. I went by myself and I didn't need much space so the lack of space wasn't much of a problem for me. I don't think I would go back though, I'll try my luck somewhere else. Nearest tube is about 5-7 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, definitely not as bad as people state”
Reviews.Author: Estadounidense
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reasonably priced and had mid-level accomodations for budget-middle of the road travellers. High Points ---- Clean/modern rooms Refrigerator in each room Individual heating/cooling in each room Very warm blankets (great for winter) Complimentary tea, coffee, shampoo and soap in each room Full bath tubs with HOT water at all hours Great price if you get a deal Mostly quiet rooms from outside noise Great view from street-facing rooms Bus stop almost directly in front of hotel Gas station/24 hour convenience store very close to hotel Gift shop has various items you might need (including umbrellas) Middle Points ---- Quite a walk to nearest tube stop (Queensway is under repairs) Staff is adequate, not the best, not the worst Smoky lobby due to bar area proximity to doors Not the best cleaning staff. Rooms are clean enough, but you probably will find dust, crumbs, stray hairs on floor, maybe on sheets. Breakfast choices on free breakfast are limited, but it is all you can eat. Not many activities around in the area Cash machine in lobby, pricey on fees, but it is still there Low Points ---- Walls are paper thin. You can hear just about everything in the next room and they can hear you as well. Full English breakfast costs 4 pounds more and really isn't worth it. Terrible view if you get a non-street view room (construction on building behind hotel) **Internet Access is 3 pounds for 30 minutes, 5 pounds for 2 hours, and I think 17 pounds for 24 hours, 129 pounds for a week. WAY too expensive.**

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good afterall”
Reviews.Author: ZepLui
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, at first I did not have any high expectations from the hotel, but quite thankly I was wrong. I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights starting from March 3, my first impression regarding this hotel was pretty good: just one and a half block from Bayswater underground station (about 5 mins walking distance). Nearby you can find all kinds of shops and restaurants (even a shopping mall). I was able to check-in early (around 12pm), they put me into a single room on 6th floor, the room is really small, but since I only stayed there for the "bed", so it didn't bother me that much. No problem with any tile, sink, toilet and shower head - thank God! But it's true that the walls are not able to intercept any noice from the ajacent rooms - I can always hear next door neighbours' conversations (at night time) and the sound of their light-switching. Other than that everything was fine. Next time if I come to London, this hotel will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Compared to the others, this was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: FSA
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately at the moment I find myself staying at quite a few budget hotels in the Bayswater area, and the Central Park is certainly one of the better ones I've endured. Not entirely sure why they squeezed an obscenely huge superking bed into such a small room, which left only very limited circulation space, but at least the bed wasn't squashed up against the wall as in many other budget hotels around here. We paid £56 with [--------] for a double room having done a price check on trip advisor and I'd say it was pretty good value for money.Room was clean, bathroom a usable size and layout, the television worked, there was air conditioning and it was mercifully quiet. Didn't bother trying the included continental breakfast following the comments from other Trip advisor reviewers. I would definitely choose this hotel again if it was at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend at this hotel.Two friends,my husband and myself booked three nights as part of a theatre break in a national newspaper.The hotel was better than we expected considering the total cost per person was £89(not bad for 3 nights B&B and a night at the theatre).Rooms were a bit on the small side but who wants to spend all their time in an hotel bedroom.They were cleaned every day,even the shower curtain was taken away to be cleaned.Staff were very pleasant and hotel was well situated for sightseeing.The weather was very cold but the rooms were nice and warm.I would certainly return to this hotel and would have no problem recommending it.Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No duct tape on the carpet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at five London hotels on the low/mid range of the scale so I understand what's up. Small cramped room I can accept, but the whole place needs some good maintenance which the management is putting off. I think they are trying to make money by being cheap and in the long run it doesn't pay off. I booked this as part of a package so I didn't have a choice but when I come back to London I won't stay here again. Indifferent staff, ugly decor and a general stinginess persists. The best I can say it that I didn't see any duct tape patches on the carpet though I would not have been surprised to see some. Such a negative contrast to my previous hotel a few blocks away near Paddington and at the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - minor grumbles”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night(13th Feb 06)as part of a theatre package booked through a national newspaper. The actual cost of the hotel was FREE so I can't really grumble there. Arrived just after 3pm and our room was ready.The reception staff were polite and helpful. Our room was on the 6th floor which faced East towards the city and was high enough to look over the rooftops of the buildings opposite so we had a bit of a view.However,the room was on the main road side so if you had your window open it did become rather noisy. The room was clean and tidy and was of typical size for this kind of hotel but the bathroom was a bit on the small side.The toilet pan was also unusually small.Gentlemen would discover this when they sat on it - if you get my meaning!! Our toilet wouldn't flush very well either, it took six or seven attempts to get rid of any embarressment.One other small niggle was there was no shower/shampoo gel supplied.Even some of the most budget hotels I have stayed in supplied it in either mini bottle form or as a dispenser on the wall.Mini soap bars were supplied however.Our bed was very comfortable.The bar lounge stayed open until 1am,in fact,it stayed open a little longer if there were enough people in.The Aussie barman (I never did get his name)was very friendly and helpful although the bar prices were typical West London - £3.20 for a pint of Fosters,but that wasn't the barmans fault.Still can't grumble too much after all we were getting the hotel for free. The buffet breakfast in the morning was plentiful but we opted for the cooked English breakfast at £4 each which was very good value for money.It was hot and tasty and you could still help yourself to the buffet if you were still hungry.Even though there was a 3 hour "window" for breakfast 7 - 10am, the restaurant didn't seem to have enough tables for the number of guests staying there.At times there was a bit of a queue waiting for a clean table.The restaurant itself could have done with a makeover,it looked a bit tired. Just a couple other minor moans - the gift shop on the ground floor didn't sell daily newspapers and one other thing that would have been useful was an ATM machine in the reception.On a positive note the hotel was in a good location close to Hyde park,bus routes and several tube stations.Queensway was just around the corner with a selection of shops,bars and restaurants plus a casino and the famous ice rink - where I met my wife 32 years ago!! I am not so sure if I would stay at the Central Park if I was paying full rates,however as part of a theatre package it was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “REASONABLE BUDGET HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Paul200
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 10 Feb 06 as part of a theatre break. The accommodation was in fact free - no complaints about value then. We stayed on the 7th floor and the hotel was generally quiet inside but a bit raucous outside until the early hours. That said it was not really a big problem. The room had recently been revamped and was in good condition but the fittings were not of high quality and I suspect the rooms will be a bit shabby in 12 months time. Breakfast is taken in the basement restaurant and was ok for this type of budget hotel. Staff were polite and all in all I was pleasantly suprised by my stay. However, I am not sure I would choose to stay here if I was actually parting with hard cash!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: dianej01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband and daughter for 5 nights in a triple room, Pluses, the hotel is clean, the staff were helpful - even getting in my favourite vermouth, it was good value for money, close to tube station and near a nice shopping / dining out area,the in room fridge was handy for storing milk and biscuits [the hotel provide only 1 sachet of coffee per person per night], Minuses, the room was tiny and very cramped [3 single bads with only a few inches between and hardly enough space to stand], the bathroom was minute [approx 6' x 4' with WC, hand washbasin and bath], there was hardly anywhere to hang / keep clothes and we had to live out of the suitcases [which were on the floor], no drawer space and no door on the wardrobe, at night it was often noisy on 3 nights we were woken in the early hours by neighbours, on the final morning we were woken first by phone and then by knocking on the door at 7:30am by a member fo staff looking for the iron we had returned the previous night, In short if you want some where clean and basic at reasonable prices then try this hotel, but remember it is no frills and you get what you pay for,

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Shelley_2411
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a theatre break so we didn't actually select it. However, we looked it up on the internet and it looked OK. I would say that OK was all it was. Checking in time is after 3PM but our room wasn't ready until 4.15, even then I had to ask the receptionist when it would be available as he just moved onto to the next person in line (it was very busy). When we eventually got our room it was no. 149 which turned out to be underground so no window. The room itself was clean but the light switch to the bathroom was broken and the hairdryer didn't work. The breakfast was alright but my husband (who is a chef) was concerned about the hygiene as there were no tongs for the rolls/bread, the restaurant manager who allocated you a table was also cooking on the hot plate (with no apron), the tea bags were not seperated so you had to do it with your fingers. Whilst I am a clean person I am sure that there are others who aren't so clean. The restaurant was also underground and in general need of updating. This hotel is OK for a night but I would not book a decent length stay their, I found the staff impersonal and disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Central Park Hotel is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying, after reading some reviews but this is a great hotel. For a 3 star rated hotel you could want for nothing more. The room we stayed in seemed like it had just been refurbished and was tidy and cleaned every day. Never had a problem. Once or twice a couple of staff were a little short but not rude. This hotel has short walk access to three different tube stations and I would definately stay here again - for 40 pounds/night this hotel was great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel - fine, Staff - not so fine”
Reviews.Author: Lyon06
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay in London at the Central Park Hotel, Bayswater. Following advice on the site we were expecting a comfortable room (if not very big) and a good location and that is was we got. Considering we paid just 70 odd quid each for theatre and two nights we got good value for money. The only disapointment with the hotel though was the staff - we reported a broken shower not long after arriving on the friday night, which we were promised would be fixed by the time we returned form the theatre that night - it wasn't. The staff on reception weren't very helpful and English wasn't (or didn't seem to be) any of their first languages. We were assured that a room would be reserved and ready for us the following day but when we enquired at reception the next morning no record had been made and we were faced with another day with no shower. After much complaining they finally agreed to move our room and the weekend ended fine. The hotel is by Kennsington Garden and Hyde Park and a good place to start exploring either on foot or by tube.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about the Cenral Park Hotel it was with some trepidation that we travelled there. We needn't have worried!! The hotel was warm and welcoming with friendly staff who soon sorted out the problem of having us booked in a twin room for one night when in fact the booking was for a triple room for two nights (we had written confirmation with us, luckily). True, the room wasn't very spacious and the bathroom was tiny but white tiles and very good lighting gave the illusion of space, and everything was spotless. The beds were comfortable and the only criticism was that a chest of drawers would have been more useful than the small fridge (but that's a very personal observation). Also, my advice to would-be visitors is to take extra coathangers as the ones provided did not hold anything of any weight without falling off the hook, and there were only four of them! The decor and carpets were pleasant and clean and the whole hotel had the feel of a much more expensive establishment. Breakfast was adequate if not very exciting but the cooked breakfast was worth the £4 extra for those who wanted it. The location couldn't be better and we didn't even use the Underground to get into central London. A walk through Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park is a great way to start the day. Just round the corner on Queensway is the main hub of Bayswater with a great choice of restaurants offering cuisine from around the world. We found it better to eat there in the evenings and then go into the West End rather than trying to find a meal in the West End itself - much more relaxing. All in all we had a great few days in London and this was due in small part to the Central Park Hotel and it's location. Would we stay there again? Definitely!Would we recommend it? Definitely! To anyone who has stayed there and not been satisfied I would say "If you want The Hilton then pay Hilton prices"!!! If you want a good, clean, pleasant hotel within spitting distance of Central London, then choose The Central Park at Bayswater!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OAP's
Reviews.Content: Due to the fact that we live in quite close proximity to London, we have very rarely stayed overnight; we travel a lot worldwide & hear many unfavourable comments about 'London Hotels'- so we were wary of this hotel as it was so reasonably priced. BUT what a pleasant surprise, the staff on check-in were extremely friendly & helpful as were ALL the staff; the room was clean & comfortable. I saw negative comments about the breakfast before we went - again this was better than expected, good coffee, and fresh croissants .... I could go on! but surfice to say it compared VERY favourably to a lot of continental & beyond hotels. We are now retired and hope to spend more time visiting our beautiful city and most certainly the Central Park will be our first choice of hotel!!! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Central Park Hotel Bayswater”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. It has a medium size foyer. There is a large bar with sofas and armchairs. The rooms are comfortable and a good size but the bathrooms are small. the staff are very friendly and helpful. It is in a very quiet area with a bus stop around the corner for a short trip to Oxford St. Lots of restaurants within 500yds or so. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value for money”
Reviews.Author: mariaCyprus
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel from Eurostar`s site because of the very low prices and the good location (central london, near Oxford street). The hotel turned up to be better than we expected. The staff is very polite and friendly and helpful. The breakfast is not anything excited but remember: IT IS FREE! There was no cheese or salami but there were toasted bread, cofee, tea, rolls, croissants butter and marmalade. Also orange juice and water. For cooked english breakfast you had to pay 4 pounds. Because we had a baby with us the staff let us have our breakfast in the room, so we bought some cheese to make the breakfast better. The room was small but warm enough, plenty of light, it was clean, with cofee-tea making facilities, small fridge and TV. There was also a save deposit box. The bathroom was tiny but clean and new. One day we were upset because we lost in a bus some baby staff. The hotel manager paid a taxi to bring them back to us! We were very surprised and we appreciated it a lot. The hotel is next to queens wau stop, although it will be closed until May 2006, so we had to walk about 5 min to Lancaster Gate to get the subway. Some days we even walked until Oxford street (25 min).

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: Mimzoo
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Central Park Hotel just after Christmas. The room was dreary, grimy, and small. Our 2 daughters had a room next door, and it was the same way. My husband sat down in an arm chair and the arm fell off. My daughter went to take a shower and the shower head blew off. If it had hit her in the mouth or face, it would have been disastrous. We packed up and called the travel agent and received new accomodations at a different hotel - very clean and pleasant. The Central Park Hotel desk staff were belligerent and resentful. I can only say "Buyer Beware"

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
